column12: >Born and raised in Connecticut, I grew up in an environment where creativity and individuality were strongly encouraged. I realized at a young age that I wanted to create. After high school I decided to go to college for Graphic Design, but soon after concluded that my heart wasn’t in it. My dreams of being a designer were stifled only by the feeling that I might not have what it took. When my nails started to turn heads everywhere I went, I realized it was time to go for it. What did I have to lose? I started designing my own nails because I couldn’t find salons that were able to do what I wanted done. It is not exactly how I thought I would get started, I just kind of fell into it, but I am passionate about it. Nails, for me, had become my most important accessory when putting an outfit together. We ALL know how important accessories are. With that in mind I decided to acquire my certification in Nail Technology, and to develop my own line of hand painted nails. After premiering my first couple nail collections, I expanded my line to offer other handmade accessories.

column1: Dominique Reneé represents self expression, confidence, individuality, boldness, and truth.
I am inspired by the people, places and things that surround me
column2: adversities, prosperities, words, phrases, thoughts, feelings and emotions. I design to deliver messages, and to provoke thoughts and feelings. I design to inspire
column3: I design because it is what I was designed to do.
column7: >
column11: >Last week my team and I were invited out to Los Angeles, to take part in a gifting suite in honor of the 2014 BET AWARDS.
column18: >Participating in an event like this would mean that I would finally get the level of exposure I need to be able to work on my line full time. (It would basically be a dream come true!!!!)
column22: >In order for us to get there we need to raise $12,000! The money will be used for the cost of the sponsorship package, hotel and travel expenses, shipping costs, promotional and gifting material (business cards, flyers etc. and 120+ gifts), packaging, and display material.

column3: >Any contribution big or small will help to make this dream a reality!!
>If you are unable to donate just reposting and sharing my campaign with others would be a big help!!!

Alok &

column2:

The norm in fashion is for companies, in order to maximize profits and offer us low prices, to fire American workers, send jobs overseas, use pesticide cottons and heavy metal dyes that pollute drinking water sources &
column3: soil quality, and find countries where people are willing to work very long hours under unsafe working conditions. The clothing is cheap and the styles change often. That's called FAST Fashion.

column3: yoga studio, we'd feed 12 emergency meals via foodbanks across America. And to date, we've fed over 125,000 meals, which we think is pretty rad. And as of November 2012, we have been using only USA-based tailors and sustainable fabrics, but we learned that much of the organic cotton in America was still being send overseas to be spun into yarn and knit into fabric. column1: In exchange for your support, most of you will get a limited edition ""Wear The Change"" 100% organic limited edition T for project funders with the limited edition print and a custom hand-numbered and signed patch sewn on dedicated to Indiegogo supporters. At higher donation levels, there are definitely additional perks!
The impact of your support is profound.

column2: >You will help increase demand for farmers who grow cotton without pesticides.
>You will vote with your dollars for American jobs at every stage of production.
>You will help ensure there are quality jobs for future generations of Americans.
>You will help us feed 12 meals for each of these limited editions, which is the core of what Fed By Threads stands for.

column1: Even if things are financially tight for you, there are MANY ways you can help us support American jobs! Please consider:
• Posting the video and the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and your other social media platforms
• Tell 1-3 people about how rad what we are trying to do.
• Call a newspaper near you and tell them about what we are doing!
• Email some folks in your community you think would really dig what we are doing.
• Send us positive thoughts (we believe in the power of that)!
Our Family Has Everything on the line, so thank YOU for caring!
","Do you want to see jobs brought back to America from overseas?

Do you want to see stable economic growth in America that benefits the middle class?  Do you think drinking water & soil quality for growing are valuable for America? Alok & Jade, the co-founders of Fed By Threads, are going completely against the norms in fashion and taking their supply chain to new territory by teaming up with American organic cotton farmers, American yarn spinners, American fabric knitters, American fabric dyers, American fabric cutters, and American tailors to make a limited edition organic seed-to-garment USA-made t-shirt for you and fabrics that we can wholesale to others.

Ask yourself this: Where can you go to buy an organic T-shirt that you can trust was 100% grown, spun, knit, dyed, cut, & sewn inside America? The norm in fashion is for companies, in order to maximize profits and offer us low prices, to fire American workers, send jobs overseas, use pesticide cottons and heavy metal dyes that pollute drinking water sources & soil quality, and find countries where people are willing to work very long hours under unsafe working conditions. The clothing is cheap and the styles change often. That's called FAST Fashion.

Instead, Fed By Threads is part of The Slow Fashion Movement and is in position to make a limited-edition organic T for you and our other Indiegogo supporters that is made entirely seed-to-garment within America!

You see, we started Fed By Threads as a tiny idea to help feed some of the 50 million food-insecure Americans through: wed decided that every time we sell a T-shirt in our dance & yoga studio, we'd feed 12 emergency meals via foodbanks across America. And to date, we've fed over 125,000 meals, which we think is pretty rad. And as of November 2012, we have been using only USA-based tailors and sustainable fabrics, but we learned that much of the organic cotton in America was still being send overseas to be spun into yarn and knit into fabric. But this campaign will let us go to the next level.
What We Will Do With The Funds
We will buy at least 1,000 pounds of organic cotton that was grown in America, which we will have spun into yarn, knit into fabric, and dyed without heavy metals here in America.
We will then cut and sew the limited edition T's for Indiegogo supporters as well as begin to transition our upcoming clothing lines to this fabric.
Finally, we will begin to sell this fabric wholesale to other clothing manufacturers, designers, and craftspeople because we know how hard it is to find.

In exchange for your support, most of you will get a limited edition ""Wear The Change"" 100% organic limited edition T for project funders with the limited edition print and a custom hand-numbered and signed patch sewn on dedicated to Indiegogo supporters. At higher donation levels, there are definitely additional perks!
The impact of your support is profound.
You will help increase demand for farmers who grow cotton without pesticides.
You will vote with your dollars for American jobs at every stage of production.
You will help ensure there are quality jobs for future generations of Americans.
You will help us feed 12 meals for each of these limited editions, which is the core of what Fed By Threads stands for.
Even if things are financially tight for you, there are MANY ways you can help us support American jobs! Please consider:
Posting the video and the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and your other social media platforms
Tell 1-3 people about how rad what we are trying to do.
Call a newspaper near you and tell them about what we are doing!
Email some folks in your community you think would really dig what we are doing.
Send us positive thoughts (we believe in the power of that)!
Our Family Has Everything on the line, so thank YOU for caring!",4.0,0,"3 Campaigns

column7: >They say words have power and here at UpLyft Wear we not only agree with that, but we allow you to put your ""Power Words"" right on the front of your custom designed shirt for the world to see.

column1: Your favorite new shirt has a mission. Here at UpLyft Wear every shirt we make, and you help design, has a very special mission. To help you be a better you. To help you see the powerful you that sometimes gets lost in the day to day hustle and bustle of the world. Your favorite new shirt lets you show the world exactly what you stand for in no uncertain terms.

What is your Power Word? It's that word that resonates all the way to the center of your being. We all have them, and some of you have a few of them and each one states exactly who you are and how you are committed to changing the world.

On our website you will be able to design your own shirt. You choose your ""Power Word"" that will be printed on one side and a design of your choice for the other side. Each shirt is custom designed by you and individually printed by UpLyft Wear. At present there are 20 designs and over 50 words. Have a word that isn't on our list. You will be able to submit it and if our team agrees that it is uplifting we will be happy to print it for you with your chosen design.


Oh, and it's a top quality shirt made to last you for years because that's the way we believe things should be done. We will be adding additional shirt styles and designs as we grow so you can create a collection of ""Power Word"" shirts if you want.

Here at UpLyft Wear we are not just making clothing we are on a mission. We are on a mission to help change the world. And we will do it one shirt at a time by helping our clients share what they stand for with the world. By helping each and every client stand up and start a conversation with the world without even having to say a word, if they don't choose to. To shout out loud this is who I am and this is what I stand for while remaining silent. And we invite you to be part of this change. To be part of a world that is changing for the better.

We knew that Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. stood for EQUALITY.


We knew that John F. Kennedy stood for CHANGE.


We knew that Steve Jobs stood for INNOVATION.


They were on big stages and lived their lives showing what they stood for. What drove them. Not all of us live in that type of environment but each and every one of us can inspire change. Each and every one of us can stand up for what we believe in. We can stand up and show the world what drives us and how we are changing the world in our own way.


We all know people that live their deepest truths on a day by day basis. The teacher who must EDUCATE, the scientist who must DISCOVER, the gardener who must NURTURE, The entrepreneur who must CREATE , the medical professional who must HEAL. Many people build their careers around their power words, others their hobbies and lifestyles. But we all know when we are doing the things that let us share our souls. That is when we are truly living. 


What do you stand for? Compassion? Wisdom? Freedom? Connection?

column7:
>What gift do you already share?

We want you to share your gifts and help us change the world....one shirt at a time. And that will inspire one action at a time...and that is our way of helping to change this planet for the better.


""Be the change you want to see in the world"" - Mahatma Gandhi.

column1: Why do we need your help?

Although we have created samples and initial designs we now need to get products out there being worn and seen. We have manufacturing companies ready to go for initial production orders. We need to get samples to our marketing partners. We need to have our website completed which will allow our clients to design and then order their shirts. And most of all we need people out there wearing our shirts and sharing both our concept and their personal message with the world.


Our priority if we are only partially funded will be to get our website up and running and deliver all the promised premiums. We have a number of joint venture partners ready to start taking orders and spreading our message just as soon as our website is ready to take orders.


Later we will be doing another fundIng to actually bring all manufacturing in house allowing us to maintain the highest quality standards on each and every shirt we ship for you to wear.


Please look at the pledge options and even if you can't help financially help us by spreading the word through family, friends and social media and use the IndieGoGo share tools.


Thanks,

The UpLyft Team

Notes about Premiums: The ""Future Share Certificates"" will be based upon our goal to go public within the next 5 years. When we do go public (it is our goal but is in no way guaranteed) you may, if you choose to, redeem your certificate for the appropriate number of shares it has listed. We intend to make the ""Future Share Certificates"" nice enough to frame, should you just want to hold onto it and say ""I was involved at the very beginning when we started this movement"". The certificates themselves will hold no value until (and if) we go public. If and when we go public you will have a 2 year window during which you will be able to redeem your certificate.

All premiums that include a custom shirts as part of this Indie-Go-Go Campaign will be given a code that will be valid for 1 year after the website goes live with a value equal to the retail sales price of our highest priced introductory shirts style. Our reason in allowing you this extra time is that we intend to add several additional shirt styles over the first year and want to give people a wider variety of choices. If you choose to order from the initial styles expect delivery within 4-6 weeks from order date. Orders not placed within 1 year will need to contact our customer care department.

My name is Luciana, I'm a based fashion designer in Algarve, Portugal.

After a beach run I had a vision - How can we feel comfortable, have the sense of freedom and be fashionable at the same time?

column1: I spent the following days thinking
of a way in which could transport this experience into urban living and
communities and their way of living as a starting point.

Now you can  feel free, comfortable and fashionable  with O PADRAO bikinis, a revolutionary swimwear brand that responds to the need of comfort and aesthetics.

Women often loves a gorgeous and stand-out bikini, but most of the time they are uncomfortable. With O PADRAO no such thing happens. You can use and abuse it on your regular beach day or in summer sporting in or out the water.

What makes our bikini so different:

O PADRAO is not meant to
be just for surfers, or athletes , it is for each and every one who craves a
deep feeling of everyday freedom and simply wants to enjoy unforgettable moments

in or out of the water.

- They are made of NEOPRENE - yes, I know what you thinking ""isn't that the wetsuits material?"" - yes it is - in a thiner version - and because of it they'll give your body more support
column2: - Our Bottoms have a push-up effect due to our design, which was specially designed to accentuate and compliment the female figure
column3: - We have REVERSIBLE models, so you can mix and match our bikini tops with our bottoms in lots of different ways
column4:
- The bikini parts can be CUSTOMIZED with your real measures - you just have to send us a message after you contribute with the following measures: bra cup, bust, full waist line and full hip line.

 

What do we need and how can you help us!

- We need to increase our small inventory
column5:
- Spread the product to the World by updating our web-site into a very nice web-site and advertising to keep you tuned with our brand.

- If you really liked our product and want to be part of it's success, feel free to share...each one of you can make a huge difference so even if you feel you cannot contribute financially you can still help us by share it verbally and by email with your friends, family,and co-worker or like us on the social media platforms below.


Still interested ?

Check our product details, choose your favorite models and LETS PERK!!!

Each models is labeled with the correspondent perk - at your right you have the perk description - All you have to do is click CONTRIBUTE NOW - choose your perk and send us a message with the model color and size you have chosen.

Find above the Sizes available

column1: My name is Grace Cuffy. I am a 20 yr old aspiring Fashion Designer attending the Art Institute of Fashion Design. I am working toward graduation with my BA in March of 2012 but dreams dreams don't have due dates.The project i am working on is called the Annuaire de la Mode Fashion Show which pretty much means ""Fashion Yearbook"" in French. it's a modern presentation of a collection of the past decades. This Show is to present myself to the world as a designer with something to say. I want to change the way people look at fashion and make it accessible to everyone. I want to use the skills that I've learned to help people in the less fortunate Caribbean islands to have those same skills accessible right where they are.

I want to begin a program where i can travel to different schools among the islands (and hopefully around the world) every summer, to give kids and young adults who have the dream of designing, the tools to make it happen from their own homes. I want to share what i was taught with them so that they in turn can keep it going and help others in their own way.

In the fashion world what you see is what you get and in order to reach the necessary people i need to help me reach my goal i also need to get the necessary help to meet these people. With the donations i hope to receive from whoever is reading, i will be that much closer to being able to help those kids make their own dreams come true. So helping me in turn helps a lot more than initially intended. There's no better feeling than being a part of that.

column2: >My ultimate goal is to create a household brand that will benefit everyone and not just one type of person. I want to create clothing that will make people excited to get dressed to go anywhere, and feel good about themselves all the time. They shouldn't have to worry about saving up multiple paychecks to do so one garment at a time. Someone who doesn't care for a large wardrobe will look just as put together as someone who cant keep the same clothes in their closet for longer than 3 months.

>I want a percentage of profit to go towards giving kids and young adults coming up, an opportunity to better their skills without having to leave home. Being from a very small island and living on different islands, i understand the limitations that prevent kids from going far with what they love. i was very lucky to have a teacher who was very happy to take the time and share with me her expertise and show me how to evolve as a designer. i want to give that same opportunity to kids who aren't as lucky as i was. If i can get started with the right people,to eventually grow from design summits in high schools and colleges to actual facilities on different islands.In order to reach that goal i need readers to know that i'm here and i'm serious. This Fashion Show is my 1st step in that direction.

column1: <i>People work hard for their money and i know you would love to know where yours will be going. I am not trying to put on an Oscar-like show, but in order for people to take me seriously, the show needs to be well put together. I need to secure a venue complete with seating and a sound system to accommodate 50-75 people. I need to advertise and promote the show. I need to have a host for the duration of the show, as i cannot oversee my dream come true and host at the same time. Most importantly I will need 10 models if they will be changing
column2: 20 if they will only be wearing one look each.

>Why help? Did you mean besides free tickets for runway-side seats to the show for you and a friend to anyone who donates more than $200? And besides being mentioned in the special thanks/credits? Well, you'll have an opportunity to lend a helping hand in opening some very promising doors that will lead to an even bigger picture. And the feeling of helping someone make a difference in the lives of others is a never ending gift!

>Share, Share, and Share some more! I cannot do this alone, which is why you just read my story and Goal Impact (at least those two. If you haven't please do) Tell friends, family, colleagues, and take full advantage of the share buttons. Help me make this happen!

I want to begin a program where i can travel to different schools among the islands (and hopefully around the world) every summer, to give kids and young adults who have the dream of designing, the tools to make it happen from their own homes. I want to share what i was taught with them so that they in turn can keep it going and help others in their own way.

In the fashion world what you see is what you get and in order to reach the necessary people i need to help me reach my goal i also need to get the necessary help to meet these people. With the donations i hope to receive from whoever is reading, i will be that much closer to being able to help those kids make their own dreams come true. So helping me in turn helps a lot more than initially intended. There's no better feeling than being a part of that.

My ultimate goal is to create a household brand that will benefit everyone and not just one type of person. I want to create clothing that will make people excited to get dressed to go anywhere, and feel good about themselves all the time. They shouldn't have to worry about saving up multiple paychecks to do so one garment at a time. Someone who doesn't care for a large wardrobe will look just as put together as someone who cant keep the same clothes in their closet for longer than 3 months.

I want a percentage of profit to go towards giving kids and young adults coming up, an opportunity to better their skills without having to leave home. Being from a very small island and living on different islands, i understand the limitations that prevent kids from going far with what they love. i was very lucky to have a teacher who was very happy to take the time and share with me her expertise and show me how to evolve as a designer. i want to give that same opportunity to kids who aren't as lucky as i was. If i can get started with the right people,to eventually grow from design summits in high schools and colleges to actual facilities on different islands.In order to reach that goal i need readers to know that i'm here and i'm serious. This Fashion Show is my 1st step in that direction.
What We Need & What You Get

People work hard for their money and i know you would love to know where yours will be going. I am not trying to put on an Oscar-like show, but in order for people to take me seriously, the show needs to be well put together. I need to secure a venue complete with seating and a sound system to accommodate 50-75 people. I need to advertise and promote the show. I need to have a host for the duration of the show, as i cannot oversee my dream come true and host at the same time. Most importantly I will need 10 models if they will be changing
column2: 20 if they will only be wearing one look each.

column1: Why help? Did you mean besides free tickets for runway-side seats to the show for you and a friend to anyone who donates more than $200? And besides being mentioned in the special thanks/credits? Well, you'll have an opportunity to lend a helping hand in opening some very promising doors that will lead to an even bigger picture. And the feeling of helping someone make a difference in the lives of others is a never ending gift!

Share, Share, and Share some more! I cannot do this alone, which is why you just read my story and Goal Impact (at least those two. If you haven't please do) Tell friends, family, colleagues, and take full advantage of the share buttons. Help me make this happen!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"

Let's challenge modern day culture's influence on women and their physical appearance. 

-

Who We Are / The Goal Behind Ruth Vintage

My name is Taylor, currently a student and barista located in Houston, Texas I have a passion for creativity, love, and anything vintage. Being a girl within today's culture, there is a constant pressure to look and dress a certain way
column2:
the pressure to give in to the trends of media, magazines, and celebrities. My goal is to open an online, vintage shop to inspire women to stand up against the modern day image of beauty. Not only do I want women to be encouraged, but I want them to realize their value is not simply in their clothes but in their character.

I desire Ruth Vintage to be a store that promotes the value of a women's character, power, and knowledge, and not simply focus on sexuality and physicality to define her. Counter-active to today's culture, I want to ladies to be empowered by who they are and not what the media tells them they are. 

The help of contributors is incredibly important. Not only will your help provide the funds for registering Ruth Vintage, business costs, and finding quality vintage clothing for ladies, it will also spread the word of our women's value and their incredible beauty. Your contributions will be the foundation of this business, and the beginning of a statement against our modern-day trends.

What We Need

With the goal of $850 in mind, your generous contributions and funding will go to:

column1: • Buying quality, vintage clothing and accessories for women
• Registering Ruth Vintage as a Texas business
• Getting a foothold in the small business world to begin making an impact on ladies

How Are You Impacting?

By making this dream come true, you are pushing another step towards encouraging women in their value, their beauty, and creating a mindset that encourages women to see past media's pressure on the idea that 'sex sells.' Not only are you impacting women, but you are also impacting teens and young ladies by reminding them of their inner beauty, while providing them with a way to dress in a way that is in style and flattering.

I believe this is an incredible way to just love ladies! Not only will they be able to fit in with current trends in fashion, but they will receive a message that goes far beyond 'physical' and encourages their character and idea of self-worth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? We still need your help:
• Help us advertise! Show other's this goal and encourage them to contribute and spread the word about Ruth Vintage
• Use Indiegogo's share tools to share this campaign on social media
• And of course, encouragement! Kind words are always appreciated.

Help me make this dream and focus a reality. Do it for the ladies.

column1: ","Hi! My name is Christopher Palu and I was a finalist on Season 10 of Project Runway and Season 3 of Project Runway Allstars.
I am starting this INDIEGOGO campaign to start my own brand.

During my time on Project Runway I had several garments produced and sold for The Rockettes, Lord and Taylor and Babies”R”Us.Since the competition I have grown immensely as a designer and I'm ready to take the next step!
I am in the finishing stages of my Spring 2015 Collection
column2: the line featured in my Indiegogo video. I am very excited to announce that I will be showing this collection in Austin, Texas on Sept 18th!

column1: This brand is an ode to the empowered woman. My overall aesthetic is marrying hard and soft elements
column2: specifically using contrasting fabrics, textures and silhouettes.

column1: With the images from the photo shoot, I will create a look book enabling me to present this collection to luxury boutiques and department stores.

In creating my Spring line I have built the momentum to move forward, however I can not do this without your help!The INDIEGOGO proceeds will finance production for this collection. The entire line will be available for pre-order and individual purchase on my website. This campaign will also create a budget for my Fall 2015 collection.
This is the platform to start my own business and is only possible through your donations and efforts... And for that I am beyond grateful!
I hope you can help me in taking this next step. If you are unable to donate please help by spreading the word through social media or word of mouth. Any efforts made are greatly appreciated!!!
Remember to follow me for updates and special shout-outs!
And don’t forget to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!

Thank you! :)Christopher PERK#3Receive a unisex Christopher Palu New York logo crew neck t-shirt. (Available in: Small, Medium and Large).PERK#4Receive a Christopher Palu New York logo canvas tote!",13.0,0,"1 Campaign

With a design philosophy that marries style with accessibility, CoWatch packs next-level features, while being one of the most affordable smartwatches on the market. As the world's first smartwatch to integrate Alexa, Amazon's advanced voice-recognition software, CoWatch is your perfect companion into the future.
column3: >Take the leap with the next generation of smartwatch technology.

column4: theater"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Click here to see a full size comparison chart
column5: >

column1: Speak, and CoWatch will listen. With a built in dynamic speaker - and as the first smartwatch to integrate Alexa, Amazon's cloud-based voice service, you can ask for a traffic report, control connected devices, make a phone call to a friend, order a taxi to your home, pay your bills, and so much more. As long as your CoWatch is connected to a WiFI network or to your phone with a data connection, Alexa will be on!

column2:
>

Your smart home is at your fingertips. The power of Bluetooth 4.1 and cloud connectivity lets you dim the lights, check on your car, turn up the heat, and interact with the devices, products, and services that matter to you most.

column1: Friends encourage friends to stay healthy. Be proactive and let CoWatch sweat the small stuff. CoWatch can track your calories burned, count your steps, even monitor your heart rate after and during a workout. Using a nine-axis accelerometer, digital compass and gyroscope, as well as heart rate sensor and vibro motor, CoWatch can help you keep track of every move.

Maximize efficiency and connect with a simple touch. Send a quick response through text message, check your emails, review your calls on your phone, connect to your favourite streaming service, and turn on your favourite song - CoWatch can do it all.

CoWatch unites classic watch design with state of the art technology. Elegantly constructed and at a price point that competes with other luxury brands, you have a choice between carbon black or mineral silver stainless steel, with a fracture-resistant zirconia composite ceramic body for excellent wireless signal (2.4G 802.11 b/g/n). The vivid super AMOLED 400 x 400 high-resolution touch screen has an interchangeable and reactive watch face, catering to your mood, experience, and look, from day to night.

column4: >Hand pick the watch face that matches your mood. Professional? Minimalist? Fun? We've created a variety of watch faces to choose from that anyone can enjoy. Switch on the fly and be  ready to pair with any ensemble or occasion.

column1: The design of CoWatch's software and hardware architectures were carefully synchronized with Cronologics, a software platform built to deliver a precise next generation smartwatch experience. The essentials, and then some - app developers will also soon have an opportunity to get involved to build a unique experience on every CoWatch.

iOS? Android? You're covered. CoWatch is designed to improve, not complicate your experience. CoWatch compliments your favourite mobile device, carefully passing information back and forth to save you time. CoWatch is compatible with both iOS (9.0 and above) and Android (5.0 and above).

With a platform that competes in a class of its own, including an industry leading internal processing capability (1.2GHz), the cherry on top is the CoWatch is one of the first smart watches with 8GB of memory to guarantee unmatched performance.

With up to 32 hours of battery life in an always-on mode, CoWatch works as hard as you do - from dusk 'til dawn. Connect directly to the magnetic charging cradle and within one hour, you'll be guaranteed up to 70% battery capacity, working as fast and efficiently as your CoWatch.

column2: >

column1: We at iMCO and Cronologics have worked tirelessly over the past year and a half to bring the CoWatch to life. Our desire has always been to create a smartwatch that's not only high-quality, but affordable and accessible to everyone. We’re ecstatic to have achieved our goals with the CoWatch!

Production is already underway with our first 800 watches - most of which will be shipped to our early adopters within 4 weeks of the end of this campaign by the end of June! All remaining supporters can expect to receive their CoWatch by late Summer / Early Fall.

Early supporters will also have exclusive access to production updates, and exclusive pricing on any additional perks and accessories that roll out during the campaign. Mass production will continue throughout the campaign cycle to fulfill all Indiegogo orders and beyond.

column2: >The time is NOW to join the smartwatch revolution - with CoWatch by your side!

column1: Yes - it's water/splash resistant, though it shouldn't be submerged intentionally!

column2: >I have small wrists, can I still wear the  CoWatch?

column1: Yes! The adjustable clasp means the CoWatch can fit everyone.
The band is a standardized 22mm watch band.

column2: >Can I change the watch straps easily?

column1: Yes - all watch packaging will come with an easy-to-use clasp adjuster allowing you to change the straps quickly and easily.

column2: >Will the CoWatch be available in any other colors?

column1: Right now there are no plans to deviate from carbon black and mineral silver cases, however coloured stainless steel and leather bands allow you to customize the watch further.
Yes, your CoWatch will arrive with a easy-to-read manual with step-by-step details on how to set up.
How do I choose the color of my CoWatch?
Once the campaign has been completed, we'll be in touch to help you choose your color - choosing between Carbon Black and Mineral Silver.

column3: >I already purchased a CoWatch - can I choose between the Leather Band or the Stainless Steel band during fulfilment?

column1: Yes! Upon fulfillment, we'll be in touch so you can choose between the Stainless Steel (Carbon Black, Mineral Silver) or the Leather (Ink Black, Dark Coffee, Charcoal Gray) watch band.
All consumers will have a 1 year limited
warranty on parts and labor. Shipping and delivery cost is to be paid by the end user.
At this time, CoWatch supports iOS and Android.

column2: >At this time, CoWatch is not NFC compatible.

column3: >Is CoWatch available to pre-order anywhere else online?

column2: >We're only on Indiegogo! We're currently on the lookout for distributors - but if you see any other websites with our product online, they're not the real deal.

column1: The first 800 cowatches will be shipped in June 2016. Orders after that point will be shipped in July 2016 and after.

column2: >What if my CoWatch is broken during shipping or has defects at arrival - can I send it back?

column1: CoWatch offers a 1-year limited manufacturer warranty. With repair centers in North America and Asia, we will ensure your product is taken care of quickly. Free shipping is provided to and from the repair center within 30 days from the date your product is received.

column2: >How can I pay for my order?

column1: Indiegogo accepts Paypal and credit card payments online from Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, and Discover.
Depending on where you are located shipping costs will vary. Shipping costs range from a flat rate of $10 USD in USA, Canada, and China, to $25 USD internationally.
Email us at support@imcotech.co!

As the world's first smartwatch to integrate Alexa, Amazon's advanced voice-recognition software, CoWatch is your perfect companion into the future.Take the leap with the next generation of smartwatch technology.

Speak, and CoWatch will listen. With a built in dynamic speaker - and as the first smartwatch to integrate Alexa, Amazon's cloud-based voice service, you can ask for a traffic report, control connected devices, make a phone call to a friend, order a taxi to your home, pay your bills, and so much more. As long as your CoWatch is connected to a WiFI network or to your phone with a data connection, Alexa will be on!

Your smart home is at your fingertips. The power of Bluetooth 4.1 and cloud connectivity lets you dim the lights, check on your car, turn up the heat, and interact with the devices, products, and services that matter to you most.

Friends encourage friends to stay healthy. Be proactive and let CoWatch sweat the small stuff. CoWatch can track your calories burned, count your steps, even monitor your heart rate after and during a workout. Using a nine-axis accelerometer, digital compass and gyroscope, as well as heart rate sensor and vibro motor, CoWatch can help you keep track of every move.

Maximize efficiency and connect with a simple touch. Send a quick response through text message, check your emails, review your calls on your phone, connect to your favourite streaming service, and turn on your favourite song - CoWatch can do it all.

CoWatch unites classic watch design with state of the art technology. Elegantly constructed and at a price point that competes with other luxury brands, you have a choice between carbon black or mineral silver stainless steel, with a fracture-resistant zirconia composite ceramic body for excellent wireless signal (2.4G 802.11 b/g/n). The vivid super AMOLED 400 x 400 high-resolution touch screen has an interchangeable and reactive watch face, catering to your mood, experience, and look, from day to night.

Hand pick the watch face that matches your mood. Professional? Minimalist? Fun? We've created a variety of watch faces to choose from that anyone can enjoy. Switch on the fly and be  ready to pair with any ensemble or occasion.

The design of CoWatch's software and hardware architectures were carefully synchronized with Cronologics, a software platform built to deliver a precise next generation smartwatch experience. The essentials, and then some - app developers will also soon have an opportunity to get involved to build a unique experience on every CoWatch.

iOS? Android? You're covered. CoWatch is designed to improve, not complicate your experience. CoWatch compliments your favourite mobile device, carefully passing information back and forth to save you time. CoWatch is compatible with both iOS (9.0 and above) and Android (5.0 and above).

With a platform that competes in a class of its own, including an industry leading internal processing capability (1.2GHz), the cherry on top is the CoWatch is one of the first smart watches with 8GB of memory to guarantee unmatched performance.

With up to 32 hours of battery life in an always-on mode, CoWatch works as hard as you do - from dusk 'til dawn. Connect directly to the magnetic charging cradle and within one hour, you'll be guaranteed up to 70% battery capacity, working as fast and efficiently as your CoWatch.

We at iMCO and Cronologics have worked tirelessly over the past year and a half to bring the CoWatch to life. Our desire has always been to create a smartwatch that's not only high-quality, but affordable and accessible to everyone. We’re ecstatic to have achieved our goals with the CoWatch!

Production is already underway with our first 800 watches - most of which will be shipped to our early adopters within 4 weeks of the end of this campaign by the end of June! All remaining supporters can expect to receive their CoWatch by late Summer / Early Fall.

Early supporters will also have exclusive access to production updates, and exclusive pricing on any additional perks and accessories that roll out during the campaign. Mass production will continue throughout the campaign cycle to fulfill all Indiegogo orders and beyond.
The time is NOW to join the smartwatch revolution - with CoWatch by your side!
Yes - it's water/splash resistant, though it shouldn't be submerged intentionally!
I have small wrists, can I still wear the  CoWatch?
Yes! The adjustable clasp means the CoWatch can fit everyone.
The band is a standardized 22mm watch band.
Can I change the watch straps easily?
Yes - all watch packaging will come with an easy-to-use clasp adjuster allowing you to change the straps quickly and easily.
Will the CoWatch be available in any other colors?
Right now there are no plans to deviate from carbon black and mineral silver cases, however coloured stainless steel and leather bands allow you to customize the watch further.
Is setting up my CoWatch easy?
Yes, your CoWatch will arrive with a easy-to-read manual with step-by-step details on how to set up.
How do I choose the color of my CoWatch?
Once the campaign has been completed, we'll be in touch to help you choose your color - choosing between Carbon Black and Mineral Silver.
I already purchased a CoWatch - can I choose between the Leather Band or the Stainless Steel band during fulfilment?
Yes! Upon fulfillment, we'll be in touch so you can choose between the Stainless Steel (Carbon Black, Mineral Silver) or the Leather (Ink Black, Dark Coffee, Charcoal Gray) watch band.
All consumers will have a 1 year limited
warranty on parts and labor. Shipping and delivery cost is to be paid by the end user.
At this time, CoWatch supports iOS and Android.
At this time, CoWatch is not NFC compatible.
Is CoWatch available to pre-order anywhere else online?
We're only on Indiegogo! We're currently on the lookout for distributors - but if you see any other websites with our product online, they're not the real deal.
When will I get my CoWatch?
The first 800 cowatches will be shipped in June 2016. Orders after that point will be shipped in July 2016 and after.
What if my CoWatch is broken during shipping or has defects at arrival - can I send it back?

CoWatch offers a 1-year limited manufacturer warranty. With repair centers in North America and Asia, we will ensure your product is taken care of quickly. Free shipping is provided to and from the repair center within 30 days from the date your product is received.
How can I pay for my order?
Indiegogo accepts Paypal and credit card payments online from Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, and Discover.
Depending on where you are located shipping costs will vary. Shipping costs range from a flat rate of $10 USD in USA, Canada, and China, to $25 USD internationally.

After winning a silver medal at the 2009 World Ball Hockey Championships in Pilsen, Czech Republic, Team India is ready to return to the podium and strike gold at the 2015 World Ball Hockey Championships in Zug, Switzerland.

We are requesting your kind consideration to support our program which allows top level young athletes to participate in world class tournaments regardless of their financial circumstances. A tournament of this magnitude can be quite costly especially for younger players that are still going to school and we need help from community businesses like yours to help cover the costs of airfare, accommodations, uniforms, training camps, and medical staff.

This is an excellent opportunity for some of our younger, elite athletes, to experience a world class tournament and represent their Country in hopes to carry the program further in the future. With your help we can ensure a bright and positive future for these young players and for Ball Hockey in Canada and India.

Thank You.

'The Socks no.1513' is made from the ""Organic cotton"" produced by minimizing the chemical process and the ""Copper(CU)"", the only metal that can remove up to 99.9% of the bacteria in the fiber.
Our feet consist of 30 joints, 52 bones, and 19 muscles. And we walk an average of 5,000 steps a day and about 62,000 miles over our lifetime.
As such, our feet have long been the center of our body rhythms, a so called ""second heart"", and we have a duty to make sure our feet are pleasant and clean.
Copper(CU) ion of 'The Socks no.1513' destroys the cell structure of the microorganism and strongly suppresses the propagation of bacteria.
'The Socks no.1513' excellent antimicrobial ability by inhibiting the frowth of gerems is basically blocked the odor from bacterial feces.

In August 2010, a Chilean mine collapsed and 33 miners were trapped. The miners were all dramatically alive after 69 days, but what happened in the mine for about two months? The miners lived with the help of government and people, supplied for the food, medicines, etc. necessary for survival.

However, due to the heat and the humid environment, their feet began to develop fungal diseases such as athlete's foot.Initially, they treated their feet with antifungal ointment. But when it was not possible to cure it, they replaced the treatment with the socks containing   ""copper"". They reported by the JAMA Network that after two weeks of wearing copper socks, nearly 90% of the cases had improved symptoms.

""Overall, their skin condition, especially on their feet…were extremely good despite 69 days of exposure to an environment that promoted the growth of skin-damaging microbes,"" the researchers wrote in their report.

The free warranty service lasts for one year after receiving socks. If you feel uncomfortable or have a problem with socks after wearing socks, please contact us by email. And we will replace them for you as soon as possible. In some cases, we may charge you about the shipping cost we send you.(approximately $3~$5)
'The Socks no.1513' started from thinking about how we could treat our feet better, and was made through a total of 1,513 times sampling operations.

We have found that functional socks are made in uniformed designs and achromatic colors only. So we tried to make functional socks that can be worn anywhere anytime. We will be very happy if this sock can help you a little bit in your life.
","'The Socks no.1513' is made from the ""Organic cotton"" produced by minimizing the chemical process and the ""Copper(CU)"", the only metal that can remove up to 99.9% of the bacteria in the fiber.
Our feet consist of 30 joints, 52 bones, and 19 muscles. And we walk an average of 5,000 steps a day and about 62,000 miles over our lifetime.
As such, our feet have long been the center of our body rhythms, a so called ""second heart"", and we have a duty to make sure our feet are pleasant and clean.
Copper(CU) ion of 'The Socks no.1513' destroys the cell structure of the microorganism and strongly suppresses the propagation of bacteria.
'The Socks no.1513' excellent antimicrobial ability by inhibiting the frowth of gerems is basically blocked the odor from bacterial feces.

In August 2010, a Chilean mine collapsed and 33 miners were trapped. The miners were all dramatically alive after 69 days, but what happened in the mine for about two months? The miners lived with the help of government and people, supplied for the food, medicines, etc. necessary for survival.

However, due to the heat and the humid environment, their feet began to develop fungal diseases such as athlete's foot.Initially, they treated their feet with antifungal ointment. But when it was not possible to cure it, they replaced the treatment with the socks containing   ""copper"". They reported by the JAMA Network that after two weeks of wearing copper socks, nearly 90% of the cases had improved symptoms.

""Overall, their skin condition, especially on their feet…were extremely good despite 69 days of exposure to an environment that promoted the growth of skin-damaging microbes,"" the researchers wrote in their report.

The free warranty service lasts for one year after receiving socks. If you feel uncomfortable or have a problem with socks after wearing socks, please contact us by email. And we will replace them for you as soon as possible. In some cases, we may charge you about the shipping cost we send you.(approximately $3~$5)

column1: Our mission is simple for every garment SOLD we will DONATE a garment to help someone in need. Our focus is and always will be to make great products. We believe everyone has the right to clean undergarments.
Our products will be sold online that will ship directly to you! We offer two collection series. These are the Elevate series and the Classic series.

The Elevate series is a graphic based collection  inspired by Visionary artists that add an unqiue appeal. We will be working with many artist to always bring something fresh and exciting. The fabric used is 95% polyester/blend and 5% spandex. It is made to absorb sweat and not attract bacteria. They are light weight with a wide tagless waist band and a 7 inch inseam that keeps them from rolling up.

The Classic series: This style is 95% cotton and 5% spandex. We offer 3 solid colors. This style includes a soft  tagless waist band that keeps them from blowing out and rolling up. The design has a 7 inch inseam.

Socks and T-shirts:Our socks aren’t just regular socks! don’t you love when you get a new pair of socks and they get holes with in a few days, Or you wash them and they feel like sand paper on your feet. Our socks are meant for everyday wear and tear. They are made with pima cotton and a polyester blend for optimal comfort,you can wear them with a suit or casually with your sneakers in the park.We offer solid color socks in our classic series and graphic inspired socks in our elevate series.

Classic T-shirts: Do you like to wear your t-shirts under your clothes during your work day?Do you like to relax and wear your t-shirt around the house on your days off? Our tag less Unisex shirts are a Hybrid between a undershirt and everyday t-shirt. We use a heavy blended cotton that’s extremely soft.Premium details gives them a great feel so you can wear them on their own.These shirts are only offered in 3 solid colors no graphics.
classic shirt: light grey womens

Domestic shipping is always free! International shipping charges do apply, our current shipping rate is $10  to Canada, and $10-$20.00 for the rest of the World. Please note, international shipping may take a little longer to arrive, and each countries customs processes do apply and are out of our control. Returns/Exchanges. At the end of this campaign, you'll get to choose your sizing for each item. After you receive your first package, if any piece doesn't fit, we'll send you the correct size and exchange FREE of charge, and update your profile for the future. We'll make sure we get it right. Size Guide. Our shirts are a standard slim fit, They're normal. The boxer briefs are a trunk shape, they fit well and will keep your front package nice and comfy. Socks are a standard US mens size 8-12. NOTE: Sizing will be collected after this campaign ends. We will send out a survey for you to indicate sizes

We know that the less fortunate do not have the luxury of changing underwear every day. We have  put together a dedicated package for those in need. The package will include black or  grey  socks and a black or grey boxer . The fabric is processed through a  antimicrobial treatment, giving the garment ability to resist the growth of molds, fungi, and other bacterias ,

10k: We will release another color-way that you the backers will get to choose! 15k: We will send out a survey allowing backers to submit a pattern or design they would like elenex to produce. You, the backers, will get to select the best design and the winner will receive free boxers &
column2: socks for a year! We also would like to expand into making garments for women and  kids.

column1: September- funds are received and   Full production starts, we will work closely with our manufacturer To make sure everything is going smoothly and everything is scheduled for on time delivery.

October – 2nd week the Early Bird specials ship to the first 50 backers and the rest of the orders will follow, We will ship all orders out in phases but we will work hard to make sure everyone gets there Elenex garments quickly.

After a worldwide journey searching for the best premium fabrics , we started looking for the best cutters and sewers . Today we work with a top fabric mill in Asia, a Xiamen facility for cutting, sewing, and packaging, and local factories and cutters right here in Southern California. Our facilities are some the best in the apparel industry, And what’s most important is their hiring practices and employee fulfilment programs ensure workers get treated with the respect, fairness, and opportunity they deserve. They’re our kind of people that believe in our vision and mission and were happy to partner with them.

We use Pima cotton for our classic series,Pima otherwise known as Extra Long Staple (ELS) cotton, is a premium fiber that can be up to 40% stronger than basic upland cotton. Pima cotton became very popluar years ago when designers started discovering its softness yet durability. Its drapeability and flexibility lends itself to a wide variety of uses including fine knitwear.

There is no replacement for a Great community like indiegogo. Although we could've launched these products via our website, we are all about community and making personal relationships. Indiegogo is a great way to build community with our backers, complementing our production run with the inclusion of  indiegogo backers was a great way to introduce Elenex to the world.

We have been involved in the textile industry for over 10 years, We have great relationships with our manufacturers and production team.We have received many samples with all details and requests added.We have worked closely with our suppliers to insure the best quality with on time delivery. With manufacturing being made abroad there is always a chance for delays in production,If there are any delays or unforeseen issues we will keep our backers informed via updates.

Wear the change you want to see

We are building much more than an ethical clothing brand. We are leading the way to weave philanthropy into business. The Fabric is a first-of-a-kind altruistic shopping experience, and this is how it works.

Choose your item
The Perks in this campaign are full of empowering stories in the making.

Pick your project
Your options include grassroots initiatives and organizations that bring your projects to life in the community your garment comes from.

See the change
We keep you updated on your impact on the ground through our blog, newsletter and social media.

New to crowdfunding?
Start by choosing what Perk you like best or choose the Pack of 3 or 5. Indiegogo will take you through their payment process. At the end of the campaign, we will send you a questionnaire asking about the specifics of your Perk, like size, colour and the community project you'd like to support.

We are bringing you Perks from Nepal, India and Colombia. These products have amazing stories in the making, ready for you to read a little further below. For now, here is our line up of Perks – all of which are, of course, ethically made.
• Made ethically by survivors of abuse, exploitation and discrimination
• Made of 95% rayon from bamboo, 5% spandex jersey
• Longer body length with a high-low curved hemline
• Made ethically by survivors of abuse, exploitation and discrimination
• Henley buttons are hand-carved from water buffalo horn
• Made of 100% chemical free, GOTS certified organic Indian-grown cotton
• Mother of pearl buttons, buttoned side vents and tabbed sleeves
• Made of 100% chemical free, GOTS certified organic Indian-grown cotton
• Traditionally block printed accents by hand and with mother of pearl buttons
• Screen printed with the story of the Makers

We visit every community under our umbrella. By observing and experiencing daily life, we inform ourselves to select the community projects that give you the opportunity to have a disproportionate philanthropic impact.
Let us tell you the stories behind our Perks from these three communities:

Nepal is famous for its mountains, topping the world at 8,850m at the summit of Everest. Yet everything else operates at a much lower level. Nepal is the second poorest country in Asia after Afghanistan, and a high percentage of its population is vulnerable to human exploitation.

The Bryants and Fabers are Westerners who have found their home and purpose in Nepal. They are the leaders of Purnaa, a manufacturer with a mission to empower those most marginalized by society to fresh starts and fulfilled lives. The employees, often survivors of abuse and human exploitation, receive fair and living wages, literacy classes and job and life-skills training. Uncustomary for Nepal, employees also receive a healthcare and employer-matched savings package. A
column3: >ll of Purnaa's profits are reinvested to further their mission.

column1: Read more of The Makers in Kathmandu, Nepal here.

Nepal is the second poorest country in Asia. That is not without a long list of reasons. The specter of its 10-year civil war that ended in 2006, the political instability that ensued, ongoing rampant corruption, difficult access to markets (exemplified by the 5-month blockade at its border with India earlier this year), make an environment that is barely conductive to business and investment.
And that is without considering the devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake the country suffered on April 25th, 2015, that levelled almost half a million homes and affected 5.6 milion people.

It is no surprise then that 1 in 5 Nepalis have left the country to find work abroad, often in situations that make them extremely vulnerable to abuse, exploitation and bonded labour. For those that remain, opportunities are few and far between. The average worker makes less than $4/day and unemployment is above 40%. Human exploitation, including sex trafficking, exists within its borders and, while pervasive, especially affects lower castes, people living with disease, certain religious groups and women — who are often treated as second-class humans.

We were particularly disturbed to learn that Nepal is a major source of children subjected to sex trafficking. UNICEF estimates that 7,000 women and girls are trafficked to India alone every year. It is not uncommon for parents to regard “extra” children, particularly girls, as a liability. In some cases, parents sell their children. More commonly, parents or children are lured to “big city” opportunities that inevitably end under lock in brothels in cities like Kathmandu, Kolkata, Delhi or Mumbai.
Jaipur is the capital city of Rajasthan. Home to 6.6 milion people, it is a popular tourist destination with a strong tradition in textiles – above all, block printing.

Shari Keller is an American who has found her second home in India. She holds a PhD in anthropology and, as Fulbright scholar, undertook research in the slums of Hyderabad for a year. In short, she has direct and extensive experience of the difficult reality of the destitute in the country she first visited in 1975.

It is very telling, therefore, that Shari has chosen to found a clothing social enterprise in Jaipur, as a way to make a living and contribute to the community. Entering Mehera Shaw’s facilities, the collegial atmosphere quickly denotes this company’s true socially conscious culture – a lingering feeling that goes over and above her Fairtrade certification hung on the office wall. In fact, the staff, hired regardless of caste and economic background, are Shari’s extended family.

Jaipur, like the rest of India, is a difficult destination for any first-timer Westerner traveller. It is difficult to assimilate the misery of families living under bridges in cardboard boxes and seeing destitute children eat out of the garbage while life, overcrowded and drowned in the noise of seemingly chaotic traffic, goes on all around.

Rajasthan is home to a strong heritage in artisan industry such as jewelry and textiles. In the garment industry, it is particularly known for its traditional block printing. Carvers repeatedly hammer nails as chisels on a block of wood, slowly creating intricate patterns that can take up to two days of labour to complete. These are then charged with garment dye and carefully placed on extended fabrics to create Rajasthani traditionally artisan fabrics. The whole process is part of our human heritage to be preserved.

Growth, however, is in tourism. The Pink City of India is well-known to foreigners as it is home to the Amber Fort and Hawa Mahal among its many sights – all part of the golden triangle tourist routeI. Tourism provides opportunities to individuals and families from elsewhere in the Rajasthani region and is a big draw for internal migration – adults and children who upon arriving to Jaipur typically settle by under the bridges around the train station. There is a clear need to provide opportunities to disadvantaged individuals and families, regardless of background and caste.

Tadó is a small town in Chocó, Colombia’s poorest region in the Pacific rainforest. The National Liberation Army (ELN), a Marxist guerrilla, continues to wrestle with state forces in one of the last active areas of Colombia’s armed conflict.

Beatriz is a good example of what is untrue in the usual poor and lazy stereotypical portrait of the people of Chocó. She is full of energy and strives to make things better around her. She is the director of La Platina, a dance group designed to keep the local folkloric heritage alive and, at the same time, offer a positive pastime to youth that would otherwise be in danger. For years, she has sewn the dance group’s costumes.

Astrid’s eyes light up when she tells the story of her first times behind her mother’s sewing machine as a child. She was not allowed to touch it, lest she break it. In hiding, she would use any opportunity to have a go at the machine. One time the needle went through her nail and, in fear of being found out, she did not utter a sound. That's passion.

Alexander is a professional tailor. He does not have children of his own but is proud to support his extended family. Not a small feat for a physically handicapped individual in this part of the world. And it is proof that sewing is, in his own words, “my destiny”.

Silvia’s story is the most touching. Raised by an aunt who did not want her niece to do better than her own children, Silvia was held back from school. She married, and the story repeated itself: the husband restricted her to the house in his need to fill in the shoes of breadwinner. Unable to cope with the role, the husband shot himself in the living room in front of their children. Silvia was left with no education, no skills and three children to care for, the youngest just a baby. With Beatriz’s support along with that of the community, she “empirically” learned the clothes-making trade and, not short of pain and strife, over the years she has been able to put food on the table, a roof over their heads and put her eldest through university. Her youngest is doing well in school at 15. It is not all rosy: her middle child is an alcoholic at 18. But her story is a tremendous inspiration to overcoming obstacles.

Tadó is a town of some 10,000 people nested in the thick of the Pacific rainforest and almost exclusively populated by black decedents of former slaves. Until recently, the lack of decent roads kept this town relatively isolated, which is evident in the apparent slow pace of life as people great each other incessantly. But the slow pace is also an ingrained consequence of the lack of jobs. There are no official figures, but we were told that maybe 35% of people have employment. The town traditionally made do sifting for gold, a back-breaking but sustainable lifestyle. However, more recently, outsiders with machinery offered the locals to do the work in exchange of a minimal proportion of the exploit. And exploit they did. They left the overturned soil barren and polluted the pristine rivers with diesel and mercury.

Today, the gold is gone and the town is paying a heavy price, not only environmentally but also socially as the gold rush brought drugs, prostitution and, most notably, the guerillas. For the National Liberation Army (ELN, in Spanish) is present and active in the area. Tadosanos refer to their security situation as the “public order issue”. The ELN often kidnaps Tadosanos for ransom, has laid out mines in the outskirts and even bombed the local police station in late 2014. The military and special forces are since involved in what can be described as a low-intensity conflict zone. It should not be a surprise that this town is out-of-bounds according to US, Canadian and UK official travel advisories.
The Fabric of Humanity is a team of three. Nahuel is our visionary
column2: an avid traveller as well as an economist and business consultant, he was the first to understand the profound impact that clothing can have to connect us to the human stories of the makers and to bring about opportunities in the places where they live. Wendy is our know-how girl, with 30+ years of detailed industry experience including product development, manufacturing and technical skill building. Mauricio is our storyteller with 15+ years of videography and documentary-making experience around the world. So, from us to you: Hello!

column1: This campaign comes at a key moment for us. The funds we raise will allow us to undertake two equally important tasks.

• Deliver, for the first time, on the projects you pick. This will allow us to tell the stories of people and communities that you actually change for the better with our clothing. A living proof that The Fabric walks the walk. We are looking forward to building on the links we established with grassroots groups and community organizations in India and Nepal - and learn from the experience so that we can better roll out projects in other communities in the future.

• Grow. Grow. Grow. Our first crowdfunding campaign was a successful test of concept. We have delivered on what we committed ourselves to and then some more. Now it is time to take The Fabric to the next level. We will use the funds we raise to implement more ideas that will make our altruistic shopping experience more comprehensive, invest in the necessary resources and bring more communities under our umbrella.
We have a great team at The Fabric of Humanity. Not only do we have the qualifications and experiences to pull this off, we actually think this is what we are meant to do!

Like all startups, The Fabric has its risks and challenges, and we are conscious of them. Money is the bloodline to any business, and we are no exception. Overall, we are extremely excited to find awesome people like you to help us fund The Fabric and to help us get it to the next level.

Once we get the support we are looking for, we feel there is little risk in providing you with your very-well-deserved Perks. Our X'MAS early bird Perks are ready to ship as soon as we get your survey responses. And we have dependable and ethical production ready for the job for our April batch.
We are fully transparent at The Fabric, as the trust that you place on us is of upmost importance to us. There are a few things that you should keep in mind in contributing to our project.

• The availability of our inventory for the X'MAS early bird Perks assumes customary demand patterns. That is, if it turns out that everybody is ordering M-sized units and no-one wants S's or L's, we may run out of M's before we are able to fulfil your Perk. We are keeping extra units at hand to try to minimize the likelihood of this scenario. Should it happen nonetheless, we will contact you as soon as possible and ask you how you'd like to proceed.

•  We will be placing a dedicated order for the Perks to be shipped in April. This timing works well with production lead times. In the event of an extraordinary demand for our Perks, it may be the case that we need to divide our production into two or more batches. If this were the case, we will do our best to minimize wait times and to process Perks in the order the contributions were received.

• Our Indian Heritage shirts make use of upcycled trims for the inside collar, cuff, button placket and sleeve tab. Depending on the level of demand for these Perks, it may be the case that the exact trim may not be available. If this were the case, we would contact you as soon as possible and give you more trim options at the time.
That's all folks! So, take a look at our Perks again and start by choosing the item you'd like. Together we can make incredible things happen.
