column3: >Ricky is a master wristwatch maker of over 20 years experience.  Born in Hong Kong, Ricky has developed and produced luxury timepieces, leather straps and handbags for American, European and Asian brands.  He has also created his own luxury wristwatch brand,
column7: >.  As Ricky said, ""When I was still young I fell in loves with watches.  As I remember, I was given my first watch at 11 years old by my father.  It was an old watch that my father wanted to flow.  It didn't work too well but I loved it.  Everyday I wound it up and listened to the tick tock sound emanate from it. "" After completing design college in 1989, Ricky started out as a professional graphic designer and advertising campaign professional.  In 1992, he landed his first job in his lifelong career as a wristwatch designer.  In the first years, Ricky had to learn on his own by doing his own hand drawings and graphics, visiting component factories, learning how to make cases, duals, hands and straps.  ""Everyday was busy but fun,"" Ricky said,  ""And I found out that watches are beside me, like my wife and family.  It is one of the most important parts of my life.  Time has gone fast from 1992-2014...a total of 22 years I work in the watch industry.  I have witnessed the change of watches from timepieces to fashion icons, from daily equipment to a representation of lifestyle. Watches tell you the time and time reminds you everyday that you must continue on your roadmap and make your dreams come true.""  Ricky and I have worked together on smartwatches for the last two years and, as you can judge from the A.Vera watch designs, he is brilliant.

column3: >A Shunde-native, Ying Yi finished her bachelor's degree in 2012.  She speaks perfect English, Mandarin and Cantonese and served as a volunteer in the 2010 Asian Games.  Ying Yi has managed a variety of projects over the last two years, from product testing and quality control, customer care and human resources, to shipping logistics and factory inspections.  Over the last year, she has become a bit of an expert in wearables, having helped produce the
column7: >  In her free time, Ying Yi likes to go bungee jumping in Macau, study graphic design and prepare to get her master's degree.  Her job on the A.Vera project is to ensure that Ricky gets his essential oils and our backers' perks are properly drop-shipped worldwide from Hong Kong.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks so much for checking out this Indiegogo campaign.  There are many ways you can support A. Vera, aside from contributing financially.  You can send us scientific data on aromatherapy, let your friends know about what I am doing on your Facebook page and otherwise use your Indiegogo share tools.
","A. Vera - A Bouquet On Your Wrist

My name is David Bychkov and I have a PhD in Media and Communication Studies. Since 1999, I have been a psychophysiology researcher and smartwatch manufacturer.  I believe that smell is one of the most powerful and unused modes of communication in the brain-body struggle for healthy eating. Clinical studies consistently demonstrate the power of aromatherapy to modulate emotions, improve sleep quality and provoke powerful memories.  In this Indiegogo campaign, I am pitching a line of aromatherapy-enhanced wristwatches called A.Vera.  My goal here is to help people achieve their physical and mental health goals by rediscovering their sense of smell.

My inspiration for this campaign is the aloe vera plant (as in ""A.Vera""), which aside from having nutritious leaves, also produces a gel that is soothing on the skin, suitable as a base for blending aromatherapy scents, and useful for the infusion of those scents into leather goods.  Whereas my smartwatches use a Mediatek platform, my aromatherapy wristwatches in this project will be based on an aloe vera one.
Aloe Vera Gel Combined With:                                               Jasmine Essential Oil
Sensory Health - Why I Believe in Aromatherapeutic Leather Watches

Personally, I have struggled with obesity since the age of 9.  For most of my adult life, I have been on a yo-yo diet roller coaster.  Undoubtedly, the stresses of life triggered and amplified the ups and downs.  My obesity went hand in hand with insomnia, migraines and hypertension.  In 2008, I had a Lap-Band surgically installed and have since lost over 160 lbs.

The process of losing so much weight has made me reconsider how each of the senses inform my health and behavior.  No matter how much weight I lose, my ears, eyes, tongue and nose do not seem to get much smaller.  Thankfully.
Smell, which is inextricably linked to taste and touch, not only signals when and where it is time to eat - but what is safe and clean to breathe in, drink and even kiss.

Just as the aroma of bergamot and fennel can dampen cravings for sweets, lavender and vanilla fragrance can help some people fall asleep.   For one of our family's dogs, the simple smell of my wife's hand helps him fall asleep.  On a primal level, her scent means he is safe and loved.  Her scent is his sleeping pill.

At the same time, many humans (including myself) live and work in big, polluted megalopolises.  The words ""smell"" or ""odor"" to urbanites evoke memories of squalor, filth and decay.  We are trained to want no smell, just supermarket sterility. The supermarket experience itself has removed us farther from the hunting, gathering and gardening of our ancestors.  Everything has been air conditioned, hosed and sprayed to insulate us from disease and, unfortunately, from smells, flavors and textures.
This is a dog's supermarket, as far as his nose is concerned.

The modern age means adaptation and accommodation to groups.  One of the first thing we've allowed ourselves to sacrifice for those groups are the joys of the senses.  We have tacitly accepted the idea that ""sniffing, snorting and smelling"" is now just for vagrants, criminals, hysterics, dogs, rodents and other critters.

I spent most of the last two years in China, where millions of pedestrians cover their face to protect themselves from contaminants in the air.  The simple pleasures of the nose are increasingly segregated to restaurants, massage parlors, spas, perfumeries and candle shops.  In Asia, there is still an association between scent and freshness.  This is precisely because food, water and air there has been polluted beyond the reach of even modern science's curative powers.  Chinese need to and do smell the things they buy, prepare and eat - to know if they are authentic and safe to consume.  We in the West have been spared this hassle, but at what cost?
This is my sad nose en route to some meeting in Beijing.
This is my energized nose refreshed by salty French sea breeze.

Why not just spray myself with aromatherapy air fresheners when I get hungry or cranky?  Certainly, there are a wide range of aromatherapy products already out there.  Some are even available in the supermarket.  So far, none of them are convenient to carry, none of them are fashionable, and none of them really get near my nose when I would need them (at the table or in bed).  They all have that chemical, factory after smell as well.  The standard aromatherapy delivery system is tainted by ozone or wax afterbirth.
A.Vera - A New Way to Transmit Aromatherapy

The A. Vera delivery system is soft, Italian calf skin leather.  There is something almost food-like about the A.Vera strap leather even before it is soaked in the fragrant oil.  This makes it even more tempting to touch and wear than a bottle of air freshener or a can of Perriair.

Since 2013, I have been working with traditional wristwatch makers, leather artisans and essential oil producers to craft A. Vera.  From the start, my vision has been of luxury timepieces with interchangeable, Italian leather straps infused in aloe vera and other essential oils that promote fullness, comfort and rest. A. Vera backers can choose from a range of styles and scents based on their wellness goals. The scents last at least 1 year. The timepiece itself comes with a Japanese movement and 3-year warranty.

The idea is to have a living, breathing bouquet on your wrist - not a dead, lifeless machine. Those who eat, sleep, work and play with their personalized A. Vera will have something to savor that helps fights off fatigue, depression, anxiety and compulsiveness.

I know that it seems unnatural to imagine someone at the dinner table sniffing or smelling something they wear.  From the 13th to 17th Century, the monarchs and nobility of France prized those glove makers who added scents to their leathers. Since then, leather tanneries around the world have used perfumes and scents that disguise the raw, rotten notes in dried cattle skin.  For hundreds of years, it was indeed fashionable to ""smell the glove.""  I am hoping to integrate the innovations in the science of aromatherapy with the fashion sensibilities of Catherine de Medici, who knew a thing or two.

My team has already produced about 20 prototypes in three styles: white and black with Swarovski crystal elements on the case bezel (for ladies) and simple black with crystal elements on the face (for gentlemen).  Each of the Italian calf skin leather straps are perforated, interchangeable and contain an embedded layer soaked in aloe vera oil, hence the name ""A. Vera.""  Aside from its well known skin soothing properties, aloe vera oil itself is often used as a base in which to transmit additional scents.  I am looking to raise $1000 to expand the offering to include straps with more scent variations that address specific emotions, based on data from studies collected at the National Library of Medicine.  For example, ""A.Vera Peppermint"" for sugar cravings, ""A.Vera Sandalwood"" for insomnia, ""A.Vera Cucumber"" for stress, etc.

What We Need & What You Get Here is a break-down of how the $1000 will be used:  Creation of four blended aloe vera oil based scented leather straps that each specifically promote (1) relaxation, (2) satiety, (3) energy and (4) joy.  At the moment, that would be lavender, bergamot, eucalyptus and jasmine respectively.  If you look at our perks, we  offer a variety of aromatherapeutic deliverables, aside from A.Vera watches, including: (1) scented straps that can put on your other wristwatches, (2) scented ink, (3) scented paper and even (4) scented gloves.   Creation of an A. Vera companion coffee table book that will help end users understand the value of how to incorporate wrist-worn aromatherapy into their overall wellness goals - weight loss, stress relief, pain management, etc.  (No guarantee the book itself will be scented, unless someone takes advantage of the Premier Enthusiast perk.) Creation of additional watch face designs that can remind wearers of complimentary, aromatherapeutic activities such as gardening, wine tasting, cooking, hiking, attending farmers markets, fishing, hunting, etc.  So far, we only have the one face design.

If we only raise a portion of the $1000 dollars, we will focus on the development of the scented leather oils.  The A.Vera companion book would then have to be an e-book not available in printed format.  Our target is to deliver A.Vera kits by June and launch more broadly via Amazon and luxury boutiques by the end of the year.

The ImpactI am one of the earliest pioneers of the smartwatch movement, having launched the Exmocare BT1 Bluetooth biosensor wristwatch in 2006.  Since then I have been trying to come out with more and more battery powered gadgets to put on the body.  There is still a genuine need for that when dealing with chronic and elderly care.  Nevertheless, I am taking a step back to consider how to incorporate nature and our own natural capacities into what we wear.  A.Vera is an opportunity for those of us who have become too encased in technology to literally wake up and smell the coffee.  I have done 99% of the work already on this project and would like this Indiegogo campaign to help me gauge if other people in the world also want to reconnect to aromas, scents and their own noses.

How do we make the oils?  There are a wide variety of perfume experts (""noses"") in the world, some of whom were my students and colleagues at Universita' dell' Immagine in Milan, Italy.  Others work with massive fragrance production companies in Europe.  I have consulted with them to design oils that reflect the data I have already compiled from articles at the National Library of Medicine.  They have provided me the initial samples I needed for my first 20 prototypes and will continue to supply me going forward.  The main costs going forward are testing on leather samples at the timepiece and strap factories we work with in Asia.

The following things can go wrong: (1) the scents we design may be subjectively perceived as too strong or too weak, (2) specific combinations of scents may fade from the leather too quickly, (3) the scents may not age well when exposed to household chemicals and cleaning soaps, (4) some people will disagree/argue about which scent best addresses which emotions and behaviors.

In order to address what may go wrong with the scenting of the leathers, we will be warranting them for at least 1 year.  If a backer gets an A.Vera watch and hates the smell, we will replace it with a stronger/weaker scented strap.  Hopefully, after enough A.Vera backers have given us feedback, future A.Vera customers will find their timepieces to be therapeutic and something worth showing off.  As for the science itself, I can only guarantee that we will do our best to follow the literature - not that the watches or straps will ""definitely, every time, no matter what, for all people"" cause some direct change of condition, mood or behavior.  I see A.Vera aromatherapeutic effects being fairly benchmarked against Bath and Body Works consumer products, not against Pfizer and Merck medical devices and drugs.  The goal is to start now with Lavender, Bergamot, Eucalyptus and Jasmine, then expand to custom formulas based on end user feedback.

With regards to the timepieces, we are partnering with one of the most respected watch factories in Asia - which happens to be owned by our teammate Ricky Tsang. They currently output 400,000 luxury wristwatches and straps per month, using Japanese, Swiss and Chinese movements.  I have visited their facilities repeatedly and am confident of their ability to produce on time.  Actually, this is the least stressful design or manufacturing project I have ever worked on (this would be the most stressful one, if you are curious).  The success or failure of A.Vera really boils down to understanding emotion and ""synaesthetics,"" as my early mentor Fabrizio Ferri calls it.
Although I am the Creative Director of the A.Vera project, I am blessed to have a couple of key players helping me.  First on the roster is Ricky Tsang:

Ricky is a master wristwatch maker of over 20 years experience.  Born in Hong Kong, Ricky has developed and produced luxury timepieces, leather straps and handbags for American, European and Asian brands.  He has also created his own luxury wristwatch brand, Subcrew.  As Ricky said, ""When I was still young I fell in loves with watches.  As I remember, I was given my first watch at 11 years old by my father.  It was an old watch that my father wanted to flow.  It didn't work too well but I loved it.  Everyday I wound it up and listened to the tick tock sound emanate from it. "" After completing design college in 1989, Ricky started out as a professional graphic designer and advertising campaign professional.  In 1992, he landed his first job in his lifelong career as a wristwatch designer.  In the first years, Ricky had to learn on his own by doing his own hand drawings and graphics, visiting component factories, learning how to make cases, duals, hands and straps.  ""Everyday was busy but fun,"" Ricky said,  ""And I found out that watches are beside me, like my wife and family.  It is one of the most important parts of my life.  Time has gone fast from 1992-2014...a total of 22 years I work in the watch industry.  I have witnessed the change of watches from timepieces to fashion icons, from daily equipment to a representation of lifestyle. Watches tell you the time and time reminds you everyday that you must continue on your roadmap and make your dreams come true.""  Ricky and I have worked together on smartwatches for the last two years and, as you can judge from the A.Vera watch designs, he is brilliant.
The other critical member of our team is Ying Yi He, our Project Coordinator:

A Shunde-native, Ying Yi finished her bachelor's degree in 2012.  She speaks perfect English, Mandarin and Cantonese and served as a volunteer in the 2010 Asian Games.  Ying Yi has managed a variety of projects over the last two years, from product testing and quality control, customer care and human resources, to shipping logistics and factory inspections.  Over the last year, she has become a bit of an expert in wearables, having helped produce the Empath 2.1 video.  In her free time, Ying Yi likes to go bungee jumping in Macau, study graphic design and prepare to get her master's degree.  Her job on the A.Vera project is to ensure that Ricky gets his essential oils and our backers' perks are properly drop-shipped worldwide from Hong Kong.

Other Ways You Can Help Thanks so much for checking out this Indiegogo campaign.  There are many ways you can support A. Vera, aside from contributing financially.  You can send us scientific data on aromatherapy, let your friends know about what I am doing on your Facebook page and otherwise use your Indiegogo share tools.",29.0,0,"1 Campaign
Type Tank's motto is Keep it Simple. Type Tanks developed out of a friendship and a shared love of fashion.

As a costume designer I've been trained to problem solve and quick rig fashion garments for smooth quick changes and durability. Type tanks are a versatile tank top that protects and holds a Type 1 Diabetic's insulin pump for an active lifestyle.
Friends of mine have been diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes (some when they were children) and have (since diagnosis) been juggling the medical challenges and fashion frustrations.

After learning over 3 million Americans are diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes I became overwhelmed and inspired to create and push this product's development. Listening to personal stories of stashing and storing pumps inspired this line of tank tops.

Type Tanks can be worn as athletic wear or professional business attire. They can be layered and are highly durable and designed to transition from season to season. The moisture wicking fabric also keeps sweat from breaking the pump.
We are trying to raise $12,500 to develop, distribute and market Type Tanks!
Routine Costs (Shipping- Fabric and Product, Office Supplies): $2000
We hope to market Type Tanks to young girls, teenagers, athletes, and women who love fashion and live with Type 1 Diabetes and are looking for alternative solutions for apparel.

If we don't reach the 12,500 goal we will start with a small pre-sale and continue to build the company by producing small orders and using the sales to continue produtions. (This will raise the price of the tanks because our production costs will be higher for ordering small quanitites)
If we raise over 12,500 we will patent our other products (specifically men's apparel) that are in development to get consumer feed back and start production on those items as well!

We will be keeping a Multi-Media newsletter of this step by step process and all of the business advenures and events we attend as well as the reactions and feedback of those who experience and see Type Tanks!

3 million people in the USA have been diagnosed with Diabetes. I think I'm most excited to offer this product to women and young girls so they can have more options when it comes to fashion and function!
If you are unable to donate we would be grateful for any media or press coverage to let others know about this product!
-Check out our website! www.typetanks.com
-Support JDRF (Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation) www.jdrf.org
www.instagram.com/typetanks and tag us with your fashion style at #typetanks!

Short Summary

Gubby Gear was formed 4 years ago when I decided to turn a hobby into a business.  I began to sell at the local farmer's market, and when the demand became too great I enlisted hope from local ladies who needed work that they could do from home.  Unbeknowns to me, the law says that I can sew and sell my wares from my home, but I cannot have seamstresses sew for me in their homes.  AND, also unbeknownst to me, I was ""manufacturing"" because I was making a wearable robe.  If I had been only been making blankets I would not have been manufacturing.  You can imagine my surprise when the state cobbled a case against me and fined me $28,600 for these extraordinary offenses.  Who knew something like that could even happen?  

I am now trying to convince my state representative to help me with legislation to change some of the laws that make this outrageous behavior by the California department of Labor even possible.  Apparently someone doesn't want any competition in the garment industry here.  

If I can raise funds through crowd funding, it will lift the burden of paying these magnanimous fines, and allow me to continue to pursue my mission to have a small run of Gubby Gear manufactured in time for the Holidays this year.  


What We Need 

I'm looking for enough funding to help pay my fines through the end of the year (1/2 the total), to pay for licensure, which is now double because I am an ""offender"", and purchase enough fabric and pay for my first run at contract manufacturing.

$13,000 (1/2 the total fine), $1000 Licensure, $7,000 Manufacturing.

If I can raise at least $5,000 it will give me enough runway to get started.

All products offered are below retail, and all hand sewn by me, prior to manufacturing.  


What You Get
column3: >  You've seen them, but you haven't seen one like this.  Choice of 3 colors, this scarf wraps twice around the head and is as soft as a kitten.  Choose pink, ivory, or grey zebra stripe.  $20 donation.
column11:
/>


Lovey:  This Little Lovey is a BIG deal.  The baby can drag it around without ""dragging"" it around.  15 inches of soft fabulousness will be the only one at your daycare.  $25 donation.
column16:
/>


Gubby Gear Basic Baby Blanket:  These blankets are made to fit each baby's individual personality.  Please choose baby blanket fabrics from my site www.gubbygear.com to choose just the right fabric for you, the leave your choice in the comments section of Indegogo.  $55 donation.
column18:
/>


The BIG Blanket:  This is the grand daddy of perks.  This blanket is 60 inches square is best when used for reading a good book, taking an indulgent nap, snuggling with the little ones, and lots of other things...  Most people who buy this blanket never leave their couch again.  Two color choices:  Mocha and Grey. $110 donation.
column26:
/>



The Impact

This project is important for so many reasons.  The state laws are antiquated and don't allow entrepreneurs to run their businesses in a sensible way.  The laws need to change.  AND, if they are indeed protecting the industry from sweat shop labor, go after the real criminals, not those of us just trying to start a business.  The state of California was obviously desperate for funds or they wouldn't have pursued us so voraciously for a first time offense.  

Gubby Gear has been running for 4 years with successful installations in retail shops as well as many solicitations for web sales.  We feel confident that we have a product that is unique to the marketplace and that we can successfully sell into the boutique industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate or purchase Gubby Gear to help us out, please pass this campaign along to friends who need baby gear, or someone who needs an amazing throw for their couch.  We are looking for long term relationships so please bookmark www.gubbygear.com and think of us whenever you need a great unique gift.


Thank you!!!!

Q: What's the delivery time for The MessageBottle?
A: Watch for your bottle in your mailbox in March 2016!
Q: Which MessageBottle design will I receive?
A: Our first production run will feature the Green Climate Action Bottle with a metallic body finish and laser etched graphics. However the fully colored bottle design could be produced later.
Q: What will The MessageBottle Retail Price after Indiegogo?
A: The MessageBottle will retail in stores for $35 USD!
A: The first 3000 bottles will feature a green lid.  Once we've reached 3000, more colors will be created!

","The HeroesToo Foundation is an environmental NGO based in Hong Kong.  We are focused on a global solution to environmental issues.  We believe in protecting the planet through people power.
We’ve developed a range of stainless steel eco-bottles called The
MessageBottle. The idea is simple: Your Cause, Your Bottle.

Each bottle is color-coded and reflects your individual commitment to a wide range of environmental efforts and social causes. The proceeds from each bottle will fund a correlating cause. We’ve identified 17 different causes that are aligned with the UN Global Goals Initiative (www.globalgoals.org).  Our goal is to raise at least USD 30,000 to successfully manufacture the bottle. The first run will feature a First Edition Green Climate Action Bottle (Pictured above). Funds raised will go towards HeroesToo's EcoPledge program. You can learn more about the cause and how the funds will be used here: http://heroestoo.org/about-the-ecopledge/. As we raise more funds, we’ll introduce more causes and colors to the line.

We are proud to announce that we have teamed up with Masarang, an organization which protects endangered Asian species, promotes reforestation and empowers local communities. You now have the choice of donating your money to either our EcoPledge program or Masarang's reforestation initiatives in Indonesia when purchasing your MessageBottle.
After several requests from friends and supporters of HeroesToo, we have now decided to add a new bottle to our campaign - the solid green. The concept is the same
column2: by preordering your MessageBottle you donate money to our EcoPledge, but now you have the choice of either getting the first edition stainless steel bottle with green lid, or the new special edition solid green bottle.

column1: The MessageBottle journey started with The Cause Bottle Challenge Design Contest on GrabCAD, a large online community of over 2 million engineers
and designers.  Through this contest, we
sought out the most innovative and practical design of a sustainable water
bottle to be put into production.  Chicago
industrial designer Jacob Stanton’s design was selected ultimately for its simple
design, ease of production and practicality.
Product Specifications Our insulated MessageBottle will keep you hydrated with either cold or hot liquids: your choice. The MessageBottle is:
Made with high grade stainless steel
Double-walled construction keeps drinks hot or cold for hours
Reduces the need for single use plastic bottles
What We Need & What You Get
we can start manufacturing the first of many MessageBottles.  Early birds
will also be entitled to a limited edition neoprene sleeve with their bottle:
the success of the MessageBottle grows, we hope to manufacture different
colors of the bottle to benefit other causes in line with the UN Global
Goals such as gender equality and poverty alleviation.
Join our campaign to create the MessageBottle for a better planet.
1. Reduce single use plastic bottles-with billions of
plastic bottles ending up in landfill and entering our oceans, plastic is
negatively affecting our wildlife and environment.  You can help make a difference by using a
reusable water bottle instead of buying drinks bottled in single use plastics.
2. Support the EcoPledge Program in schools in
Hong Kong, Canada, United States and United Kingdom initially, then in schools
3. Support other environmental and social programs in line
Our goal is to raise at least USD 30,000 to successfully
manufacture the bottles and raise partial funds for the EcoPledge Program, but with
more funding, we’ll be able to support more schools in addition to backing other charities once we’ve passed this target! One Bottle-Global Impact!
Q: What's the delivery time for The MessageBottle?
A: Watch for your bottle in your mailbox in March 2016!
Q: Which MessageBottle design will I receive?
A: Our first production run will feature the Green Climate Action Bottle with a metallic body finish and laser etched graphics. However the fully colored bottle design could be produced later.
Q: What will The MessageBottle Retail Price after Indiegogo?
A: The MessageBottle will retail in stores for $35 USD!
Q: What are the available colors?
A: The first 3000 bottles will feature a green lid.  Once we've reached 3000, more colors will be created!
Q: What's the capacity of the bottle?
A: Absolutely! We're ensuring our products meet all international safety standards.
Help spread the word via your friends, family, colleagues,
social media network and more by sharing our website and FB page!  Remember to hashtag:

Meet JÖRD Apron. A custom-designed line of protective wear made specifically adapted to your needs. Welcome to the one tool you’re no longer missing. Cooks, servers, painters, mixologists, baristas, florists, gardeners, DIYers, woodworkers, barber, chefs, tattoo artists &
column2: butchers ... we saw how great the need was. JÖRD was born.

column1: <div>No matter your lifestyle, your trade, you are familiar with the search for the perfect tool. The one that feels like an extension of yourself
column2: the one that fits perfectly, moves with you, never gets in your way and maintains the style you’ve worked hard to create.

column1: After five generations of design, trial and error, mistakes and breakthroughs, a collection of aprons was born. Handcrafted with high-quality materials Incorporating state-of-the-art patented technology each apron delivers protection married with style.

JÖRD aprons are perfectly handcrafted using only high-quality materials. A meticulous attention is given on the detail, design and accessories to provide a standout style combined with a flawless fit. Our purpose is to create something unique, flattering and functional. All the aprons come with adjustable straps, so you can make them fit better to your size.
Our [ 5 in 1 A Model ] Customizable Apron with removable pockets that can be worn separately, or left or right with a leather ring and removable leather pocket for left or right handed.
The body of our aprons is composed of two parts that are put together by a seam on the waist. This seam avoids the balloon effect around the waist that most other aprons in the market have.

All the aprons are 100% hand made with 80% cotton and 20% polyester [250 G/M2] strong twill fabrics, developed for the JÖRD collection. The powerful ULTRAPEL™ protection is a dual action patented by Doubletex® that repels water and stains, while leaving the fabrics feeling and staying, breathing and comfortable.
Stain-repellent textiles are not a new concept. What JÖRD does differently, applies the technology to woven fabrics and make them more resistant and Foolproof.

The technology is based on a finish which protects the fabric from staining. This is achieved by blocking the stain and preventing it from penetrating into the fabric. The process forms a coating on the individual fibers within the fabric and thus protects it from spills, stains, whether oil or water based, wet or dry - even tougher stains like blood or oil.
The colors have been specially developed for the JÖRD collection and our fabrics are environmentally friendly.
Quality is our highest goal, that's why our leather is from the finest collection and specially selected for the details for our aprons.

They come with brass hardware and clasps, both coated in Zamak - an anti-allergic material that respects the environment, avoids rust and has excellent resistance and strength, giving the metal a bold look and a lifespan longer than any other zinc can offer.

The straps are manufactured according to our specifications with the colors specially developed for the JÖRD collection. The webbing matching the color and fabric of your apron, 80% cotton and 20% Polyester made adjustable straps. A handmade leather clasp on the shoulders and pockets of this apron that snap on and off for washing and fully adjustable for easy fit.

Our JÖRD 5 IN 1: Are 26"" wide by 32"" tall, with the upper part around 12"" tall and the lower 20"" tall and the width of the neck is 10 "". Plus, the waist apron with removable pockets that can be worn separately, is 11.5” wide by 21” tall.
Our JÖRD AT WORK: Are around 30"" wide by 36"" tall, being the upper part around 13"" tall and the lower 23"" tall and the width of the neck is 10""

Machine wash, it’s totally safe. Wash with warm water delicate cycle, dry flat [no bleach and without liquid softener]. These aprons are coated so they will repel water, liquids, and most food stuff, turn the apron inside out and iron. They are super easy to clean!
We think the most important Value of Kickstarter platform — It's not about money — It’s Community.

The INDIEGOGO community is more than another way of raising funds. In connecting creators and entrepreneurs directly with customers and funders, it transforms the market for early-stage fundraising into a more democratic, open one. Creators can directly reach out to customers and communities and they understand the value that's associated in the creative process of the creator.

This is a great opportunity to benefit mutually. By pledging for one of our apron, you'll not only help a small business grow, but you'll also receive an awesome hand made apron at a fraction of its normal price!

JÖRD is the northern goddess and Germanic venerated on the summit of the mountains where she would have mated with the sky, bringing paradise to earth. Jörd means ""land"". This powerful goddess embodies all the strength and resistance of our planet - as well as the strength and stain-resistance of the JÖRD Apron.

The INDIEGOGO community is more than another way of raising funds. In connecting creators and entrepreneurs directly with customers and funders, it transforms the market for early-stage fundraising into a more democratic, open one. Creators can directly reach out to customers and communities and they understand the value that's associated in the creative process of the creator.

This is a great opportunity to benefit mutually. By pledging for one of our apron, you'll not only help a small business grow, but you'll also receive an awesome hand made apron at a fraction of its normal price!

JÖRD is the northern goddess and Germanic venerated on the summit of the mountains where she would have mated with the sky, bringing paradise to earth. Jörd means ""land"". This powerful goddess embodies all the strength and resistance of our planet - as well as the strength and stain-resistance of the JÖRD Apron.

0,"

 

 

Méraud Watch Co. was founded by vintage watch collector and one of the leading members of the Belgium Watch Club, Stijn Busschaert. A watch enthusiast for years, Stijn decided to create his own brand and infuse his passion into the market. He’s well-versed in the nuances of vintage and heritage timepieces and approached Méraud’s designs from the mindset of a passionate collector.

Méraud’s mission is to create exceptional, yet affordable vintage-inspired timepieces. 

The result is the Méraud Bonaire. A mechanical timepiece built by modern standards with a pure design where form follows function.
column9:
>

Méraud's inaugural model is the Méraud Bonaire dive watch. The name Méraud is derived from the French word for emerald (émeraude), symbolizing something precious. Bonaire is a Caribbean island that’s also known as ‘Diver’s Paradise’.  

The Bonaire has a case size of 39mm and a thickness of 12,5mm, including the crystal. Lug to lug it measures 48,50mm. The Bonaire’s unidirectional diver’s bezel design was inspired by the Bakelite bezels from the 1950s and 1960s and is finished with a scratch-resistant sapphire to complement the active lifestyles of our time. It will be available with three different dial variations (you will be asked to choose the one you'd like at the end of the campaign).
column10:
>""Onyx Black""

The Bonaire ""Onyx Black"" comes with a deep gloss black dial. The lume markers are filled with patina-like C3 Swiss SuperLuminova®. The indexes are applied and polished steel. Slightly domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating on the inside. Domed black sapphire bezel with Swiss SuperLuminova®, mimicking the bakelite bezels from back in the day.
column11:
>
""Marine Blue""

The Bonaire ""Marine Blue"" comes with a beautiful marine blue sunburst dial. The lume markers are filled with regular C3 Swiss SuperLuminova®. The indexes are applied and polished steel. Slightly domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating on the inside. Domed blue sapphire bezel with Swiss SuperLuminova®, mimicking the bakelite bezels from back in the day.
column13:
>""Graphite Grey""

The Bonaire ""Graphite Grey"" comes with a beautiful grey sunburst dial. The lume markers are filled with regular C3 Swiss SuperLuminova®. The indexes are applied and polished steel. Slightly domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating on the inside. Domed black sapphire bezel with Swiss SuperLuminova®, mimicking the bakelite bezels from back in the day.

The Méraud Bonaire watch is powered by a modified Caliber STP1-11, which boasts the precision of Swiss automatic mechanical movement. The STP1-11 operates at 28,800 beats per hour and offers a 44-hour power reserve. The movement has a “perlage” finish, while the rotor has the “Côte de Geneve” finish and Méraud signature. The movement is modified to a no-date movement, all components releated to the date have been removed. Upon request STP has adjusted the movements that there are only 2 crown, one for winding and one position to set the time.
column14:
>Photo of the modified STP1-11 caliber used in the Bonaire

This video below gives a good view on the production facilities of Swiss Technology Production, the manufacturer that is producing the movements for each Méraud Bonaire.
column16:
showinfo=0"">

Staying true to the watches of the 60's, the elegant 316L stainless steel cases measure a perfect 39mm. In addition, the cases are finished with striking contrasts thanks to a mix of linear, circular, and high-polished brushed finishes.

With a height of 12,5mm and a classical case build the watch has a masculine, elegant and sporty look on the wrist. Perfect for any occasion. 

Thanks to the drilled lugholes the straps can easily be exchanged by using the strap tool that is added with the package. 

The screwed caseback has a polygon shape referring to the casebacks from back in the day. It's a minimalistic approach and it's finished by a combination of circular brushing and sandblasting. The speardiver on the back is designed by an Argentinian comic designer.
column17: >A mixture of brushed and polished finishings. Polishe bezel edge, polished chamfers, circular brushed lugs.
column18: >Polished hands, polished applied indexes.
column20: >Linear brushings on the side, polished chamfers, polished crown with logo, drilled lugholes.​
column22: >Vintage-style polygon caseback, brushed and sand blasted finishing, minimalistic approach.​
column24:
>

 

1. Leather strap

The strap, an important detail that is so often overlooked by many brands, be it established names or small brands. For Méraud it's an essential piece of the puzzle, a proper strap. Some important points were craftsmanship, durability, tradition, comfort and quality. Based upon those needs two tanneries were selected to use leather. Located in France and Germany, and suppliers of one of the biggest leather luxury brands. 

The skins are bought and sent to a small leathercrafter. There the straps are cut, machine stitched and partially hand stitched. Each single leather strap is finished by hand. The straps have a thickness of about 2mm, the inner leather is hypo-allergenic and the outer leather is durable, yet soft and luxurious. 

They are saddle stitched, which is the strongest stitching. The result is a piece of art and craftsmanship.
column31: >Cognac colored strap, fits the ""Onyx Black""​
column33: >Blue colored strap, fits the ""Marine Blue""​
column35:
>Taupe leather strap, fits the ""Graphite Grey"".​

 

2. Steel bracelet

Standard the Méraud Bonaire comes on a leather strap. Yet, there is a bracelet option. This is a stretch goal, once 125 backers are reached there will be an option to choose between a steel bracelet or leather strap, without any added cost. The steel bracelet will be available separately as well.

Staying true to the vintage-inspired design, the stainless steel bracelet is rivetted. The first four links have rivets, the other links have screws in order to resize the bracelet. There's a double-folding clasp with holes on the side for micro adjustments. 

The bracelet is finished in 316L steel, polished sides and clasp. 

3. Tropic strap*

A vintage inspired dive watch without a proper rubber strap would be a no-go. 

After creating technical drawings and 3D prints, green light has been given for a proper mould. The tropic strap is manufactured by a leading supplier of the Swiss watch industry. 

Important was that the strap would be comfortable and soft, non dust attractive, long lasting and that it had the true vibe of an original tropic strap. Silicone has been avoided for quality reasons. 

It had to taper from 20mm down to 16mm at the buckle, be large enough to put over a wetsuit as well. A blue tropic strap comes with the blue dial.

This is the result:

4. NATO strap*

At last, a NATO strap, for the true adventurous backers. This type of strap comes in handy in every situation. 

The NATO strap is only 1.2mm thick, has a soft feel and a very fine weaving pattern as per our request.
column36:
>Fabric of the nato strap. Only 1.2mm thick, amazingly comfortable.

*Important notice: both the tropic and nato strap are part of the package that comes with the Méraud Bonaire.

column1: • DIMENSIONS: Lug width 20mm, lug to lug 48.50mm, thickness 12.50mm
• MOVEMENT: Swiss Made STP1-11 modified to no-date
• BEZEL: Unidirectional rotatable, Sapphire Crystal, lumed with C3 SuperLuminova®
• STRAP: Calfskin leather, sourced in France and Germany or a rivetted bracelet, 316L stainless steel.
• EXTRAS: Rubber Tropic strap, premium NATO strap and a custom strap tool

RETAIL PRICE: €849,00 

OPTION °1 - Watch pouch (+€15,00)

Your perfect travel companion. The pouches will be available in 3 colors, Camel, Taupe and Marine Blue, matching the 3 variations of the Bonaire. 

Securely fastening button guarantees your watch's safety. Included inside the pouch is a special extra insert that ensures the watch is not scratched by the bracelet or buckle. 

Dimensions - 6 x 13 x 1.5 cm

OPTION °2 - Extra leather watch strap (+€95,00)

The Bonaire is made for strap changes. You have the option to add an extra strap to complement your Bonaire. These will be available in regular size or short size. 

Below the different colors available.
column12:
Textured Marine Blue (right)​

 

OPTION °3 Extra stainless steel bracelet (+€95,00)

You'd like to order the Bonaire on a strap and buy an additional bracelet? Great, we're offering it as an extra option.

 

Méraud Watch Co. is built up on a foundation of passion and watch collecting. The Bonaire is offered as a collector's package. A minimal watch box with a top tray and below space for a NATO strap, rubber strap and a tool. 

 

Founded in Ghent, Belgium, Méraud Watch Company is a passion project through and through. As a watch enthusiast, I feel that I’m well versed in the nuances of vintage watches and I know what collectors like myself look for in heritage timepieces. After collecting watches for over 10 years it was time to fulfill a dream, launching my own watch brand. I want to set myself apart by creating timepieces, using my passion as fuel for my work, which is the most natural and efficient way to be creative.  

Méraud is a passion project out of love for watches and I have tried to combine this with everything I love, be it design, craftsmanship, history. This is where I connected with the people behind the scenes, every single individual is just as passionate about his task as I am about watches. This synergy lead to the end result, the Méraud Bonaire, the inaugural model of the company.      

Stijn Busschaert, founder 
– Méraud Watch Co. –

Thanks For All Your Support, Our Crowd-Funding Phase Is OVER And We've Raised Almost $1.1 Million USD Because Of You!

column3: utm_campaign=Top-Link"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Click Here To Pre-Order Your Timepiece While You Still Can!

column2: Most Funded NYC Watch Campaign IN HISTORY.

>

 

We all want millionaire watches. You know the kind.

Watches so unique, they are instant conversation starters.

Watches so expensive, they stun the room and make people whisper our name.

Watches with that ONE thing that make them cost more than a house -- the Tourbillon.
column3:
>

Put a tourbillon into any watch — the price explodes: Six Figures. Seven Figures. 

INSTANTLY.
column4:
>

The world’s most expensive watches??

No surprise - they are all tourbillons.
column9:
>

Want to buy a tourbillon for five figures? 

Good luck. 

The New York Times says that is almost impossible.
column10:
>

Clearly tourbillon watches are out of reach for me and you, for nearly everyone. 

Yet...do they have to be? 

When you think about making a more inexpensive tourbillon, simply “cutting out the middlemen” or “eliminating manufacturer markup” won’t bring down the price of tourbillon watches. 

Those are overused marketing buzz words for making yet ANOTHER “affordable luxury” watch.
column11:
>

This is harsh language but it needs to be said. Any brand that talks about “cutting middlemen” and selling true luxury watches “direct to consumer” is telling you a nice fairy tale. 

It sounds nice in practice but it isn't based in reality whatsoever. 

Why?  

Because in reality: a basic minimal watch with a turnstile Miyota movement can NEVER be a luxury watch.

It's putting lipstick on a pig. 

You are paying a “luxury” price for craftsmanship on par with a Walmart bargain bin watch.

What you’re getting isn’t “affordable luxury”, you’re paying $270 for a fabricated story and $19 for a cheap watch.

This isn't bringing you affordable luxury - it is robbing you.
column12:
>

Fortunately, or unfortunately for us, we just saw that tourbillon watches really ARE 6 or 7 figures. 

Again if that sounds insane - I agree with you 100%. 

But what is even more insane, what will REALLY make you mad...is the reason they are so expensive. 

And the reason is all too familiar
column13:
a small group is controlling nearly everything. There is actually a ""secret watch society” actively price gouging high-end timepieces and stopping us from wearing what we want.  

To uncover this unfairness, we first need to see why tourbillon watches are intrinsically so valuable. Only then can we know and what is or isn’t fair to pay for them. 

Here’s why they will always be pricey...
column14:
>

Manufacturing Precision 

In order to make a tourbillon, expert machinists use million dollar equipment like the Willemin 5-Axis. These machines give form and function to finest of raw materials.
column15:
>

This machine transforms precious metals into the cases, bezels, fasteners, and dials of your tourbillon watch.
column16:
>

Want an ultra high-end watch?  

Then you need high-end watch parts.  

And high-end watch parts can only come from high-end machines.
column17:
>

A tourbillon cannot be built in an environment that is less than perfect.
column18:
>

Every piece is made precise and accurate. 

The margin of error is only microns.
column19:
>

But these are JUST the watch parts.

We haven't even begun the Grand Ballet of Watch Assembly yet.

100s Of Hours Of Detail

Because you see, after machining, these intricate parts are hand-worked. The attention each piece receives walks a fine line between obsession and passion.
column20:
>

You don’t just have one watchmaker dedicated to making your timepiece. A small army of master horologists add hours...and hours - of laser focused, hand-crafted detail.
column21:
>

And It takes 100s of painstaking hours to make ONE tourbillon.
column22:
>

Yet hyper-focused eyes and minds are not enough. To successfully build a tourbillon timepiece, you need the most important ingredient of all.

Watchmaking Mastery

Master watchmakers are the only ones capable of building a tourbillon. 

Only through years and years of training, practice, and learning can they tackle complications such as minute repeaters, grand sonnier, and the tourbillon.
column23:
>

Because for these elite artisans, it isn’t just watchmaking. 

They approach their craft like its heart surgery.
column24:
>

And this tourbillon assembly? That’s a HEART TRANSPLANT.
column25:
>

If all this seems excessive, remember - NOTHING about a tourbillon watch is supposed to be “affordable” or “normal” or “accessible”.
column26:
>

From the million dollar equipment, to the surgically precise watch parts

From 100s of artisanal labor hours, to the world-class fingers of the horologists:

A Tourbillon IS the supercar of watches, 

A marvel of engineering,

And... expensive.

But does it really have to be THAT expensive? Does it really have to be THAT ridiculously priced?
column28:
>

We believe no watch should be beyond our grasp. ERA represents the first way to finally access ultra high end watches. We are the only solution to the question:

How Do You Buy Millionaire Watches For Under $1000?

Hopefully you are skeptical. Knowing how tourbillons are now made, how is it even remotely possible to buy them for 3 figures? 

Great instincts. 

Remember that watch “secret society” we mentioned earlier? The one purposely keeping you away from the watches you love, purposely holding you back. Lets expose them. 

See, the ultra-luxury watch brands are making fools out of you and me. We are being lied to and manipulated by a select group of corporations, AGAIN. 

Remember: we just saw that only elite watchmakers can build a tourbillon.
column29:
>

But... the ultra-luxury brands control the world’s elite watchmakers.
column30:
>

So, you want a tourbillon watch? 

No problem. You can get one through a luxury watch brand and they will charge you anywhere from $100,000 to even $1,000,000 dollars or more.

Don’t like that price?

Too bad.

Who else is going to make the watch for you?  The luxury watch brands control the world’s elite watchmakers.

If that sounds like an unfair monopoly or cartel -- you’re right. It Is
column31:
>

But here at ERA, we want to finally break this monopoly and we are in a unique position to do so.

Having first worked as luxury brand distributors, we got to see “behind the scenes” and how things worked in the watch industry.

More importantly after years of networking and forming strategic partnerships:

We got to know the same master watchmakers who build tourbillons for the luxury brand cartel. 

By partnering with these same master watchmakers, we broke through the cartel wall.
column32:
>

And together with these master watchmakers, we finally made the world’s first ever accessible tourbillon.
column34:
>

In Greek mythology Prometheus stole fire from the Gods and gave it to mankind.

He took from those with unlimited power, and shared a gift that was meant for all.

Inspired by this timeless myth, we made a tourbillon watch attainable for all.
column35:
>

Made EXACTLY like other tourbillon watches, the ERA Prometheus comes with a lower half, exposed mechanism.
column36:
>

Here we see the balance wheel, pallet fork, hairspring: watchmaking virtuosity in full display.
column37:
>

Other than the show-stopping Tourbillon, the ERA Prometheus has even more complications that you would expect from a 6-figure watch.
column38:
>

Every timepiece is detailed and engraved with gears and other flourishes. Such as a 24 hour GMT Timer on the left and a dual revolving sun-moon dial on the right.
column41:
>

All these mechanisms are housed behind beautiful sapphire crystal and a special made stainless steel body.
column45:
>

As befitting for a watch of its caliber, the Prometheus also features a hornback leather croc style band that is stitched with premium midnight blue threading.
column48:
>

Alternate Strap Colors

We originally didn't want to offer brown bands with this particular model because we are extreme horological and design purists here, and brown doesn't usually go with the blues we have on the dial of our timepiece (earth tone palettes and cool ones usually don't go together).

That being said, we still took some photos with some prototype sourced brown hornback croc bands and put them on our Instagram for fun awhile back.

After so many of our fans wrote in wanting them, we took a hard look at our stance and we're pleased to announce we are going to give our customers what they want.

In Total, we now have 5 colors to choose from, and 2 bezel finishes:

column1: Lastly on the back, each watch is engraved with a unique serial number. So your timepiece will be a limited edition and always, one of a kind.
column3:
>

The finest timepieces must be stored in the finest way, so it's no surprise that we have a hand-crafted and polished lacquered wood box to house your legendary timepiece.

And as amazing as it already looks -- this box shown here is actually just a prototype, the final version will be even more custom and stunning!
column4:
>

We're proud to announce that we will be introducing other variants for those who simply must have the finest Tourbillon upgrade pick:  

The ERA Prometheus Titan Edition

column1:
The ERA Prometheus Titan Edition is a special limited-edition versions that feature over 2.3 carats and over 78 gigantic diamonds that have been fused with the bezel and stretched around all surrounding metallic surfaces.

It features a PLATINUM bezel and all the diamonds on both are natural Bright cut round GH colored diamonds with a clarity of VS1.

The Titan Edition is meant for a real world Titan, like the current UNDEFEATED, UNDISPUTED WBA Super Bantemweight World Champion Ryan Burnett.  He is a huge fan of what we're doing at ERA and can be seen here wearing the ERA Prometheus Titan Edition with over 78 diamonds and 2.3 carats at his world title defense:

But with such amazing timepieces, it's important to remember that while your tourbillon timepiece is bound to attract a lot of attention,  owning an ERA Prometheus is not about flaunting a 6 figure timepiece. 

It’s about - NO WATCH being beyond our grasp. 

It’s about - NO ONE telling us where our place is in life.

It’s about - NOTHING being impossible to get.

If you agree with that...then please, back our timepieces and support our kickstarter.
For those of you who want a completely UNBIASED review, here is one from critically acclaimed watch reviewer: the Time Teller:

On top of the Time Teller review, we've also been written about by the acclaimed Steve Huyton, who writes about all things design (Architecture, art, horology, design, etc) for Esquire Magazine and on his own blog: Total Design Reviews

He's a published author and reviewer of over 3 books on horology and design, including one that specifically covers 6-figure ultra-luxurious timepieces. Here's a link to just one of of his 3 published books on horology:

Being that he’s such an authority on all things design and especially since he’s reviewed other 6-figure tourbillon timepieces before, it’s an honor to receive a glowing review from him about the work we’re doing here at ERA. You can read his review on our ERA Prometheus here:
And right now Erik Slaven of Monochrome Watches, which is Europe’s LARGEST watch publication and #5 in the world is reviewing it and will have his review up in a few weeks.

Thickness: 12.72 mm

Accuracy: +/-25 seconds/day

Power Reserve:  ~42hours

Frequency: 28,800 vph

Jewels: 20

Case: Hand Finished 316L Stainless Steel 

Crystal: Ultra Scratch-resistant Sapphire Glass

Water Resistance: 5 ATM / 50 Meters

Movement: HZ3360A Tourbillon

Strap: Black Hornback Style 100% Leather With Midnight Blue Stitching

Weight: 3.53oz / 100 grams
column10:
>

ERA Timepieces set out with one singular goal -- to take haute horlogerie complications and make them accessible to the common man. The ERA Prometheus is our first model, which features a skeletonized HZ3360A Tourbillon movement with a GMT / Dual timezone complication on the left and a sun-moon complication on the right. ERA Timepiece's CEO is Michael Galarza, who started the company by partnering up with master watchmakers that he's met over the years through his luxury goods distribution business.

Our concept seems to have legs, as we raised $50K before even launching on Kickstarter, then another additional $175K in 1 week on Kickstarter, and then hit the $700K mark in less than 4 weeks after launching.

This proves that regular people want Tourbillons to be accessible to them. They want tourbillon timepieces that created by a real brand that understands how to do proper branding and all the details associated with that, yet isn't trying to price gouge because they need to spend the bulk of their advertising budget on celebrity sponsorship deals.

The inspiration of our branding as you can see from our logo is Art Nouveau, and centered around the time period of the Great Gatsby. So streamline, black chrome blue color palette, early Rimowa suitcases, etc.

Leading ERA Timepieces is Michael Galarza, who has been enthralled with timepieces since before he could read and write. One of his earliest memories is sitting in the corner of the room, with his ear to a pocketwatch that his father owned, listening to its rhythmic beating.

As an adult, he created a boutique luxury goods sourcing and distribution business that specialized in helping companies find the highest quality suppliers worldwide. From the farms that provide the wool that eventually go into a famous British brand's hallmark checkered cashmere scarves to the leatherworkers who produce leather bags for famous French and Italian brands, Michael has a knack for identifying the world's absolute best quality producers in emerging economies.

As he got to know the producers better, he came to a realization that the actual price he could get these same products made for was many times 10% or 5% of what the eventual retail markup was -- far far below what the famous luxury brands charged for them and much higher than the usual markups in standard wholesaling. He realized that the crazy markup was required for these brands to keep paying for celebrity endorsements and sponsoring global sporting events to try to increase brand strength.

The luxury watch segment of the market was especially egregious, as he got to know more master watchmakers and boutique horological shops that made turnkey watches for large Swiss conglomerates, who would use a loophole in the weakness of the trade directive term ""Swiss Made"" to just ship an engraved rotor from Switzerland to China, and then source and make 100% of the rest of the watch there, and then it would ship directly to its final point of sale.

And so he decided to see if there was a market for people who cared about receiving a quality timepiece without an overly inflated budget for marketing dollars, who wanted a true timepiece that was worth its value. And so he decided to create a quality dependable Tourbillon timepiece that would be under $1000 that would still have all the hallmarks found in higher end watches.

That was how the ERA prometheus was born.

column2:
>

 

What exactly is a tourbillon?

A tourbillon is the invention of famed watchmaker Abraham-Louis Breguet. It was made to counter the ill effects of gravity on the accuracy of his timepieces.

Breguet’s solution was to create an escapement that was constantly in a state of motion. Called the tourbillon (French for “whirlwind”), the escapement is housed in a rotating cage that, because of the constant motion, averages out the effect of gravity when the watch is stuck in different positions. 

They’ve remained common among the uppermost echelon of the watch market. Most Swiss-made examples start at around $40,000 and price tags often break the six-figure barrier. 

This is because tourbillons are arguably one the most difficult movement to make by hand. The tourbillon mechanism is tiny, weighing in at under a gram, and is usually crafted with more than 40 parts, finished by hand and made from lightweight metals like aluminum and titanium. They require a special set of tools and a lot of time to make. For example, just to make a single A. Lange &
column3:
Söhne Tourbograph Pour le Merite, its tourbillon chronograph movement takes 18 months.

I saw a tourbillon for $100 - what’s the difference?

Simply put, those aren’t tourbillons. 

These are scammers that are trying to pass off an open heart / flywheel off as a real tourbillon.  They are preying on the customer thinking they can see some simple gears and equating it with a tourbillon. What you are probably seeing is an attempt by a Chinese seller to pass a regular mechanical watch as a tourbillon-like watch.

They are allowed to advertise in such a confusing and possibly ill-intention manner because the platform (aliexpress, amazon, ebay, etc.) lets them.

There are no trusted brands who sell mechanical tourbillon watches for under $1000.

And that’s why we created ERA

Is your tourbillon real? How is it so much less expensive?

There is no such thing as a “real” or “fake” tourbillon. You either have the mastery to make it or you don’t. 

And most cannot - they are a feat of technology and creativity, both beautiful to look at and very difficult to make by hand. . 

That’s why tourbillon watches will always be pricey.

But by breaking through the cartel and monopoly, we are able to get you a world-class tourbillon for on average 99% OFF what you would pay for another similar Tourbillon.

Will I be forced to pay high VAT / Customs fees?

We strive to keep costs as low as possible for you, although you are responsible for any import tariffs.  We have the infrastructure necessary to customize the appropriate declared value so after consulting with your local import tax authority, send us a message though and we will surely be able to work with whatever value you need us to declare.

What about servicing for my watch?

Mechanical masterpieces like our Tourbillons have parts that move tens of thousands of times a day, and over a few years... the lubricating oil inside evaporates and parts wear down... and so servicing a mechanical timepiece every 3 years is absolutely essential.

Now if you're familiar with servicing any Swiss mechanical watch, you'll know they don't ever charge less than $450 and that's not counting shipping or other extra fees for parts etc. For many brands, servicing a Tourbillon starts between $1500 and $4000 USD.

We created ERA timepieces with a simple mission -- to make haute horological complication attainable for normal people. We knew our timepieces wouldn't be very attainable for normal people if we kept up this same tactic, and so that's why have an EXTREMELY lucrative flat-rate $150 servicing fee that covers parts, labor, and EXPRESS global DHL shipping with 100% insurance both TO our service center and back to you for just $150.

Just shoot us a message when you want your watch serviced, and we'll take care of the rest!

Technical Questions?

We are avid readers of watchuseek and consider ourselves watch nerds. We are very open to a healthy discussion regarding a myriad of topics like: movement, sensitivity, movement comparisons, tourbillon comparisons, price vs value, etc.

We only ask that you backup your claims with data or relevant technical images, because whenever we can - we will as well.
column4:
>

With a project of this scale, there are almost countless people we need to thank, because without their help: our project would never have came together. 

So special thanks to the many members of watchuseek.com for constantly taking the time to answer obscure questions. Ariel from ablogtowatch.com for his insightful articles, MHC for showing us the beautiful process of making a tourbillon, Watchfinder&
column5: Co for their insightful video analysis, and our beta users for all their feedback and reviews! We love you Jamal and you can buy more than one watch soon!!!

column1: Click Here To Pre-Order Your Timepiece While You Still Can!
Most Funded Tourbillon Watch & Most Funded NYC Watch Campaign IN HISTORY.

We all want millionaire watches. You know the kind.Watches so unique, they are instant conversation starters.Watches so expensive, they stun the room and make people whisper our name.Watches with that ONE thing that make them cost more than a house -- the Tourbillon.Put a tourbillon into any watch — the price explodes: Six Figures. Seven Figures. INSTANTLY.The world’s most expensive watches??No surprise - they are all tourbillons.  Want to buy a tourbillon for five figures? Good luck. The New York Times says that is almost impossible. Clearly tourbillon watches are out of reach for me and you, for nearly everyone. Yet...do they have to be? When you think about making a more inexpensive tourbillon, simply “cutting out the middlemen” or “eliminating manufacturer markup” won’t bring down the price of tourbillon watches. Those are overused marketing buzz words for making yet ANOTHER “affordable luxury” watch. This is harsh language but it needs to be said. Any brand that talks about “cutting middlemen” and selling true luxury watches “direct to consumer” is telling you a nice fairy tale. It sounds nice in practice but it isn't based in reality whatsoever. Why?  Because in reality: a basic minimal watch with a turnstile Miyota movement can NEVER be a luxury watch.It's putting lipstick on a pig. You are paying a “luxury” price for craftsmanship on par with a Walmart bargain bin watch.What you’re getting isn’t “affordable luxury”, you’re paying $270 for a fabricated story and $19 for a cheap watch.This isn't bringing you affordable luxury - it is robbing you. Fortunately, or unfortunately for us, we just saw that tourbillon watches really ARE 6 or 7 figures. Again if that sounds insane - I agree with you 100%. But what is even more insane, what will REALLY make you mad...is the reason they are so expensive. And the reason is all too familiar
column2: a small group is controlling nearly everything. There is actually a ""secret watch society” actively price gouging high-end timepieces and stopping us from wearing what we want.  To uncover this unfairness, we first need to see why tourbillon watches are intrinsically so valuable. Only then can we know and what is or isn’t fair to pay for them. Here’s why they will always be pricey...Manufacturing Precision In order to make a tourbillon, expert machinists use million dollar equipment like the Willemin 5-Axis. These machines give form and function to finest of raw materials. This machine transforms precious metals into the cases, bezels, fasteners, and dials of your tourbillon watch.Want an ultra high-end watch?  Then you need high-end watch parts.  And high-end watch parts can only come from high-end machines. A tourbillon cannot be built in an environment that is less than perfect. Every piece is made precise and accurate. The margin of error is only microns. But these are JUST the watch parts.We haven't even begun the Grand Ballet of Watch Assembly yet.100s Of Hours Of DetailBecause you see, after machining, these intricate parts are hand-worked. The attention each piece receives walks a fine line between obsession and passion. You don’t just have one watchmaker dedicated to making your timepiece. A small army of master horologists add hours...and hours - of laser focused, hand-crafted detail.And It takes 100s of painstaking hours to make ONE tourbillon. Yet hyper-focused eyes and minds are not enough. To successfully build a tourbillon timepiece, you need the most important ingredient of all.Watchmaking MasteryMaster watchmakers are the only ones capable of building a tourbillon. Only through years and years of training, practice, and learning can they tackle complications such as minute repeaters, grand sonnier, and the tourbillon.Because for these elite artisans, it isn’t just watchmaking. They approach their craft like its heart surgery. And this tourbillon assembly? That’s a HEART TRANSPLANT.If all this seems excessive, remember - NOTHING about a tourbillon watch is supposed to be “affordable” or “normal” or “accessible”.From the million dollar equipment, to the surgically precise watch partsFrom 100s of artisanal labor hours, to the world-class fingers of the horologists:A Tourbillon IS the supercar of watches, A marvel of engineering,And... expensive.But does it really have to be THAT expensive? Does it really have to be THAT ridiculously priced? We believe no watch should be beyond our grasp. ERA represents the first way to finally access ultra high end watches. We are the only solution to the question:How Do You Buy Millionaire Watches For Under $1000?Hopefully you are skeptical. Knowing how tourbillons are now made, how is it even remotely possible to buy them for 3 figures? Great instincts. Remember that watch “secret society” we mentioned earlier? The one purposely keeping you away from the watches you love, purposely holding you back. Lets expose them. See, the ultra-luxury watch brands are making fools out of you and me. We are being lied to and manipulated by a select group of corporations, AGAIN. Remember: we just saw that only elite watchmakers can build a tourbillon.But... the ultra-luxury brands control the world’s elite watchmakers.So, you want a tourbillon watch? No problem. You can get one through a luxury watch brand and they will charge you anywhere from $100,000 to even $1,000,000 dollars or more.Don’t like that price?Too bad.Who else is going to make the watch for you?  The luxury watch brands control the world’s elite watchmakers.If that sounds like an unfair monopoly or cartel -- you’re right. It Is But here at ERA, we want to finally break this monopoly and we are in a unique position to do so.Having first worked as luxury brand distributors, we got to see “behind the scenes” and how things worked in the watch industry.More importantly after years of networking and forming strategic partnerships:We got to know the same master watchmakers who build tourbillons for the luxury brand cartel. By partnering with these same master watchmakers, we broke through the cartel wall.  And together with these master watchmakers, we finally made the world’s first ever accessible tourbillon. In Greek mythology Prometheus stole fire from the Gods and gave it to mankind.He took from those with unlimited power, and shared a gift that was meant for all.Inspired by this timeless myth, we made a tourbillon watch attainable for all.Made EXACTLY like other tourbillon watches, the ERA Prometheus comes with a lower half, exposed mechanism.Here we see the balance wheel, pallet fork, hairspring: watchmaking virtuosity in full display.Other than the show-stopping Tourbillon, the ERA Prometheus has even more complications that you would expect from a 6-figure watch.Every timepiece is detailed and engraved with gears and other flourishes. Such as a 24 hour GMT Timer on the left and a dual revolving sun-moon dial on the right. All these mechanisms are housed behind beautiful sapphire crystal and a special made stainless steel body. As befitting for a watch of its caliber, the Prometheus also features a hornback leather croc style band that is stitched with premium midnight blue threading.Alternate Strap ColorsWe originally didn't want to offer brown bands with this particular model because we are extreme horological and design purists here, and brown doesn't usually go with the blues we have on the dial of our timepiece (earth tone palettes and cool ones usually don't go together).That being said, we still took some photos with some prototype sourced brown hornback croc bands and put them on our Instagram for fun awhile back.After so many of our fans wrote in wanting them, we took a hard look at our stance and we're pleased to announce we are going to give our customers what they want.In Total, we now have 5 colors to choose from, and 2 bezel finishes:

column1: Lastly on the back, each watch is engraved with a unique serial number. So your timepiece will be a limited edition and always, one of a kind.The finest timepieces must be stored in the finest way, so it's no surprise that we have a hand-crafted and polished lacquered wood box to house your legendary timepiece.And as amazing as it already looks -- this box shown here is actually just a prototype, the final version will be even more custom and stunning!We're proud to announce that we will be introducing other variants for those who simply must have the finest Tourbillon upgrade pick:  The ERA Prometheus Titan Edition

The ERA Prometheus Titan Edition is a special limited-edition versions that feature over 2.3 carats and over 78 gigantic diamonds that have been fused with the bezel and stretched around all surrounding metallic surfaces.It features a PLATINUM bezel and all the diamonds on both are natural Bright cut round GH colored diamonds with a clarity of VS1.The Titan Edition is meant for a real world Titan, like the current UNDEFEATED, UNDISPUTED WBA Super Bantemweight World Champion Ryan Burnett.  He is a huge fan of what we're doing at ERA and can be seen here wearing the ERA Prometheus Titan Edition with over 78 diamonds and 2.3 carats at his world title defense:But with such amazing timepieces, it's important to remember that while your tourbillon timepiece is bound to attract a lot of attention,  owning an ERA Prometheus is not about flaunting a 6 figure timepiece. It’s about - NO WATCH being beyond our grasp. It’s about - NO ONE telling us where our place is in life.It’s about - NOTHING being impossible to get.If you agree with that...then please, back our timepieces and support our kickstarter.
For those of you who want a completely UNBIASED review, here is one from critically acclaimed watch reviewer: the Time Teller:

And right now Erik Slaven of Monochrome Watches, which is Europe’s LARGEST watch publication and #5 in the world is reviewing it and will have his review up in a few weeks.
