GOD BLESS YOU ALL-  AND MAY ALL YOUR DREAMS COME TRUE AS WELL!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
One man's DayDream is another man's Day. When that Day comes, wear FUTR Footwear.
FUTR Footwear is a company started by 2 college students, in Los Angeles CA, that have a passion for success and a love for fashion.
It is natural then, that the philosophy of FUTR Footwear is to provide shoes that are both fashionable and compliment the lifestyle of young people striving to succeed.
The goal of FUTR Footwear is, for all products that bear its name, to make the person wearing them feel like success is nothing but guaranteed for them on the road ahead.
Simply put, FUTR Footwear is the story of a person that will make it.

The idea for FUTR Footwear was initially drafted up by Andre Marcarian. Before deciding to start FUTR Footwear, Andre was pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Business and Finance, working in downtown Los Angeles. Some people would already find that a busy enough schedule, but Andre felt that he still was not putting, what little was left of, his free time into something meaningful. And so, FUTR Footwear was thought of by Andre to make shoes that support, embrace, and compliment his lifestyle and the lifestyle of other driven individuals like him.
Armand Gharakhani | Head Designer and Consultant on Fashion Industry

After the concept of FUTR Footwear was completed, Andre needed a designer and partner. Of course this person had to not only be a good designer but also had to befit the FUTR Footwear culture of young success driven individuals. The perfect candidate came when Andre met Armand Gharakhani. Armand has been working for his parents' high fashion clothing company for years and is also in school pursuing a Bachelor's in Vehicle Design.

The First step taken to initiate the vision for FUTR Footwear was designing the very first shoe. Easy right? Sure! All that was needed was to draft a design, find a designer, find a manufacturer, drink coffee...lots of coffee, order a sample, network, and tell the world.
The first model designed by FUTR Footwear is the DayDreams. The name DayDreams is an homage to all the young people out there that begin their plan for success with a simple DayDream.
And so for FUTR Footwear, the DayDreams are the first step in their plan.

The creative process that went into designing the DayDreams started form the humble beginnings on notepads, when Andre was looking for a way to express the FutrFootwear culture he imagined, with a breakthrough shoe that could compliment the lifestyles of young motivated individuals.

As it turns out, Andre is more talented at the conceptual side of a creative process than drawing the idea out. This is when Armand joined the team and brought his skills and experience of both fashion and vehicle design into the mix.

Inspiration for the DayDreams come from many facets of a lifestyle befitting the FutrFootwear culture. Elements were taken from contemporary architecture, New York loft spaces, and even luxury vehicles.

The collaboration between Andre and Armand brought the notepad sketches along with the overall theme of the shoe, to the computer screen and software. The design was shown to fashion designers, professors of vehicle design, and even architecture grad students in brain-storming meetings for their insight and advice.

When the renderings of the first concepts were finalized they were sent out to a manufacture to produce a sample prototype. Designs were altered with testing of the prototype to increase both comfort, aesthetics, and quality. A new sample was ordered form the manufacturer with the adjustments and testing was conducted across all standards.
Along with designing, adjusting, and testing the prototype, branding for the logo and branding for FutrFootwear is developing in synch with exposure to social media and advertising outlets.
Here is the Production Process that has lead to the current prototype of the DayDreams:
• Receiving the sample, making adjustments and testing
• Final round of testing and minor adjustments.

The DayDreams were designed in-house and tested for quality, durability, comfort, and of course sexiness. This current prototype is fully functional and will look the same as the production models that will be ordered, with the exception of very minor changes such as changing the lace rings from silver to black.

The DayDreams were designed, for the FUTR Footwear culture, to be a shoe that could make many different statements. The shoes look perfect when worn casually, semi-formally, and even add a hint of funk when worn with your favorite suite.

The diamond stitching is inspired by the upholstery found in classic luxury cars, and has even made a reappearance into modern luxury cars which use the texture to trigger nostalgia and romanticism of high end car culture.
The Daydreams involve a combination of materials to produce a shoe that can make a statement in many different settings.
•  Leather | is the main material on the DayDreams and offers the luxurious feel and look that compliments the texture of the diamond stitching.
Suede |  trims on the DayDreams bring contrast of tones as well as the oh-so-smooth and sexy feel.
Rubber | may not be smooth or sexy, but is found on the soles of the DayDreams which are designed carefully to offer comfort and stability as you wear them.

For the first edition of DayDreams, they will only come in black with a dark red interior. Of course, other colors are definitely going to be introduced for the DayDreams, including some special colors for limited edition series. As for now, the black color serves as a good starting point because it is a very flexible and universal shade for complimenting most outfits and moods.

FUTR Footwear is designed for young motivated individuals. This motivation involves a very active lifestyle, whether it is running from meeting to meeting or spending hours working behind a computer. This is why the DayDreams have been tested and made sure that they can keep up with anyone's daily activities and still make them feel like they own the building.
The DayDreams will be available in ten USA Adult Male sizes ranging from 8.5-13.

The plans for manufacturing the final version of the DayDreams will involve dealing with an outside manufacturer. The firm that was chosen to produce the DayDreams was picked after a long process of interviewing, visting and examining multiple different manufacturers to ensure that the people making the DayDreams will meet strict standards. The standards that are expected of the manufacture are dedication to quality, commitment to ethical work standards, uses of environmentally friendly processes, timely delivery of the product, and of course, awesome people  to build a lasting relationship with.

Out of many manufacturers that were observed, the one that met all standards with excellence was chosen and collaboration has begun with the prototypes. The sole responsibility of the manufacturer at this point is to be ready to start producing orders of the DayDreams and delivering them to FutrFootwear

Since Andre and Armand both live their life's based on the FUTR Footwear culture of working towards success, they've spent close to a year testing the DayDreams on their own feet while they were up and about. Many adjustments were made until the DayDreams met the standard that was expected of them.
Do We Really Know What We Are Doing? | Experience and Commitment

FUTR Footwear's Head Designer and Consultant on the Fashion Industry  has worked for years at Nikole Bakti, a large women's formal wear company based in Los Angeles, and the vision and advice he has brought to the table has helped FUTR Footwear become a ""new kid"" that knows his way around the block.

Can we really pull this off? Of course we can! It is expected that making FUTR Footwear the perfect shoe company for young people striving for success, is no easy task but it is a task that we live and breath. The very culture that represents FUTR Footwear is the same culture that will ensure its own success.
What Comes In The Future? | The Laboratory
Along with researching, testing, and improving the current DayDreams, FUTR Footwear has already come up with several special edition DayDreams that are in testing.

A second model is also being developed. The design will still implement the FUTR Footwear culture, however the look of the next shoe will not be similar the DayDreams, instead they will have other elements that are a little more ""extreme"" in nature.
Essentially the funds are a simple aggregate of what is needed to make the first orders and offer a small cushion of security against time.
Add it all up and we get a total cost of $13,500
The Perks have been structured so that they can, of course, help us but also offer you kick-ass deals and merchandise along with the limitless love and gratitude from FUTR Footwear.

We do not own any ships, so we encourage loose lips. We would love if you could spread the word about FUTR Footwear through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Face-To-Face Conversations (Last one is not a website, so don't google it).
And of course do not hesitate to reach out to us at info@futrfootwear.com.

Our photographer and videographer is the amazing Orbel Sarkisian and his studio MYNT Photography. His vision, energy, and commitment fit right into the FUTR Footwear culture and was crucial in this project.

This is not our first time up to bat. We have years of experience in the fashion industry and have made great efforts to network and build solid relationships with vendors, distributers, and promoters. We know what potential mistakes to look out for and how to avoid them.
However we realize that everyone can trip up, us included, and it is this awareness and readiness for overcoming issues that makes us confident in FUTR Footwear.

The timing of execution is our biggest risk. We project that in order to execute FUTR Footwear successfully, we must order the product in time, shipped to us, and get the shoes ready for shipping to customers. Thankfully this issue of timing is a priority in our plan and we have taken appropriate steps to create a schedule for avoiding any delays.

Can we really pull this off? Of course we can! It is expected that making FUTR Footwear the perfect shoe company for young people striving for success, is no easy task but it is a task that we live and breath. The very culture that represents FUTR Footwear is the same culture that will ensure its own success.
What Comes In The Future? | The Laboratory
Along with researching, testing, and improving the current DayDreams, FUTR Footwear has already come up with several special edition DayDreams that are in testing.

A second model is also being developed. The design will still implement the FUTR Footwear culture, however the look of the next shoe will not be similar the DayDreams, instead they will have other elements that are a little more ""extreme"" in nature.
Essentially the funds are a simple aggregate of what is needed to make the first orders and offer a small cushion of security against time.
Add it all up and we get a total cost of $13,500
Sounds Awesome, What Now? | Getting Involved.
The Perks have been structured so that they can, of course, help us but also offer you kick-ass deals and merchandise along with the limitless love and gratitude from FUTR Footwear.

We do not own any ships, so we encourage loose lips. We would love if you could spread the word about FUTR Footwear through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Face-To-Face Conversations (Last one is not a website, so don't google it).
And of course do not hesitate to reach out to us at info@futrfootwear.com.

Our photographer and videographer is the amazing Orbel Sarkisian and his studio MYNT Photography. His vision, energy, and commitment fit right into the FUTR Footwear culture and was crucial in this project.

This is not our first time up to bat. We have years of experience in the fashion industry and have made great efforts to network and build solid relationships with vendors, distributers, and promoters. We know what potential mistakes to look out for and how to avoid them.
However we realize that everyone can trip up, us included, and it is this awareness and readiness for overcoming issues that makes us confident in FUTR Footwear.

The timing of execution is our biggest risk. We project that in order to execute FUTR Footwear successfully, we must order the product in time, shipped to us, and get the shoes ready for shipping to customers. Thankfully this issue of timing is a priority in our plan and we have taken appropriate steps to create a schedule for avoiding any delays.",11.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hello everyone, my name is Michelle Poirier, and I am a jewelry artisan from Prince Edward Island (that's Canada's smallest province for anyone who doesn't know).  My passion is creating chainmaille jewelry for men and women in styles ranging from elegant to geeky, to Gothic :)

I'm looking to grow my business, but as with any business, growth = cost.  I need more supplies to make more jewelry, more displays to put them on, both of which cost money.

I've decided to launch an Indiegogo campaign to help me with these costs.  With the boost I hope to get from this campaign, I hope to expand my business.

I have been running Eternal Elf Creations for six years now.  I started out barely making any money, but my passion drove me to create better products and I am finally making my living by my work, and I hope to keep doing that :)  I just need a little help to afford new supplies and displays.

Want to see the rest of my work?  Please check out my online store at: http://www.artfire.com/ext/shop/studio/eternalelfcreations
I ship worldwide.

What I Need

I'm hoping to get $1000 in total,
$700 will go towards new materials to make jewelry with.
$100 will cover the fees for Indiegogo

Of course, if I manage to go over my goal, I have lots more designs I have in mind that I want to make, so the money will go towards even more materials so that I can be a busy, busy beaver for months to come :D
Byzantine earrings, bracelets, and/or necklaces, according to whichever reward level you choose :)
Earrings will be 1 inch long, and earrings hooks are nickle free.

Bracelets are your choice of size, up to 8 inches long max.  If you are buying this as a gift, and aren't sure what size to get, 6.5 inch is the most common wrist size.  Bracelets have a 1 inch extender chain.
Necklaces are 8 inches long with a 3 inch extender chain, letting it adjust between 18-21 inches.
You get to choose your jewelry's colors! Go for elegant, colorful, fun, or Gothic colors, it's up to you!
silver, black, red, orange, yellow, gold, bronze, champagne, black ice, green, seafoam green, blue, sky blue, purple, lavender, rose, white.
If I go over my campaign goal I will add new reward levels for different styles as well :)
I work hard on my jewelry and have been doing this for six years so you will be getting quality pieces.
If I don't reach my goal, whatever amount I make will go towards buying new supplies, and paying Indiegogo fees (9% of total raised).

column2:
Challenges-I have set the reward levels to a time when I know I will for sure have your items in the mail.  If by chance this campaign does super amazing, I have a friend who chainmailles as well who has agreed to pitch in and help me get everything done on time.

I will keep everyone informed with campaign updates.

column6: >Interested in buying a Scrubba Wash Pack?

column1:
The Scrubba Wash Pack can now be purchased online at www.thescrubba.com 
or if you are in Australia visit www.thescrubba.com.au

column3:
>This daypack is also a washing machine!

In 2012, we first unpacked the Scrubba® Wash Bag with outstanding support from the Indiegogo crowd. We are now excited to bring you a new product, the Scrubba™ Wash Pack.

column1:
As an avid traveler Ash Newland, the founder of the Scrubba Wash Bag, was motivated to evolve his concept further and develop a product that would be the most versatile travel must have, continuing to help people travel clean, light and free.

So, whether you are seeing the sites of Paris, kayaking the waters in Hawaii or climbing to the peak of Mt Fuji, the Scrubba Wash Pack allows you to go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean.

column3:
/>

The Scrubba Wash Pack is your ultra-functional daypack featuring a flexible internal washboard with hundreds of nobules that give you a machine quality clothes wash in a matter of minutes.

column1: It has adjustable straps allowing you to wear it as a backpack or messenger-style sling bag, a waist strap and easy access pockets on the shoulder straps and pouch, plus an abrasion resistant back panel for added durability.

You no longer need to travel with a daypack, a dry bag and dirty clothes. The Scrubba Wash Pack is your versatile and weatherproof pack by day and your environmentally friendly and effective washing machine at night.

“Most travellers pack a daypack already, why not pack a lightweight one
 that is versatile, weatherproof and can wash your clothes!”
- Ash Newland
column2: >As seen on:
column4: >Go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean

column2:
>It's more than just a daypack or dry bag

What sets the Scrubba Wash Pack apart from other lightweight daypacks and dry bags, is it can also wash your clothes.

campers have experienced firsthand the quality wash our internal flexible washboard delivers as part of the Scrubba Wash Bag.  The flexible washboard results from a fusion of old and new technology, bringing the washboard into the 21st century.

With hundreds of nobules incorporated into the Scrubba Wash Pack, you have a machine-quality clothes wash in a matter of minutes.
column3: >7 easy steps to clean clothes

column4: '>Add 2-4 litres of water, items of clothing, a few drops of washing liquid (Body wash or shampoo also works)

column5: '>Seal the Scrubba Wash Pack but expelling some air and rolling down the top of the pack.

column4: '>Expel even more air from the Scrubba Wash Pack through the valve.
'>Place the Scrubba Wash Pack on a table or the floor.
column7: '>Rub the clothes against the flexible washboard from the outside of the Scrubba Wash Pack for 30 seconds to 3 minutes.

column4: '>Empty clothes and dirty water from the Scrubba Wash Pack.

column5: '>Your clothes are now clean, so repack your Scrubba Wash Pack and off you go.

column2:
>What is the Scrubba Wash Pack made from?

The Scrubba wash pack is made from a strong but lightweight 40 denier nylon fabric with an abrasion resistant 210 denier nylon fabric base and back panel.

column1: The internal Scrubba washboard, viewing window and lining are made from high-quality polyether urethane to provide resistance to hydrolysis (water damage), good chemical and microbial resistance and low-temperature flexibility.
As part of our campaign perks we are offering a Scrubba Wash &

column2:
>Help us to help people Travel Clean, Light and Free

To make the Scrubba Wash Pack the ultimate travel item we need your help.

column1: Funding raised from our Indiegogo campaign will go in part to the production and delivery of our Scrubba Wash Pack, so click on one of the perks to the right to get a Scrubba Wash Pack at a great price and join the Scrubba Wash Pack crowd of people who go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean.
You can also help us spread the word about the Scrubba Wash Pack with friends and family who like to travel. If you have any questions, comments or suggestions:

Also don’t forget to like and follow us for all the latest information on all things Scrubba.

column1:
“We had such a great experience with crowdfunding when we were
making the Scrubba Wash Bag. As well as raising the money to get the 
product off the ground, it helped us build a real community. 
We’re looking to Indiegogo to help make this new one a reality,”
-Ash Newland
Thank you for supporting the Scrubba Wash Pack. Please take a few minutes to help us spread the word through email and social media to earn referral rewards.

Here’s how it works:
You earn $10.00 $20.00 USD in Scrubba credits towards our campaign every time one of your referrals purchases a Scrubba Wash Pack! 

Once the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund off your purchase, (up to the purchase price).

column2:
>An example of how it works:
If 5 of your friends purchase a Scrubba Wash Pack then you will be credited $100.00 USD. That’s right… you can get yourself a Scrubba Wash Pack for free by sharing our campaign.

>

Click HERE to find out more on how to use your unique code and be part of our referral rewards program.
>Thank you for your support - The Scrubba Team

column1: Free international shipping is included with the perks. For Australia, the US, Canada and European countries shipping is estimated at 5-20 working days.  For shipping to other destinations, shipping may take several weeks though we anticipate most orders will be delivered within around 20 working days.

All orders will be shipped internationally so please bear in mind that import fees and duties may be payable and are the responsibility of the purchaser.  Please inquire with your local customs authority for fees that may be applicable.

The Scrubba Wash Pack is an innovative product of Calibre8 Pty Ltd.  Patented in Australia and New Zealand.  Patent pending internationally.  The word Scrubba, the Scrubba logo, the slogan 'travel clean, light and free' are trademarks of Calibre8 Pty Ltd.
The logo looks different in the videos and images.  Why is this and how will the final product look like?

The Scrubba Wash Pack has been an 18 month project and we have had several prototypes along the way as the product (and the logo) has evolved.  The video and photos show some of the different prototypes along the way but your product has a more discreet and cool looking logo.  It will look more like this image:

How will I benefit from a Scrubba Wash Pack?
Being able to wash clothes anywhere, anytime means that you can pack less clothes when you travel and wash them for free.  You will save on bag fees at the airport and laundry fees, which we all know can be exorbitant when traveling.  You no longer need to buy a day pack or dry bag as the Scrubba Wash Pack performs these functions.  With the Scrubba Wash Pack, you really can follow the Scrubba mantra and travel clean, light and free.
Using your referral program, my Scrubba credits exceed my purchase price.  Does this mean I have made money?

Thanks for spreading the word and congratulations on getting your Scrubba product for free.  Credits above the purchase price are forfeited but before the campaign ends you can increase your purchase using the credits.

For Example: You pledged $99 for a Scrubba Wash Pack and then 15 of your referrals made purchases so you have $150 of credit.  After the campaign we will send you a refund for the $99.  However if you pledge for a second Scrubba Wash Pack, you can use the rest of the credit and you would have only paid $48 for 2 Scrubba Wash Packs.  For full details of our referral program, please click HERE.

How does the Scrubba Wash Pack wash clothes?
The Scrubba Wash Pack works on the same principle as an old-fashion washboard.  Clothing is cleaned by rubbing them against the washboard.  As opposed to an old-fashion washboard, the Scrubba Wash Pack is lightweight, compact and self-contained (you no longer need a bucket or basin).  Furthermore, the Scrubba Wash Pack can minimise exposure of the user to cleaning materials.  Independent testing by one of Australasia’s leading washing machine manufacturers has shown that 3 minutes of rubbing in the Scrubba Wash Pack provides a machine quality wash.
Do I wear the Scrubba Wash Pack when washing clothes?

While that sounds pretty cool, it would be pretty heavy and the clothes wouldn't rub against the washboard enough to clean clothes.  See the question above for how to wash clothes in the Scrubba Wash Pack.

How much clothing can be washed at once?
Generally, the Scrubba Wash Pack is effective at cleaning a couple of T-shirts, a couple of pairs of underwear and a couple of pairs of socks at once (e.g. 2 days worth of summer clothes).  While the Scrubba Wash Pack can hold more clothing, the washing efficiency may be reduced if too much clothing is added.

How large is the Scrubba Wash Pack?
The Scrubba Wash Pack when laid flat measures approximately 54 cm x 32 cm (21.3 x 12.6 inches).  You can pack it in your travel bag flat, compactly rolled up or use it to organise your clothes and separate them from your other travel gear.

How does the valve work?
Our air valves are double closure air valves.  The first closure is the cap, while the second is a deformable base component.  In its normal position, the deformable base component will not let air out of the valve.  To let air out simply open the cap and squeeze the sides of the valve.  This will force the base component open at the slit.  Squeezing the valve from the outside while watching from the inside will help to determine the best finger positioning that enables the air flow channel to open.

What's the quickest way to expel air from the Scrubba Wash Pack?
We know that the valve on the Scrubba Wash Pack is pretty small.  The reason for this is to keep the Scrubba Wash Pack compact, light and flexible.  However, this does mean that expelling a large amount of air through the valve can take some time.  You can quicken the process by laying the bag down and gently pressing on it to remove most of the air before you seal the bag.  After sealing the bag you can get rid of any remaining excess air by opening and squeezing the valve.

What is the capacity of the Scrubba Wash Pack?
The total volume of the Scrubba Wash Pack is around 13L (~3 gal).  However, as the washing method requires you to seal the bag and rub the clothes against the washboard from the outside, the optimal working volume is around 3-4L (~1gal).  We have markings on the front of the Scrubba Wash Pack to help you add the right amount of water and clothes.

How long does the Scrubba Wash Pack take to clean a load of clothing?
For most clothing, simply rubbing them against the washboard from outside the bag for 20-40 seconds is sufficient to remove oils, dirt and odour from the clothing.  For a machine quality wash, rub the clothes for 3 minutes and use a quality laundry liquid.  For stubborn stains, the clothing may be rubbed for longer and/or the clothing may be allowed to soak in the Scrubba Wash Pack for 2-3 hours.  If soaking clothing in the Scrubba Wash Pack, ensure the Scrubba Wash Pack is stored upright (e.g. seal facing upwards) to prevent water wicking through the seal.

Can I use hot water in the Scrubba Wash Pack?
Due to the waterproof lining in the bag, we recommend that water no hotter than 50°C (122°F) be used.  Warm water (e.g. 30°C – 50°C or 85°F – 122°F ) can assist the washing process. Simply put, if it is too hot to hold your hands in, the water is too hot for the Scrubba Wash Pack.

What cleaning product should be used with the Scrubba Wash Pack?
A variety of detergents have been tested in the Scrubba Wash Pack with success. We've found the use of liquid detergents to be more efficient due to the extra time it takes to dissolve solid detergents (powders, leaves, etc.). Using a liquid enables active suds immediately, reducing the overall time required for rubbing out a wash.

While the Scrubba Wash Pack has been made with a highly chemically resistant form of urethane, use of very harsh bleaches may reduce its longevity. We do not recommend soaking with such products in the Scrubba Wash Pack for prolonged periods

We are conscious of the fact that every traveler has different priorities. For some travelers, weight is the most important factor in packing, so a single product that can perform multiple tasks is beneficial. A small dollop of 3-in-1 bodywash-shampoo-shave liquid may be used in the Scrubba Wash Pack and we have found this to work well in refreshing clothes.

If you don't mind carrying extra products, then packing a very small (~25-30ml) bottle of washing liquid (e.g. Omo or the like) is a good idea when traveling. Washing liquids are generally the most efficient for cleaning your clothes, as they are purpose designed for removing oils and dirt from fabrics. You really only need to use the smallest amount (probably a few ml per bag load) as washing liquids are generally highly concentrated.

For environmentally conscious travelers, there are a number of bio-washing liquids on the market (often released by outdoor brands and available at camping stores) that are better for the environment (e.g. phosphate free). These probably fall somewhere between using bodywash/shampoo and a washing liquid in efficiency but are much better for use in the back country.

You can test for quantities of different cleaning products in the Scrubba Wash Pack by checking the amount of suds visible through the clear section of the bag. If you still have suds after 30 seconds of rubbing, then you can probably reduce the amount of product for the next batch. Optimising the amount is not only better for the environment, but will also minimise the amount of rinsing required.

Why isn't there a loop for hanging the Scrubba Wash Pack to dry?
As we recommend turning  the Scrubba Wash Pack inside out after use to dry, the loop would need to be added to the inside of the bag, which would affect the washing performance.  When you turn the bag inside out, you can make good use of the clips to hang the inverted bag to dry.  This is shown in the following image:

column4: '>How do I reduce water wicking out of the seal?

column1: How do I reduce water wicking out of the seal?While our fabric and the seams of the Scrubba Wash Pack are waterproof, the roll-down-and-clip closure can allow a small amount of water to wick through over time.  This can be minimised by rolling the top down as tightly as possible and at least 4-5 times.  When tightly rolled, water typically won't wick through the top for at least 20 minutes, which should be a sufficient amount of time to perform a standard Scrubba wash.  If you position the buckles of the roll-down-and-clip seal to face upwards, this will also reduce wicking.

How long will the Scrubba Wash Pack last and how do I care for it?
The Scrubba Wash Pack is designed to last and you can take steps to ensure a prolonged life.  This includes avoiding contact with sharp objects which could puncture the Scrubba Wash Pack, avoiding contact with strong bleaches, abrasive surfaces and high temperatures (less than 50°C (122°F) is fine).  For good hygiene we also recommend turning the Scrubba Wash Pack inside out to allow the bag to dry.

Is there a warranty on the Scrubba Wash Pack?
Is there a warranty on the Scrubba Wash Pack? Yes.  To the original owner,  our company, Calibre8 Pty Ltd, provides a guarantee against defects in materials and craftsmanship. If your product fails due to a defect, we will replace, repair or refund it at our discretion.  While manufacturing defects are rare, the occasional bad egg can sometimes make it past our dedicated quality control inspection team.  If there is a defect in the materials or craftsmanship, you will realise fairly quickly and all you need to do is email us at info@thescrubba.com and we will work with you to make it right.  

If you are purchasing a Scrubba Wash Pack before a trip, we suggest that you test the Scrubba Wash Pack before you leave as there are some pretty remote parts to the world that can make replacing the bag difficult.

Can the Scrubba Wash Pack be used on all clothing?
The Scrubba Wash Pack can be used on most forms of clothing.  While clothing made of thick materials such as denim jeans may be washed in the Scrubba Wash Pack, it may be necessary to open the bag and rotate the jeans to ensure sufficient contact between the whole jeans and the washboard.  Care needs to be taken for clothing with zips or buckles, which could potentially damage the internal coating of the Scrubba Wash Pack.

Will the Scrubba Wash Pack damage my clothing?
Independent testing by one of Australasia’s leading washing machine manufacturers has shown that the Scrubba Wash Pack is gentler on clothing that washing machines and on par with handwashing.  However, as all washing techniques cause some wear on clothes, users should always follow the washing instructions on their clothing.

Can my Scrubba Wash Pack be repaired?
It sure can and we are planning to include a repair patch that is really simple to use. The repair patch is made from the same type of fabric as the front of the Scrubba Wash Pack and has a purpose designed urethane adhesive.  Simply clean the area of the Scrubba Wash Pack that needs to be repaired, cut the patch to size, remove the backing of the repair patch and apply the patch to the shiny side of the fabric (the inside of the bag).  Press patch firmly over the repair area and allow the adhesive to cure for 4 hours before use.
Alternately, a bicycle tyre puncture repair kit (from your local bicycle store) or inflatable mattress/tent repair kit (most camping stores sell this) may be used.

How do I dry my clothing?
Great question.  You can simply wring out the clothes and hang them to dry or use the Scrubba wash &
column2: dry pack, which includes a large Scrubba travel towel, inflatable hangers and pegless clothesline.  After rinsing the clothing, lay them on the Scrubba towel.  Roll the towel up and press down on the towel as hard as you can.  This will transfer much of the residual water from the clothing to the towel.

column1: What do I do with the dirty water if I am camping or trekking?

If you use the Scrubba Wash Pack in the countryside, we recommend using an environmentally friendly laundry liquid to minimise potential damage to the local ecosystem.  Most camping stores sell a range of eco laundry liquids.  If washing near a water source (e.g. a river, stream, lake, etc.), we recommend that dirty water be tipped out at least 30 metres (100 feet) from the water source to prevent pollution.

How long are the shoulder and waist straps?
Each of the shoulder straps are adjustable between around 55 cm to 105 cm [21-41 inches] (with an additional 40 cm [16 inches] between the anchor points) and the waist strap is adjustable between around 47 cm and 90 cm [18.5-35 inches] (with an additional 15cm [6 inches] between the anchor points). If you feel you may need longer straps, please contact us and we will see what we can do.

What is the purpose of the waist strap and pouch?
The waist strap functions to hold the pouch, which has convenient pockets large enough for most smart phones and passports, making it great for use at the airport.  For those who are more active, the waist strap also assists in keeping the Scrubba Wash Pack tight against the body, which can be important for active pursuits such as jogging and hiking to minimise the bag bouncing around.

Why would I buy this instead of a Scrubba wash bag?
The Scrubba wash bag is the world’s smallest and lightest washing machine for travel and camping.  If you don’t need a lightweight day pack, then the Scrubba wash bag may be more suitable for you and they are available globally at thescrubba.com and thescrubba.com.au (for Australians).  However, if like most people you pack a daypack in your backpack or suitcase when you travel, then you will love the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Not only is it a lightweight, weatherproof and versatile day pack, but at the end of the day you can still wash your clothes in just minutes.

What if I only like messenger-style sling bags?
No worries at all.  We know people like to wear bags differently, which is why the Scrubba Wash Pack has been designed to be extremely versatile.  If you don’t like the waist strap, simply un-clip it – it only takes seconds.  If you don’t want to wear it like a backpack, just unclip one of the shoulder straps and adjust the length of the remaining shoulder strap.  Now you have a sling bag. It really is that easy.

column2:
Dry Pack?
If you like your clean clothes to also be dry then you may need it.  Just kidding.  It is possible and quite easy to dry clothes after washing them in the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Simply wring them out and find somewhere to hang them.  Where the Scrubba Wash &
column3: Dry Pack comes in handy is that it includes a huge travel towel that can accelerate the drying process by par drying the clothes before you hang them on the inflatable hangers or pegless clothesline that are included in the Wash &amp

column1: I'm from the media and want to run a feature on the Scrubba Wash Pack.  How do I get more information?
Thanks for your interest in spreading the word about the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Please send us an email to info@thescrubba.com and we will provide you with our media pack.
Go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean with the Scrubba Wash Pack.

As an avid traveler Ash Newland, the founder of the Scrubba Wash Bag, was motivated to evolve his concept further and develop a product that would be the most versatile travel must have, continuing to help people travel clean, light and free.So, whether you are seeing the sites of Paris, kayaking the waters in Hawaii or climbing to the peak of Mt Fuji, the Scrubba Wash Pack allows you to go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean.
The Scrubba Wash Pack is your ultra-functional daypack featuring a flexible internal washboard with hundreds of nobules that give you a machine quality clothes wash in a matter of minutes.

It has adjustable straps allowing you to wear it as a backpack or messenger-style sling bag, a waist strap and easy access pockets on the shoulder straps and pouch, plus an abrasion resistant back panel for added durability.

You no longer need to travel with a daypack, a dry bag and dirty clothes. The Scrubba Wash Pack is your versatile and weatherproof pack by day and your environmentally friendly and effective washing machine at night.“Most travellers pack a daypack already, why not pack a lightweight one that is versatile, weatherproof and can wash your clothes!”- Ash NewlandAs seen on:Go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean
Features of the Scrubba Wash Pack
It's more than just a daypack or dry bagWhat sets the Scrubba Wash Pack apart from other lightweight daypacks and dry bags, is it can also wash your clothes.

Tens of thousands of travelers & campers have experienced firsthand the quality wash our internal flexible washboard delivers as part of the Scrubba Wash Bag.  The flexible washboard results from a fusion of old and new technology, bringing the washboard into the 21st century.With hundreds of nobules incorporated into the Scrubba Wash Pack, you have a machine-quality clothes wash in a matter of minutes. 7 easy steps to clean clothes
Step 1: FillAdd 2-4 litres of water, items of clothing, a few drops of washing liquid (Body wash or shampoo also works)
Step 2: Roll & ClipSeal the Scrubba Wash Pack but expelling some air and rolling down the top of the pack.
Step 3: DeflateExpel even more air from the Scrubba Wash Pack through the valve.
Step 4: RubPlace the Scrubba Wash Pack on a table or the floor.Rub the clothes against the flexible washboard from the outside of the Scrubba Wash Pack for 30 seconds to 3 minutes.
Step 5: RinseEmpty clothes and dirty water from the Scrubba Wash Pack.Rinse the clothing with fresh water.
Step 6: DryHang the clothing to dry
Step 7: Pack & GoYour clothes are now clean, so repack your Scrubba Wash Pack and off you go.
What is the Scrubba Wash Pack made from?The Scrubba wash pack is made from a strong but lightweight 40 denier nylon fabric with an abrasion resistant 210 denier nylon fabric base and back panel.

The internal Scrubba washboard, viewing window and lining are made from high-quality polyether urethane to provide resistance to hydrolysis (water damage), good chemical and microbial resistance and low-temperature flexibility.  Stretch Goals
As part of our campaign perks we are offering a Scrubba Wash & Dry pack.  This pack contains a Scrubba Wash Pack and other travel essentials.
What's in a Scrubba Wash & Dry pack?
Scrubba Packing CellGreat for storing smaller items within your Scrubba Wash Pack.
Lightweight with a transparent front window, so you can easily see what it contains
Scrubba Travel TowelPerfect for partially drying clothes after washing them in your Scrubba Wash Pack and big enough to be used at the beach or to dry off after a shower.
Scrubba Travel Clothes LineNo pegs required this clothes line is perfect for hanging your clothes out to dry.
Can be hung with the use of hooks or suction caps
Scrubba Inflatable Coat HangersGreat to hang clothing to dry or to keep wrinkle free.
Lightweight and compact at only 32g (1oz) each.
Help us to help people Travel Clean, Light and FreeTo make the Scrubba Wash Pack the ultimate travel item we need your help.

Funding raised from our Indiegogo campaign will go in part to the production and delivery of our Scrubba Wash Pack, so click on one of the perks to the right to get a Scrubba Wash Pack at a great price and join the Scrubba Wash Pack crowd of people who go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean.

You can also help us spread the word about the Scrubba Wash Pack with friends and family who like to travel. If you have any questions, comments or suggestions: Email us at: Info@thescrubba.comAlso don’t forget to like and follow us for all the latest information on all things Scrubba.

“We had such a great experience with crowdfunding when we weremaking the Scrubba Wash Bag. As well as raising the money to get the product off the ground, it helped us build a real community. We’re looking to Indiegogo to help make this new one a reality,”-Ash Newland
Thank you for supporting the Scrubba Wash Pack. Please take a few minutes to help us spread the word through email and social media to earn referral rewards.

Here’s how it works:You earn $10.00 $20.00 USD in Scrubba credits towards our campaign every time one of your referrals purchases a Scrubba Wash Pack!  Once the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund off your purchase, (up to the purchase price).

An example of how it works:If 5 of your friends purchase a Scrubba Wash Pack then you will be credited $100.00 USD. That’s right… you can get yourself a Scrubba Wash Pack for free by sharing our campaign.
Click HERE to find out more on how to use your unique code and be part of our referral rewards program.
Thank you for your support - The Scrubba Team

Free international shipping is included with the perks. For Australia, the US, Canada and European countries shipping is estimated at 5-20 working days.  For shipping to other destinations, shipping may take several weeks though we anticipate most orders will be delivered within around 20 working days.

All orders will be shipped internationally so please bear in mind that import fees and duties may be payable and are the responsibility of the purchaser.  Please inquire with your local customs authority for fees that may be applicable.

The Scrubba Wash Pack is an innovative product of Calibre8 Pty Ltd.  Patented in Australia and New Zealand.  Patent pending internationally.  The word Scrubba, the Scrubba logo, the slogan 'travel clean, light and free' are trademarks of Calibre8 Pty Ltd.
The logo looks different in the videos and images.  Why is this and how will the final product look like?

The Scrubba Wash Pack has been an 18 month project and we have had several prototypes along the way as the product (and the logo) has evolved.  The video and photos show some of the different prototypes along the way but your product has a more discreet and cool looking logo.  It will look more like this image:

How will I benefit from a Scrubba Wash Pack?Being able to wash clothes anywhere, anytime means that you can pack less clothes when you travel and wash them for free.  You will save on bag fees at the airport and laundry fees, which we all know can be exorbitant when traveling.  You no longer need to buy a day pack or dry bag as the Scrubba Wash Pack performs these functions.  With the Scrubba Wash Pack, you really can follow the Scrubba mantra and travel clean, light and free.
Using your referral program, my Scrubba credits exceed my purchase price.  Does this mean I have made money?

Thanks for spreading the word and congratulations on getting your Scrubba product for free.  Credits above the purchase price are forfeited but before the campaign ends you can increase your purchase using the credits.

For Example: You pledged $99 for a Scrubba Wash Pack and then 15 of your referrals made purchases so you have $150 of credit.  After the campaign we will send you a refund for the $99.  However if you pledge for a second Scrubba Wash Pack, you can use the rest of the credit and you would have only paid $48 for 2 Scrubba Wash Packs.  For full details of our referral program, please click HERE.

How does the Scrubba Wash Pack wash clothes?The Scrubba Wash Pack works on the same principle as an old-fashion washboard.  Clothing is cleaned by rubbing them against the washboard.  As opposed to an old-fashion washboard, the Scrubba Wash Pack is lightweight, compact and self-contained (you no longer need a bucket or basin).  Furthermore, the Scrubba Wash Pack can minimise exposure of the user to cleaning materials.  Independent testing by one of Australasia’s leading washing machine manufacturers has shown that 3 minutes of rubbing in the Scrubba Wash Pack provides a machine quality wash.
Do I wear the Scrubba Wash Pack when washing clothes?

While that sounds pretty cool, it would be pretty heavy and the clothes wouldn't rub against the washboard enough to clean clothes.  See the question above for how to wash clothes in the Scrubba Wash Pack.

How much clothing can be washed at once?Generally, the Scrubba Wash Pack is effective at cleaning a couple of T-shirts, a couple of pairs of underwear and a couple of pairs of socks at once (e.g. 2 days worth of summer clothes).  While the Scrubba Wash Pack can hold more clothing, the washing efficiency may be reduced if too much clothing is added.

How large is the Scrubba Wash Pack?The Scrubba Wash Pack when laid flat measures approximately 54 cm x 32 cm (21.3 x 12.6 inches).  You can pack it in your travel bag flat, compactly rolled up or use it to organise your clothes and separate them from your other travel gear.

How does the valve work?Our air valves are double closure air valves.  The first closure is the cap, while the second is a deformable base component.  In its normal position, the deformable base component will not let air out of the valve.  To let air out simply open the cap and squeeze the sides of the valve.  This will force the base component open at the slit.  Squeezing the valve from the outside while watching from the inside will help to determine the best finger positioning that enables the air flow channel to open.

What's the quickest way to expel air from the Scrubba Wash Pack?We know that the valve on the Scrubba Wash Pack is pretty small.  The reason for this is to keep the Scrubba Wash Pack compact, light and flexible.  However, this does mean that expelling a large amount of air through the valve can take some time.  You can quicken the process by laying the bag down and gently pressing on it to remove most of the air before you seal the bag.  After sealing the bag you can get rid of any remaining excess air by opening and squeezing the valve.

What is the capacity of the Scrubba Wash Pack?The total volume of the Scrubba Wash Pack is around 13L (~3 gal).  However, as the washing method requires you to seal the bag and rub the clothes against the washboard from the outside, the optimal working volume is around 3-4L (~1gal).  We have markings on the front of the Scrubba Wash Pack to help you add the right amount of water and clothes.

How long does the Scrubba Wash Pack take to clean a load of clothing?For most clothing, simply rubbing them against the washboard from outside the bag for 20-40 seconds is sufficient to remove oils, dirt and odour from the clothing.  For a machine quality wash, rub the clothes for 3 minutes and use a quality laundry liquid.  For stubborn stains, the clothing may be rubbed for longer and/or the clothing may be allowed to soak in the Scrubba Wash Pack for 2-3 hours.  If soaking clothing in the Scrubba Wash Pack, ensure the Scrubba Wash Pack is stored upright (e.g. seal facing upwards) to prevent water wicking through the seal.

Can I use hot water in the Scrubba Wash Pack?Due to the waterproof lining in the bag, we recommend that water no hotter than 50°C (122°F) be used.  Warm water (e.g. 30°C – 50°C or 85°F – 122°F ) can assist the washing process. Simply put, if it is too hot to hold your hands in, the water is too hot for the Scrubba Wash Pack.

What cleaning product should be used with the Scrubba Wash Pack?A variety of detergents have been tested in the Scrubba Wash Pack with success. We've found the use of liquid detergents to be more efficient due to the extra time it takes to dissolve solid detergents (powders, leaves, etc.). Using a liquid enables active suds immediately, reducing the overall time required for rubbing out a wash.

While the Scrubba Wash Pack has been made with a highly chemically resistant form of urethane, use of very harsh bleaches may reduce its longevity. We do not recommend soaking with such products in the Scrubba Wash Pack for prolonged periods

We are conscious of the fact that every traveler has different priorities. For some travelers, weight is the most important factor in packing, so a single product that can perform multiple tasks is beneficial. A small dollop of 3-in-1 bodywash-shampoo-shave liquid may be used in the Scrubba Wash Pack and we have found this to work well in refreshing clothes.

If you don't mind carrying extra products, then packing a very small (~25-30ml) bottle of washing liquid (e.g. Omo or the like) is a good idea when traveling. Washing liquids are generally the most efficient for cleaning your clothes, as they are purpose designed for removing oils and dirt from fabrics. You really only need to use the smallest amount (probably a few ml per bag load) as washing liquids are generally highly concentrated.

For environmentally conscious travelers, there are a number of bio-washing liquids on the market (often released by outdoor brands and available at camping stores) that are better for the environment (e.g. phosphate free). These probably fall somewhere between using bodywash/shampoo and a washing liquid in efficiency but are much better for use in the back country.

You can test for quantities of different cleaning products in the Scrubba Wash Pack by checking the amount of suds visible through the clear section of the bag. If you still have suds after 30 seconds of rubbing, then you can probably reduce the amount of product for the next batch. Optimising the amount is not only better for the environment, but will also minimise the amount of rinsing required.

Why isn't there a loop for hanging the Scrubba Wash Pack to dry?As we recommend turning  the Scrubba Wash Pack inside out after use to dry, the loop would need to be added to the inside of the bag, which would affect the washing performance.  When you turn the bag inside out, you can make good use of the clips to hang the inverted bag to dry.  This is shown in the following image:
How do I reduce water wicking out of the seal?

How do I reduce water wicking out of the seal?While our fabric and the seams of the Scrubba Wash Pack are waterproof, the roll-down-and-clip closure can allow a small amount of water to wick through over time.  This can be minimised by rolling the top down as tightly as possible and at least 4-5 times.  When tightly rolled, water typically won't wick through the top for at least 20 minutes, which should be a sufficient amount of time to perform a standard Scrubba wash.  If you position the buckles of the roll-down-and-clip seal to face upwards, this will also reduce wicking.

How long will the Scrubba Wash Pack last and how do I care for it?The Scrubba Wash Pack is designed to last and you can take steps to ensure a prolonged life.  This includes avoiding contact with sharp objects which could puncture the Scrubba Wash Pack, avoiding contact with strong bleaches, abrasive surfaces and high temperatures (less than 50°C (122°F) is fine).  For good hygiene we also recommend turning the Scrubba Wash Pack inside out to allow the bag to dry.

Is there a warranty on the Scrubba Wash Pack?Is there a warranty on the Scrubba Wash Pack? Yes.  To the original owner,  our company, Calibre8 Pty Ltd, provides a guarantee against defects in materials and craftsmanship. If your product fails due to a defect, we will replace, repair or refund it at our discretion.  While manufacturing defects are rare, the occasional bad egg can sometimes make it past our dedicated quality control inspection team.  If there is a defect in the materials or craftsmanship, you will realise fairly quickly and all you need to do is email us at info@thescrubba.com and we will work with you to make it right.  If you are purchasing a Scrubba Wash Pack before a trip, we suggest that you test the Scrubba Wash Pack before you leave as there are some pretty remote parts to the world that can make replacing the bag difficult.

Can the Scrubba Wash Pack be used on all clothing?The Scrubba Wash Pack can be used on most forms of clothing.  While clothing made of thick materials such as denim jeans may be washed in the Scrubba Wash Pack, it may be necessary to open the bag and rotate the jeans to ensure sufficient contact between the whole jeans and the washboard.  Care needs to be taken for clothing with zips or buckles, which could potentially damage the internal coating of the Scrubba Wash Pack.

Will the Scrubba Wash Pack damage my clothing?Independent testing by one of Australasia’s leading washing machine manufacturers has shown that the Scrubba Wash Pack is gentler on clothing that washing machines and on par with handwashing.  However, as all washing techniques cause some wear on clothes, users should always follow the washing instructions on their clothing.

Can my Scrubba Wash Pack be repaired?It sure can and we are planning to include a repair patch that is really simple to use. The repair patch is made from the same type of fabric as the front of the Scrubba Wash Pack and has a purpose designed urethane adhesive.  Simply clean the area of the Scrubba Wash Pack that needs to be repaired, cut the patch to size, remove the backing of the repair patch and apply the patch to the shiny side of the fabric (the inside of the bag).  Press patch firmly over the repair area and allow the adhesive to cure for 4 hours before use.
Alternately, a bicycle tyre puncture repair kit (from your local bicycle store) or inflatable mattress/tent repair kit (most camping stores sell this) may be used.

How do I dry my clothing?Great question.  You can simply wring out the clothes and hang them to dry or use the Scrubba wash & dry pack, which includes a large Scrubba travel towel, inflatable hangers and pegless clothesline.  After rinsing the clothing, lay them on the Scrubba towel.  Roll the towel up and press down on the towel as hard as you can.  This will transfer much of the residual water from the clothing to the towel.
What do I do with the dirty water if I am camping or trekking?

If you use the Scrubba Wash Pack in the countryside, we recommend using an environmentally friendly laundry liquid to minimise potential damage to the local ecosystem.  Most camping stores sell a range of eco laundry liquids.  If washing near a water source (e.g. a river, stream, lake, etc.), we recommend that dirty water be tipped out at least 30 metres (100 feet) from the water source to prevent pollution.

How long are the shoulder and waist straps?Each of the shoulder straps are adjustable between around 55 cm to 105 cm [21-41 inches] (with an additional 40 cm [16 inches] between the anchor points) and the waist strap is adjustable between around 47 cm and 90 cm [18.5-35 inches] (with an additional 15cm [6 inches] between the anchor points). If you feel you may need longer straps, please contact us and we will see what we can do.

What is the purpose of the waist strap and pouch?The waist strap functions to hold the pouch, which has convenient pockets large enough for most smart phones and passports, making it great for use at the airport.  For those who are more active, the waist strap also assists in keeping the Scrubba Wash Pack tight against the body, which can be important for active pursuits such as jogging and hiking to minimise the bag bouncing around.

Why would I buy this instead of a Scrubba wash bag?The Scrubba wash bag is the world’s smallest and lightest washing machine for travel and camping.  If you don’t need a lightweight day pack, then the Scrubba wash bag may be more suitable for you and they are available globally at thescrubba.com and thescrubba.com.au (for Australians).  However, if like most people you pack a daypack in your backpack or suitcase when you travel, then you will love the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Not only is it a lightweight, weatherproof and versatile day pack, but at the end of the day you can still wash your clothes in just minutes.

What if I only like messenger-style sling bags?No worries at all.  We know people like to wear bags differently, which is why the Scrubba Wash Pack has been designed to be extremely versatile.  If you don’t like the waist strap, simply un-clip it – it only takes seconds.  If you don’t want to wear it like a backpack, just unclip one of the shoulder straps and adjust the length of the remaining shoulder strap.  Now you have a sling bag. It really is that easy.

Do I need the Scrubba Wash & Dry Pack?If you like your clean clothes to also be dry then you may need it.  Just kidding.  It is possible and quite easy to dry clothes after washing them in the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Simply wring them out and find somewhere to hang them.  Where the Scrubba Wash & Dry Pack comes in handy is that it includes a huge travel towel that can accelerate the drying process by par drying the clothes before you hang them on the inflatable hangers or pegless clothesline that are included in the Wash & Dry Pack.
I'm from the media and want to run a feature on the Scrubba Wash Pack.  How do I get more information?
Thanks for your interest in spreading the word about the Scrubba Wash Pack.  Please send us an email to info@thescrubba.com and we will provide you with our media pack.
Go anywhere, do anything and end the day clean with the Scrubba Wash Pack.",17.0,0,"6 Campaigns

The Undress - SPORT, allows you to CHANGE CLOTHES, ANYTIME, ANYWHERE, WITHOUT GETTING NAKED. (Don't believe us? Watch the video!)

column1: The Undress is the world's first mobile changing room, and dress of its kind! Runners, Cyclists, Yogis, Triathletes, Travelers, Super Moms - all active women - can benefit from this amazing invention. No need to change with a flimsy towel, behind a bush, or dirty public restroom - The Undress has you covered!
Have one in your gear bag, or in the trunk of your car at all times! You'll never know when you'll need one! WATCH THE VIDEO to see how it works and click ""Get This Perk"" to preorder yours today!

column3: >BRAND NEW! The newest edition of The Undress is more than just a dress. It's a SYSTEM that has many proprietary features to help you change clothes without ever getting naked. Updated fabrics, fit, style, and functionality make it the best Undress yet. Be the first in the world to own The Undress SPORT!

column1: • Click on ""Get This Perk"" under the reward of your choice to start the preorder process. This will reserve a dress for you.
• You will not need to select your size and color until our preorder period ends on March 31. But you can use the below chart to get a good idea of what you'd like to request once it's time!
• After our preorder period ends, we will contact you to get all your size, color, and shipping details.
• We estimate that your order will ship in June 2016. And yes, we do ship internationally!
The Undress v2.0 has a variety of features &
Faster and Easier - Change outfits in half the time it would take by using a towel, or fumbling in the car!
This is not just a dress - The Undress - Version 2 SPORT has Patent Pending features to helping you change from one outfit to another without getting naked!  There is nothing else like it!
Skirt - You can use it as a skirt, in case you only want to change your bottoms, or if you just need a skirt!
Strapless Dress - Transforms into a unique strapless dress to add coverage where needed if you go bra-less!
Easy to remove a Sports Bra - No other product in the world helps you change in or out of a Sports Bra like The Undress!
Seat Cover - Use it as a car seat cover in seconds!
Wear as a dress - It's fashionable AND functional!
Versatile - Every woman should have one- with dozens of uses, you never know when you’ll need it!
Only Available HERE on Indiegogo - There is NOTHING else in the world like it!
Step 1- Slip In and bring dress to your waist.
Step 2- Slip under - Slip the front panel underneath your bra, or top.
Step 3- Slip Over - Slip the drawstring loop over your head and secure the cord lock
• To redress, reverse the process with your new outfit!
Watch the video to see it in action!

column1: With your feedback from The Undress - Version 1, we are proud to build The Undress - Version 2, with YOU.  Here are the most important upgrades that was requested from a majority of our original backers!
1. New Tech Fabric - Athletic (sweat wicking, antimicrobial), Lifestyle (swimwear type, moisture friendly), and Terry/Towel Fabric Options in multiple colors and sizes TBD
2. Improved Strapping - more comfortable, color matched fabric
3. Color Matched Cord Lock - Option (*stretch goal)
5. New ""Soft Handle"" - More wearable, machine washable, and dryer friendly.
6. Zippered Side Access Openings - Open and Close as you need them. Lays flat when closed.
7. Custom Zipper Pulls - Easier to grab during changes
8. New Performance Slit - For better mobility
9. Fabric Technology - Anti-Microbial, Odor Blocking, and Sweat Wicking performance (Athletic Fabric Option Only)
11. Midi Length - Fits most women, and gives you all the coverage you need. Great in wet, sandy, and muddy training conditions.
12. Updated Style - Modern, technical design and feel
13. Performance Fabric Layer - Chest area concealment is better than previous versions when bra-less.
14. Improved Secret Pocket - Construction Updated, and more secure
15. Construction Improvements - Key Points throughout the dress are reinforced / reengineered for strength and durability
After a successful initial funding period on Kickstarter to launch The Undress SPORT, we are excited to take preorders for this amazing dress on IndieGoGo!
• Be one of the first to own The Undress SPORT - a brand new product!
• Save money! All preorders are priced at a special discount that's just for you. And if you buy two or more dresses, you'll also get free US shipping!
Preorder now by clicking on ""Get This Perk"" under any reward! You can change your preorder, or cancel at anytime before the project is funded on March 31, 2016.
• Make sure we produce the exact amount of dresses that YOU want us to make, so we don't waste any resources producing anything you may not actually want.
• Meet minimum order requirements for colors and sizes by our various manufacturers.
• Dream big! We have so many things we want to do with The Undress SPORT, and aiming for stretch goals during this crowdfunding period will make sure we have the funds to do so responsibly.
$225K - 3 New Super Shawl Colors (total of 5)! - Current available colors are Heather Gray &

$325K - Add Athletic Bamboo Fabric Option, color to be voted on!
$615K - EVERYONE gets an extra surprise gift!

Our company was built by our community, and we look forward to collaborating with you as we grow together. Crowdfunding allows us to connect with you and others so that we can continue to develop this product with those that matter most - our backers.

column1:
Risks and challenges

Production - We experienced explosive success in our first crowdfund, selling over 10,000 dresses (when our goal was ""only"" to sell 400) and as a result we had major production delays. We learned a lot, and we now have more experience, have tested factories that have been proven to be reliable, and have a team that is more ready than ever. If we are lucky enough to be as successful as we were in the past, we are 100% positive that we now have the knowledge, contacts, and resources to complete this project in a timely manner. In comparison, we are already much, much farther in development on Version 2 (and ready to produce) than we were on Version 1 when we launched last year. Production is always a challenge, but we are very confident that we have all the right partners, and resources to get the job done, and done well!

5. New ""Soft Handle"" - More wearable, machine washable, and dryer friendly.
6. Zippered Side Access Openings - Open and Close as you need them. Lays flat when closed.
7. Custom Zipper Pulls - Easier to grab during changes
8. New Performance Slit - For better mobility
9. Fabric Technology - Anti-Microbial, Odor Blocking, and Sweat Wicking performance (Athletic Fabric Option Only)
10. Easy Care - Washer & Dryer Friendly, ""Pilling"" and Wrinkle Resistant
11. Midi Length - Fits most women, and gives you all the coverage you need. Great in wet, sandy, and muddy training conditions.
12. Updated Style - Modern, technical design and feel
13. Performance Fabric Layer - Chest area concealment is better than previous versions when bra-less.
14. Improved Secret Pocket - Construction Updated, and more secure
15. Construction Improvements - Key Points throughout the dress are reinforced / reengineered for strength and durability
After a successful initial funding period on Kickstarter to launch The Undress SPORT, we are excited to take preorders for this amazing dress on IndieGoGo!
Preordering on IndieGoGo will help you...
Be one of the first to own The Undress SPORT - a brand new product!
Save money! All preorders are priced at a special discount that's just for you. And if you buy two or more dresses, you'll also get free US shipping!
Preorder now by clicking on ""Get This Perk"" under any reward! You can change your preorder, or cancel at anytime before the project is funded on March 31, 2016.
Preordering on IndieGoGo will help us...
Make sure we produce the exact amount of dresses that YOU want us to make, so we don't waste any resources producing anything you may not actually want.
Meet minimum order requirements for colors and sizes by our various manufacturers.
Dream big! We have so many things we want to do with The Undress SPORT, and aiming for stretch goals during this crowdfunding period will make sure we have the funds to do so responsibly.
$150K - New Color / Print for Dress - ACHIEVED!
$225K - 3 New Super Shawl Colors (total of 5)! - Current available colors are Heather Gray & Heather Navy (matching the two Athletic dresses) - ACHIEVED!
$250K - Mens Version of The Undress Designed and Prototyped, and Kickstarter created! - ACHIEVED!
$325K - Add Athletic Bamboo Fabric Option, color to be voted on!
$615K - EVERYONE gets an extra surprise gift!

Risks and challengesProduction - We experienced explosive success in our first crowdfund, selling over 10,000 dresses (when our goal was ""only"" to sell 400) and as a result we had major production delays. We learned a lot, and we now have more experience, have tested factories that have been proven to be reliable, and have a team that is more ready than ever. If we are lucky enough to be as successful as we were in the past, we are 100% positive that we now have the knowledge, contacts, and resources to complete this project in a timely manner. In comparison, we are already much, much farther in development on Version 2 (and ready to produce) than we were on Version 1 when we launched last year. Production is always a challenge, but we are very confident that we have all the right partners, and resources to get the job done, and done well!",33.0,1,"7 Campaigns

We have been working hard on this project for over 3 years to produce what is one of the world's toughest, lightest, slimmest automatic dive watches.

 

Introducing the Paulson Pearl Diver

 

Case Finishing

The case is made of Grade 5 titanium - stronger than steel but only half the weight.  Not only does titanium feel very light on your wrist, it is also hypoallergenic and therefore very safe to wear on your skin.

Dial

One of the features of the Pearl Diver is its unique gradient black dial that shifts ever so slightly from black to navy to grey to indigo, a truly captivating effect.

Hands

The luminous hands are a polished finish to contrast the case's beautifully mattte finish. 

Crystal

Sapphire is extremely durable, rating 9 out of 10 on Mohs Scale of Hardness, making it highly scratch and crack resistant.  An anti-reflective coating applied on the underside allows for better viewing pleasure.

Bezel

The 120 click unidirectional rotating ceramic bezel has a radiant shine and features luminous indices that make night time viewing a delight.

Water Resistance

Water resistant to 100m.

Crown

The screw down crown is made from Grade 5 smooth matte finish titanium and serves as protection from moisture and other natural elements.  The signed crown is 5.5mm.

Case Back

The case back is Grade 5 titanium with signature etching kept flush and smooth for comfortable wear. 

Buckle

The 20mm engraved buckle is made from Grade 5 smooth matte finish titanium. 

Straps

The Pearl Diver comes with two straps so that you are ready for both business and pleasure
column2:
a genuine Italian black leather strap and a black perlon strap.

Visibility

Super-Luminova blue (BGW9) was chosen for its immense afterglow performance and is one of the brightest lumes on the market today.  It has been applied on the hour markers, bezel markers, hour and minute hands.  Chargeable in sunlight and artificial light, Super-Luminova is non-radioactive so you can wear your watch with peace of mind.

Mechanical Movement

The Paulson Pearl Diver features a Miyota 9015 caliber movement, a solid and reliable movement with a 42 hour power reserve, 24 jewels and a classic three hand display.  A highly regarded Japanese movement that matches its Swiss counterparts in both accuracy and reliability.  Smooth sweeping with a good power reserve, it’s an automatic movement that can be hand wound and features a hacking seconds hand.

 

---------------------

---------------------

---------------------

Production Plan

Manufacturing your orders will immediately commence at the end of the campaign. It will take 120 days for production.  

By backing the first production run, you will be able to enjoy big discounts on your Paulson Pearl Diver.  Rest assured that we will provide you with regular production and delivery updates.

 

Early Bird Perks

USD 199.00 per timepiece for the first 50 backers 

USD 229.00 per timepiece for the next 200 backers 

USD 279.00 per timepiece for the next 200 backers 

USD 299.00 per timepiece for additional backers 

USD 500.00 for two timepieces up to 200 backers

 

Stretch Goals

If we reach USD 80,000, we will add serial numbers on the back of all the watches and this will identify your watch as part of the first production run.

column3: >We believe in making the world a more beautiful place &amp
column4: that fashion alongside with sharing is one medium through which this can be achieved.  The Athenaeum model reduces waste such as that created by “fast-fashion” and by giving a new “living” home for the “dead storage” of people’s unused treasures hibernating in the backs of their closets.

column3: >Another main purpose of the library is to facilitate community-building via an in-house fashion design program and by hosting a variety of classes, all of which bring a diverse population together.  Diversity is key to a strong environment. We are working to build a place where people who normally might not cross paths can find common joys, build new friendships, and learn from each other. In summary, our method of commerce will not only provide one of the most eco-friendly and socially just fashion options to local consumers, it will also strengthen a weakened local economy, build and strengthen community, foster the arts, and provide professional opportunities to San Francisco’s youth.

>We need $50k to open the space, remodel, organize, and ready it for a grand opening party. Of the money, 30% is for rent (deposit + 1st month's rent), 20% for remodeling, 25% for inventory collecting and cataloging, 15% for staffing, and 15% for a library management system.

>If we exceed our funding goal, additional donations will be put towards the purchase of a trailer for use as a mobile library and towards shooting a reality TV show about the Athenaeum and eventually expanding to open another library in Los Angeles.  If our goal isn't reached, the money will stay in a trust fund as we pursue other avenues to complete funding and will be used altogether once funding is complete.

and our blog:
Donate your favorite pieces of clothing and accessories to the library's collection.  (Contact Shaye Mckenney for details at contactathenaeum@gmail.com)

A project 17 years in the making, The Athaenum is the brainchild of Shaye Mckenney, creator and owner of La Library.  Aptly named, La Library was a former prototype clothing library housed in San Francisco’s Mission District. The new-and-improved project, The Athenaeum, will be an eco-friendly fashion library and community events space in the San Francisco Bay Area. It will make new and used haute couture, designer, vintage, and reconstructed clothing accessible to folks from all economic backgrounds. The Athenaeum will also provide in-house librarians (professional stylists) to help clientele put together selections from the collections to meet individual needs.Beyond providing the community with an affordable way of attaining fashion and style, the Athenaeum's ultimate purpose will be to provide an alternative to ideas of ownership, and take the focus away from personal possession and place it instead on community sharing.  Lastly it will offer various classes, and fashion design internships for aspiring youths.

column1: Community members who can provide proof of enrollment in Welfare, Disability, and Social Security will be offered store membership at the following discounted rates: 80% off of the Red membership, 75% off of the Orange membership, 50% off of the Yellow membership, 40% off of the Green membership, 35% off of the Blue membership, 15% off of the Purple membership, and 10% off of the Light membership.

We believe in making the world a more beautiful place & that fashion alongside with sharing is one medium through which this can be achieved.  The Athenaeum model reduces waste such as that created by “fast-fashion” and by giving a new “living” home for the “dead storage” of people’s unused treasures hibernating in the backs of their closets.

Another main purpose of the library is to facilitate community-building via an in-house fashion design program and by hosting a variety of classes, all of which bring a diverse population together.  Diversity is key to a strong environment. We are working to build a place where people who normally might not cross paths can find common joys, build new friendships, and learn from each other. In summary, our method of commerce will not only provide one of the most eco-friendly and socially just fashion options to local consumers, it will also strengthen a weakened local economy, build and strengthen community, foster the arts, and provide professional opportunities to San Francisco’s youth.
What We Need & What You Get

We need $50k to open the space, remodel, organize, and ready it for a grand opening party. Of the money, 30% is for rent (deposit + 1st month's rent), 20% for remodeling, 25% for inventory collecting and cataloging, 15% for staffing, and 15% for a library management system.

If we exceed our funding goal, additional donations will be put towards the purchase of a trailer for use as a mobile library and towards shooting a reality TV show about the Athenaeum and eventually expanding to open another library in Los Angeles.  If our goal isn't reached, the money will stay in a trust fund as we pursue other avenues to complete funding and will be used altogether once funding is complete.

With your generous contributions you will be helping make possible a new type of ethical, sustainable, and creative business.  But just as importantly, you'll get awesome rewards for your contributions.  Please refer to the ""Perks"" section for details.
Follow our progress on our website: http://athenaeum-fashionlibrary.com/
Donate your favorite pieces of clothing and accessories to the library's collection.  (Contact Shaye Mckenney for details at contactathenaeum@gmail.com)",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
