WELCOME TO RAUM FOOTWEAR

Our shoes are made for people who want stylish earthing footwear without synthetic materials. Our vision is to bring people closer to earth with minimalist footwear that permits conduction of energy from the earth into our bodies through the flexible, copper riveted leather sole.

HANDSEWN, ETHICALLY-MADE SHOES

Each shoe is made by hand in a small, European atelier. We employ roughly 10% Syrian refugees and train them by master cobblers that have been making footwear for generations. Our secret is the vegetable tanned, water buffalo leather soles equipped with a copper rivet. They are extremely flexible and mold to your feet over time. Our soles are zero-drop, to promote natural walking just how humans were designed to. 

100% COPPER RIVETED SOLE

Located at the KD 1 acupuncture point, each copper rivet is installed by hand. This unique feature acts as a ""super conductor"" of the earth's abundant supply of electrons to your body. This combined with the porous leather sole, makes our shoes conductive as soon as you put them on your feet. Due to the strategic location, the copper touches your foot without you even feeling it! 

PREMIUM MATERIALS AND CONSTRUCTION

RAUM shoes are made with luxe suedes, supple leathers and vegetable tanned leather soles. The uppers are extremely soft and contain no reinforcements. This allows your feet to bend and move naturally. Each shoe is fully lined with premium sheepskin. The water buffalo leather footbed is porous, allowing for maximum breathability. A single piece of 100% cotton thread is hand-sewn to attach the soles to the upper of the shoe, this allows for each pair to be re-soled for years of use.

COLORWAY SELECTIONS

Our shoes are made in small batches with the future of our planet in mind. All leather is a bi-product of the food industry. Our soles are vegetable tanned, which drastically reduces harmful chemicals and extreme water waste that is typical in the leather tanning process. We do not use any steel molds for production. This eliminates hazardous petroleum based materials that are extremely popular in modern footwear. We pride ourselves on fair wages, a transparent supply chain, and a direct-to-consumer pricing model to deliver you the worlds most stylish grounded footwear.
column2: >WELCOME TO OUR PRIMITIVE FUTURE.

column1: Unlike standard smartwatches, which use large digital displays and need to be recharged daily, the Mas Carney is a smartwatch with a traditional watch face that runs for well over a year on a single battery. It also allows you to wear a smartwatch only you’ll know is a smartwatch.

Stainless Steel Body
Built using time-honed watchmaking techniques, the Mas Carney is constructed with quality in mind. The case and back uses 316L Stainless Steel to protect the hybrid mechanical interior movement and to give it a 5 ATM waterproof rating.

Your Choice of Color
Decide between two simple, bold colors for your Mas Carney - Copper or Steel - to add a regal tone to your wrist.

Sapphire Coating
Mas Carney's simple and dignified face is protected by crystal glass with a sapphire coating making it essentially scratch-proof.

Genuine Leather Strap
And it rests gently on your wrist with a fully adjustable and replaceable leather strap. Each Mas Carney also arrives with a silicone strap allowing you to switch out straps at any time and for any occasion.
Let your watch do more than just tell the time. Mas Carney syncs to your smartphone to silently update you of every important notification.

Phone Alerts
Mas Carney gently vibrates to inform you when calls or texts reach your phone. You can set specific actions for your Mas Carney to display individual contacts calls
column2: its seconds hand will move to specific icons on the watch face to show you different incoming notifications.

column1:
Silent Alarm Clock
Set up your Mas Carney to act as a silent alarm clock for all your notifications. It will vibrate on your wrist to wake you up each morning, remind you of your after-lunch meetings, and tell you it's time to read before bed.

column3: '>Share your contact information or phone number just by holding your Mas Carney up other phones who have enabled NFC sharing.

column1:
Time Sync
The Mas Carney automatically syncs to whatever time zone you find yourself in.

Fitness Notifications
Fitted with comprehensive activity tracking, Mas Carney tracks your fitness information when you’re walking, running, swimming or even sleeping. Just select the appropriate mode on the iPowerful App and it'll do the rest.

Sedentary Alerts
It’ll even remind you get moving with its sedentary alerts when you sit still for too long.

Real Time Data Analysis
Mas Carney compiles all of this data for you in the iPowerful App for easy analysis. See everything from your steps taken and distance covered to the activities you’ve done that day.

Unlike many other hybrid and full smartwatches Mas Carney works as hard as you do. Thanks to its powerful button battery it is guaranteed to run for a full year using daily smart features before needing a battery replacement. And if you use it as just a regular watch its battery can last up to 4 years.

What is the battery lifetime?
The button battery lasts up to 365 days with smart features and up to 4 years if used as a regular wrist watch.

Is it waterproof?
Yes it has a 5 ATM rating.

How does it connect to my phone?
It connects through Bluetooth 4 and through the iPowerful app.

What app does the Mas Carney connect to?
The iPowerful app which is available on Android and iOS.

Do you ship worldwide?
Yes, we are offering FREE shipping worldwide.

What is the strap width and length?
The strap width is 20 mm and the length is 24.8 cm

What is the diameter of the watch face?
The diameter of the watch face is 43 mm.

Can I change the strap?
Yes. There is an extra strap, replacement tools and a pair of lugs in each Mas Carney package.

Is it necessary for the Mas Carney to be connected to my phone all the time?
For all of the functions to work properly you need to be connected to your phone. The only exceptions are the pedometer and sleep monitor which can work without being connected to your smartphone.

Does the watch have memory to collect activity and sleep data when it is not paired with the app?
Yes it does. The Mas Carney can store up to 30 days of data. When paired to your phone, it will a take a few minutes to sync and upload the data to the app.

Can I change the strap?Yes. There is an extra strap, replacement tools and a pair of lugs in each Mas Carney package.

Is it necessary for the Mas Carney to be connected to my phone all the time?For all of the functions to work properly you need to be connected to your phone. The only exceptions are the pedometer and sleep monitor which can work without being connected to your smartphone.Does the watch have memory to collect activity and sleep data when it is not paired with the app?Yes it does. The Mas Carney can store up to 30 days of data. When paired to your phone, it will a take a few minutes to sync and upload the data to the app.",34.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

 

Our Indiegogo campaign for the Ape-X has ended! If you missed us, you can find out more about Weird Ape here: Weird Ape website

With your phone always an arms length away, few people use a watch to tell the time anymore. 

So why are mechanical watches still so desirable?

Mechanical watches are a reminder of a simpler, less technology obsessed time. When a watch was a work of art, not just a timekeeper. 

 

Their craftsmanship and uniqueness make them extremely valuable to own. There’s nothing you can wear that makes a bigger statement than a mechanical watch.
column2:
>

 

However, this comes at a hefty price. Until now...

Uncompromising Quality, Without The Price Tag.

 

 

Creating a high-quality mechanical timepiece (at a fraction of the market price) was our challenge.

How did we do it?
column4:
> 

To make our dream a reality, we spent 12 months working with the best British watch designers and world-leading manufacturers who specialise in producing luxury mechanical watches that retail for thousands of pounds.

With their help, we managed to innovate the design and manufacturing process using state of the art materials.
column5:
>

Every style of Ape-X is limited to 1717 pieces and hand-crafted with it’s own identification number. This makes each timepiece unique and the only one of its kind.

Ergonomically Designed One-Piece Case

Most mechanical watch cases are built using multiple (unnecessary) pieces of stainless steel, driving the price up. 

The Ape-X case is built with a single-piece of 316L stainless steel giving i superior strength. 

The World’s Easiest Interchangeable Straps.

Most mechanical watches use a fixed-pin strap that without complicated tools or trips to the jewellers is impossible to change, driving up the cost for consumers.
column6:
>

 

Black Silver - Grey Silicone

All Black - Black Silicone

All Black - Grey Silicone

Black Silver - Indigo Blue Leather

All Black - Slate Grey Suede

Black Rose Gold - Brown Leather

 Black Silver - Silver Link 

All Black - Black Link

Black Rose Gold - Black Link

Black Rose Gold - Rose Gold Link
column7:
>

We've been producing great mechanical watches for 5 years, just see what our previous customers say...

column2:
>

Case:

40mm, 316L stainless steel case

Full open-face dial showcasing the attention to detail and craftsmanship that goes into every timepiece

A clear glass back to see the beautiful movement at work

Glass: Hardened mineral glass

Straps:

20mm wide.

Quick release, interchangeable with all Weird Ape straps.

Choose from hand-crafted Italian leather, durable silicone, and 316l stainless steel link.

316l Stainless steel buckles.

Movement:

Custom designed premium wind-up movement.

36 hour power reserve.

An oversized twist-grip crown for easy winding

Coating: 3 micron Scratch resistant PVD ion plating.

Water Resistance: 50 meters (5ATM)

Every Ape-X timepiece comes with a 2-year guarantee.
column3:
>

Who you buy from can be just as important as what you buy.

That’s why every Ape-X timepiece comes with a 2-year guarantee. 

If our timepiece doesn’t meet your expectations when you receive it, contact us immediately and we will give you a 100% refund.
column4:
>

Join the mechanical watch revival. Help us bring back something beautiful from a less technology obsessed time. 

With your support we can make this dream a reality.

The new model takes its name from Mount Mahameru, or “Great Mountain,"" an active stratovolcano and the highest mountain in Indonesia’s most populated island, Java. The design pays homage to the classic dress watches from the 1950s such as the 1954 Omega Seamaster. The design revisits not only the elements but also the spirit of classic watchmaking, an era where craftsmanship and quality came first, and beauty naturally followed.

The Mahameru design of pays homage to the classic dress watches from the 1950s such as 1954 Omega Seamaster, 1959 Rolex Tudor, and 1954 Ulysse Nardin. The design chose to revisit not only the design elements but also the spirit of 1950s classic watchmaking, an era where craftsmanship and quality come first, and beauty naturally comes out through utility rather than mere fashion accents.

Through the Mahameru, we try aims to invite those that have directly experienced 1950s watches to relive the era and create a new story of their own. We believe that a watch’s value isn’t measured in currency, but rather the story it brings and moments its wearers associate with it – there is no real value in hefty price tags for poor specifications and played out designs. To achieve this, we offer our watches at the price that won’t put a hole in your pocket to invite more people to join and write the story together.

Dress watch and classic touch are the perfect mixes, make that watch very suitable to be a reminder, put the debate aside, we can all agree that some people can relive the moment and memories just by wearing and looking into the watch, especially those who really knew the story behind the watch. All more reasons to make the classic watch is an area that many people are attracted to.

More wanted, means more pricey, that you might end up pay about thousand dollars to own one. We intend to make our timepieces similar to that category, but with a bargain price, so it won’t make your constraints about the budget. What makes this watch so interesting is it has some details and quality you will not usually find at this price point.
Hand sketching is the very 1st step that we've done to manifested our thought to something real.
The 3rd step is assessing a design from the 3-dimensional point of view makes our timepieces’ prototypes being more accurate and representative after the sampling process is finished.

With an elegant round case in steel, we offer the Mahameru in a polished steel case and rose gold colors. The case is 39mm wide, 11.8mm thick, 47mm lug to lug and 18mm lug width. These combinations make the Mahameru a very comfortable and exceedingly wrist-friendly option for those with smaller or thinner wrists. It will really hit the spot, not too big nor small. The Mahameru also have water resistant to 100m and have the double AR-coated sapphire crystal. The case is produced in stainless steel and has a see-through case back.

The dial is also interesting and attractive part here. We offered 5 dial and case combinations from cream white, black and even blue dials. Dial colors vary with the combination of baton-style hour markers and Arabic numeral 12, 3, 6, and 9 o'clock hour markers with applied indices, making for a slightly dressier look. Breaking up the smooth expanses you have the logo up at 12 o'clock and the small seconds dial down at 6 o'clock. One bit of visual interest pops up in this sub dial - the 60 is printed in red to adds more visual appeal to the watch. We put the radial guilloche dial pattern on the sub dial to make it more aesthetic for the users. The hour and minute hands are done in a sword style which matches nicely with the hour markers. The Mahameru will feature a black leather band, while the red gold iteration comes on a brown leather strap.
A dress watch should have the polished finish rather than the brushed one. The smooth surface indicates our watches to have a top notch polished finishing crown.

The term ""Guilloche"" is also used more generally for repetitive architectural patterns of intersecting or overlapping spirals or other shapes, as used in the classic architectural decorations. We adopted it in our sub dial patterns as you can see.
We used applied indices which are also known as “Applique Indices”, using raised metal batons attached to the dial via adhesion or pegs.
The Crown is positioned between 4 and 5 markers. It is engraved with the initial letter “N” from NAM at its side. A little detail yet leaves a strong impression.
With a transparent back case, you can peek into our watch’s heart, which is the mechanical movements of Miyota 8245.
Our buckle is made from 316L stainless steel (which has high a corrosion resistant) with a polished finishing touch. It is also engraved with initial letter “N” from NAM at its side.

Our watch’s band has a curved end with the padded style, making it suitable for watches with round cases. These watch bands allow for a smoother transition between your watch and the watch band. All of them are also made from genuine leather which will sit comfortably on your wrist.

We used recycled paper from the home industry as the main material, which is eco-friendly and non-toxicant. We did all the little things above because of nothing but to support their economy even if it's not significant and to keep the environment green. Constructed with semi-rigid built and customized for safety.

From the inside, Mahameru is powered by Miyota 8245 which is a non-hacking twenty-one (21) jewels with an accuracy of -20 to +40 seconds per day, and a power reserve of over 40 hours which can be seen through the back case that engraved with NAM logo on the rotor.
Here are some specifications that worth mentioning:
• Function: Hour, Minute and sub second
• Glass: Sapphire Crystal, Double Anti Reflective Coating
• Back case: See through with engraved logo and pattern

We also provide an affordable price and some good value opting for a direct distribution. Watches are sold first-handed from the manufacturer to the customer without any distributor, any retailer or any other middle-men.

Our watches have standard productions and specifications which make the products have some great qualities. It is highly probable, where some other brands with similar production standards and specifications, can charge hundreds more on their watches!
When the project is born, it is born in Indonesia, which also allows us to hold the price at a competitive level but of course, without neglecting the quality we want to achieve.

Last but not least, we really want to put the customer first, that we don’t see the need of multiplying our prices just to mark up our like the luxury brands or other brands who gain a lot of profit with their watches lacking originality and some low specifications

column4:
'>OUR PRODUCT

Our premium denim leggings are designed to make you feel special. You can easily slip them on whenever you want and transform your outfit. Roll them back in your purse when you need to. Our leggings are light and take a little space. Our goal is to combine convenience with style.
column6:
/>


WEAR YOUR JEANSXY WITH CONFIDENCE.
column9: '>HOWEVER YOU WANT, WHENEVER YOU WANT

column1:
OUR MISSION

We design premium quality denim products that combine convenience and style to help you transform your outfit and make you feel special so you can wear them with confidence
column2:
whenever you want, however you want.

***At least 5 percent of our profits will fund educational and innovative projects around the world. Jeansxy is more than just a brand, jeansxy mission is to transform the world through funding projects that matter. Children are the future, jeansxy goal is to invest in them and GROW TO LIFE.

OUR STORY
column6:
/>

THE FABRIC

Mt. Vernon is one of the finest denim fabrics used by luxury brands. We use it because we believe in top quality products. Mount Vernon is one of the largest denim manufacturing facilities in the world in Trion, Georgia. This mill produces a wide variety of denim including washed, over-dyed, and stretch fabrics. 

 

THE PROCESS

Our premium denim leggings are made with love in the Fashion District in downtown Los Angeles. We try to keep each pair slightly different from each other. That's why my team works with top wash out studios and denim specialist in the industry to grind our fabrics in unique ways and give each pair its own flavor. 



 

THE PACKAGING

column1: By participating in our Indiegogo launch effort, you'll be our honored backers of JEANSXY. Everyone who gives at any level will be our honored backers and that is only possible through this campaign. Thank you for being here, and please spread the word!
We are offering the following EXCLUSIVE and LIMITED offers as rewards for our honored backers.
Currently we have 4 different sizes available: XS, S, M, L. At the end of campaign you will let us know your size so we can ship your jeansxy to as soon as possible.

Jeansxy premium denim leggings in more colors and carefully selected designs. We are also working on designing cool denim sleeves and gloves. We expect our final new products delivery in the next 6 months. Stay tuned.

column4: '>How long would it take to get my denim leggings?

column1: Since we are working with top quality manufacturers and because all our products are hand made by artisans who put a lot of effort to their work, manufacturing takes more time than regular mass production. However, we have done a lot of preparation and put everything in place to start shipping right after the campaign ends. Our indiegogo campaign end mid January, and for that reason, we estimate shipping by the end of January 2016. You should get your jeansxy just on time to impress your Valentine.  However, if we receive larger orders soon enough, we'll be able to start shipping sooner than our estimated shipping date.

column2: >The video that tells the story of the importance of this project and how it can be implemented on a larger scale through organized activity with proper legal structures and data base designed to track marketing campaigns for education, investment in land/lease, people to live and learn the farm life.
>This has been an inspiration for me and what I do.

>   This project is to design and build an integrated web site and database, and the legal structures to accommodate all activities for generations to come. Inviting  groups and individuals that want to participate in this project.  See applications to the right.

column4: >There are individuals and groups active in key areas and have for the most part operated independently and successfully.

column1: Without changing their current operating basis each of them can be included in
a sophisticated database designed to provide new opportunities that align with
their work. The database can also help in connecting others with these groups as

they will need more people to help in the delivery. This project is  a proactive activity dedicated to find investors that want to invest in land and restoration projects, find land and farms for sale or lease and match these with the individuals and teams that will incorporate sustainable and regenerative practices. PR, Marketing and Sales (matching opportunities with participants). Educators and instructors and their students and graduates as part of the database can be matched with projects to start or continue their career as paid specialists. The design is not for volunteers it is designed for paid interns, students and professionals.

column2: >   We need a coordinated and dedicated effort to

column1: reach the Mom and Pop Farms before they get bought up by Commercial Ag or
Developers and work out one of several types of purchases and leasing options that are already being used successfully.
Monsanto is marketing to Commercial Ag and leaving them with no other choice.
In the last 2 years he invested $1.2 billion in database information he uses to

market his products of destruction. He is going after a $20 billion dollar market so we know the potential is there and makes this project feasible on that point alone. His marketing campaign leaves out the natural
and profitable aspects of multi-yield organic farming. We need to show the
farmers the healthy and profitable options on how to ""TRANSITION"" to sustainable
and regenerative practices. There are some successes in doing this but much
more is needed and can be done. That is the purpose of this project.

column2: >   There is a lot of work to do along this line and it is

column1: time to utilize all of the trained and unemployed Permaculture Designers and other specialists as well as educate more of them and put them to work, more investments in sustainable/regenerative activities benefiting investors the environment and its' inhabitants.

column2: >   More Commercial Farmers/Mom and Pop farmers need to understand they have options for ""TRANSITIONING"" into more sustainable/regenerative practices which includes such things as increased profits, consistent cash flow, options uninfluenced by commodity prices outside their control and less upfront costs for inputs. Cities

column1: around the country are catching on to the need for community gardens and
locally grown healthy food and can be an integrated part of local farmers. The database will be used to connect them and the
appropriate individuals and groups that they can interface with and accomplish

column2: >   Those that want to participate should have the

column1: opportunity to do so. A web site integrated with a database makes it possible
to recognize and capture each individual or groups interests and direct them to
an opportunity that matches by trained professionals ""The Core Team"" who are dedicated to their success.
be used to set up the legal structures, costs for web site hosting and design, database design and integration specialists, marketing specialists, data entry and basic operating
expenses i.e. phone and transportation to carry out the establishment

column2: >   Farmer - Both Mom and Pop or Commercial Farming. If you are interested in selling, leasing all or part of your farm, transition to sustainable/regenerative practices, increase your cash flow throughout the year, lower costs or market liabilities, increase yield naturally and sustainably or address something specific to your operation or concerns.
>   Educator/Instructor - Instructors in Permaculture Design, Holistic
column3: > Management, or any specialty in sustainable/regenerative practices. The marketing benefits integrated into this database is designed to bring more students as well as hire graduates, interns etc.

column2: >   Land Owners - Land is a valuable asset that can be purchased, leased, donated and used optimally as its' purpose in the natural landscape.
column3: > Any land will be considered and looked into for it best use and value.

column2: >  Investors - Project Related Investments, Investment pools for large or multiple related projects, donation or tax saving investments, low profit or profitable investments, legacy investments. Applications from individuals and groups will need to meet certain ethical criteria and matched appropriately with their terms.
>  Affiliates - Products and/or services used in sustainable and regenerative practices. Become a sources for consideration on each project.

>  Municipal - this is where you state your concerns and needs in your community in the areas related to sustainability/regenerative practices. Design services can address most anything and a matching for appropriate specialist(s) to address your needs.

>  Core Team - The full-time management team (paid) that will oversee each of the above areas, handle broad and successful marketing and sales as well as the internal and external operations of ALARM which will also integrate with Legacy Designs and ACRE. Current plan is to strategically headquarter in the Champaign Illinois area in the heartland of America where aligned and successful activities are in progress and a central point in the Mississippi Watershed which embraces 30 states and 2 Canadian Provinces.
>   Applications can be filled in at the web site once it is up and running or sent in an excel
column3: > spreadsheet via email prior to the web site where it can be imported into the database and acted upon.

column2: >   The discounts associated with these donations will be towards services delivered by via ""The Core Team and its Affiliates"". Services that apply at this time are Permaculture Designs,Consulting and Career Counseling related to sustainable/regenerative projects and careers. Additional products and services may be added in the future. Your suggestions are welcome!
>Professional Profile on LinkedIn Click on this link and search for Bob Lawrason  http://www.linkedin.com

a sophisticated database designed to provide new opportunities that align with
their work. The database can also help in connecting others with these groups as

they will need more people to help in the delivery. This project is  a proactive activity dedicated to find investors that want to invest in land and restoration projects, find land and farms for sale or lease and match these with the individuals and teams that will incorporate sustainable and regenerative practices. PR, Marketing and Sales (matching opportunities with participants). Educators and instructors and their students and graduates as part of the database can be matched with projects to start or continue their career as paid specialists. The design is not for volunteers it is designed for paid interns, students and professionals.
We need a coordinated and dedicated effort to
reach the Mom and Pop Farms before they get bought up by Commercial Ag or
Developers and work out one of several types of purchases and leasing options that are already being used successfully.
Monsanto is marketing to Commercial Ag and leaving them with no other choice.
In the last 2 years he invested $1.2 billion in database information he uses to

market his products of destruction. He is going after a $20 billion dollar market so we know the potential is there and makes this project feasible on that point alone. His marketing campaign leaves out the natural
and profitable aspects of multi-yield organic farming. We need to show the
farmers the healthy and profitable options on how to ""TRANSITION"" to sustainable
and regenerative practices. There are some successes in doing this but much
more is needed and can be done. That is the purpose of this project.
There is a lot of work to do along this line and it is

time to utilize all of the trained and unemployed Permaculture Designers and other specialists as well as educate more of them and put them to work, more investments in sustainable/regenerative activities benefiting investors the environment and its' inhabitants.

More Commercial Farmers/Mom and Pop farmers need to understand they have options for ""TRANSITIONING"" into more sustainable/regenerative practices which includes such things as increased profits, consistent cash flow, options uninfluenced by commodity prices outside their control and less upfront costs for inputs. Cities
around the country are catching on to the need for community gardens and
locally grown healthy food and can be an integrated part of local farmers. The database will be used to connect them and the
appropriate individuals and groups that they can interface with and accomplish
Those that want to participate should have the
opportunity to do so. A web site integrated with a database makes it possible
to recognize and capture each individual or groups interests and direct them to
an opportunity that matches by trained professionals ""The Core Team"" who are dedicated to their success.
How The Funds Will Be Used
be used to set up the legal structures, costs for web site hosting and design, database design and integration specialists, marketing specialists, data entry and basic operating
expenses i.e. phone and transportation to carry out the establishment.

Farmer - Both Mom and Pop or Commercial Farming. If you are interested in selling, leasing all or part of your farm, transition to sustainable/regenerative practices, increase your cash flow throughout the year, lower costs or market liabilities, increase yield naturally and sustainably or address something specific to your operation or concerns.

Educator/Instructor - Instructors in Permaculture Design, Holistic Management, or any specialty in sustainable/regenerative practices. The marketing benefits integrated into this database is designed to bring more students as well as hire graduates, interns etc.

Land Owners - Land is a valuable asset that can be purchased, leased, donated and used optimally as its' purpose in the natural landscape. Any land will be considered and looked into for it best use and value.

Investors - Project Related Investments, Investment pools for large or multiple related projects, donation or tax saving investments, low profit or profitable investments, legacy investments. Applications from individuals and groups will need to meet certain ethical criteria and matched appropriately with their terms.
Affiliates - Products and/or services used in sustainable and regenerative practices. Become a sources for consideration on each project.

Municipal - this is where you state your concerns and needs in your community in the areas related to sustainability/regenerative practices. Design services can address most anything and a matching for appropriate specialist(s) to address your needs.

Core Team - The full-time management team (paid) that will oversee each of the above areas, handle broad and successful marketing and sales as well as the internal and external operations of ALARM which will also integrate with Legacy Designs and ACRE. Current plan is to strategically headquarter in the Champaign Illinois area in the heartland of America where aligned and successful activities are in progress and a central point in the Mississippi Watershed which embraces 30 states and 2 Canadian Provinces.
Applications can be filled in at the web site once it is up and running or sent in an excel spreadsheet via email prior to the web site where it can be imported into the database and acted upon.

The discounts associated with these donations will be towards services delivered by via ""The Core Team and its Affiliates"". Services that apply at this time are Permaculture Designs,Consulting and Career Counseling related to sustainable/regenerative projects and careers. Additional products and services may be added in the future. Your suggestions are welcome!
Professional Profile on LinkedIn Click on this link and search for Bob Lawrason  http://www.linkedin.com",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column2: >My name is Tara Wright, and I am the designer behind Cescca. I am originally from Galveston,TX and I graduated Magna Cum Laude from the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2012. While my fellow alumni were running off to New York and LA, I decided to stay in Savannah with my fiance (a chemist,) and do the retail thing until we could get somewhere bigger. But I am meant to design clothes - and there is no time like the present! (Check out more of my work at Cescca.net)
column3:
>My love for children's wear developed my senior year at SCAD, and I have never looked back. There is a huge need in the American kid's wear market for clothes that are FUN, not just functional!

Cescca||Dew Drops||

column9: >Dew Drops is a collection I designed for Cescca while a senior at the Savannah College of Art and Design. Since graduation, I have wanted to put the collection into production -and the timing just feels right, right now. The collection features about 20 looks, for girls ages 3-8. You can see the full collection at Cescca.net!
column15: >$4000. Thats a lot of money. Here's where it is going to go:

column1: • Even if I don't reach $4000, even if I don't come close - every dollar helps get me closer to making the collection a reality.

• Crocheted accessories - these are created by hand, from silk or wool (backer's choice.) Small accessories, for the $10 reward will be coin wallets, cell phone cases, etc. Large accessories will be scarves, hats, or gloves (backer's choice.)
• The famous owl print! The very first and most popular print that I have designed, seen here:
• The tote bag will feature the print, but not be overpowered by the print - and each one will be unique. Crocheted details will be on the owls!

Why this campaign? I want to change American kid's wear. I'm tired of seeing pink dresses, blue suits, or a shirt with a Disney character - and that's it. Let's spice up children's wear with prints and crazy shapes! And it is time to bring back well made kid's clothes. Made in the USA. Touched by hands who love what they do.

Why now? I am ready to make my dreams a reality. I have wanted to be a fashion designer since I was about 5. I'm 30 now, and I don't know when another opportunity to try will come. Soon marriage and kids and other responsibilities will take over my life.

Cescca||Dew Drops||
There are so many ways to help spread the word, donations are not the only way to send me to fashion week!
• Social Media - don't blast, but please share on facebook, twitter, etc.

Crowdfunding is very simple: thanks to your donations, we can launch HOOT Watches ! Do not worry, the project will succeed even if the campaign does not reach its goal. This means that if you help us today, the production will be faster. In any case, you will get the contribution you have chosen !

Le concept de crowdfunding est très simple ! C'est grâce à vos dons que la production sera plus rapide !  Ne vous inquiétez pas, le projet aboutira même si la campagne n'atteint pas son but. Dans tous les cas, vous obtiendrez la contribution choisie !

POUR LA VIDEO EN FRANCAIS CLIQUEZ SUR L'ONGLET GALLERIE


The collection is available in white or black high-quality rubber. It’s composed of index color references, next to the classical white version, we offer you three other fresh, trendy colors: green, white and blue.

With the Night Owl collection, club-goers can check the time at all hours of the night thanks to a case dial that illuminates between midnight and 6 a.m., using Swiss Super Luminova technology. 



      style="""">
column4:
/>



Our brand brings a unique set of quality and design together with a DNA based on Swiss know-how, resulting in an affordable luxury product. A thorough analysis of the market shows that entry-level watch quality is often neglected. On the other hand, the quality of high-end luxury watches is irrefutable, yet inaccessible. Our objective is thus to offer a design that is both appealing and made of the same high-end materials as those used by luxurious brands.

We combined the technical sophistication of a stainless steel structure to that of a high quality, rubber-injected membrane in order to allow a link between the Case band and bracelet. This creates a unique, extremely technical and resistant piece.

The elaborated internal micro grooves of the strap guarantee optimal comfort with this UV-resistant and hypoallergenic watch even in high heat temperatures. The stainless steel bezel is also covered in high-quality rubber coating and the back case, stamped with the HOOT logo, reveals a Swiss-made quartz movement that is water resistant to 10 ATM.

HOOT : The perpetual, rallying cry beating to the rhythm of nighttime festivities. Flying through the night, meeting fellow nocturnal creatures, the owl is the ultimate night bird. It symbolizes the wildness and freedom.

The HOOT brand innovates by offering a new vision of timepieces. Above all, a watch acts as a bridge, federating a new community throughout the world.  HOOT is the rallying cry of clubbers, gathering people to honor nocturnal festivities in the dark hours.

The brand will be present in entertainment spaces, whether in urban, mountain or beach environments. HOOT is wherever the festivities take place!

An encounter often starts with a mutual glance that awakens curiosity... During a thrilling evening, a group of watch enthusiasts exchanged ideas. Inspirational Catalonia had infused a common energy: that of creating a timepiece that empowers to live freely to the rhythm of the night.  


A Swiss startup by Salemi design studio, under the direction of designer Jean-Marc Salemi and his ten years of industry experience. As the first Swiss firm to launch a watch project on U.S. crowdfunding platform Indiegogo, our team has worked many months to accomplish this common dream.

* Discover more pictures here

Thank YOU for allowing us to offer you  something different

By getting involved early you can cement yourself into the begining of HOOT watches history! With your help we can realize our dream to produce a design and quality watch at an affordable price ! 

Unprecedent opportunity:
At one third the retail cost thanks to Indiegogo community.




Your watch will be delivered with a 2 years warranty in a luxurious and elegant black or white box stamped with a silver HOOT logo.

All 100% of the funds collected on Indiegogo will be used for the production of HOOT WATCHES first serie. The start-up has spent over a year conceptualizing, designing and adjusting to perfection the HOOT WATCHES prototypes, we are therefore ready to launch the production! We guarantee a delivery of the models within four months following the end of the Indiegogo campaign.

The definitely off-beat, streetwise brand will opt for an authentic communication style – a mobile, intuitive platform that allows for instant reactivity. By using social media channels such as Instagram, Facebook or Pinterest we will be able to generate a community movement in line with the essence of the HOOT brand.

Hello everybody, AFO here. For the past 6 months I have been creating and building a brand new T-shirt website which aims to spread the truth (that the government keeps hidden from you) through the power of T-shirts. With over 5 years of website and graphic design experience I have decided to combine both my passions into one project. As an individual I work hard to keep my day job, AFO and currently TruthTShirts afloat, and as much fun as I have creating new content and designs, it consumes alot of my time and money, and that is why I am asking for your help.

TruthTShirts.com is just coming to the end of it's beta phase but cannot do so without the essential tools. Most of these tools have already been purchased and are in full working order, however I do not currently have the funds required to complete the final piece of the jigsaw - the Roland GX-24 Vinyl Cutter (pictured at the top of this page).

The vinyl cutter is just what I need to make the leap from making average quality t-shirts, to brilliant quality t-shirts the buyers deserve. However the cutter comes with a hefty price above it's head, over 1000 GBP. The t-shirts I am currently making are of an average standard, and come at a low price. With your help I will be able to improve the t-shirts to store quality standards, but also keep the same cost efficient price. TruthTshirts is trying to spread the word to the world at the lowest cost possible, but I can only do it with your help.

With the amount of money I am currently earning from month to month it would be next to impossible to afford a piece of equipment of this caliber. With your help along with people I know in my personal life, I am highly optimistic that the funds for this item are achievable within the next 30 days.

Truth T Shirts is exactly what it says in the title - a T-shirt website that is here to bring the real information to light through informative clothing. High quality, professional designs are being created every day on a wide variety of different subjects, such as aliens, UFOs, Chemtrails and fluoride etc, but if I am going to be taken seriously in the worldwide truth movement, a higher quality piece of equipment is required. If you wish to find out more about what your money would be funding, visit the website:

As you all know, AnonymousFO has been a huge hit in the UFO community. Hopefully you can see the determination and passion I have for spreading the truth to the masses. Which is why I know with the correct tools, time and a little help from my followers, my Truth T Shirts project will be making some waves across the world too.

column2: >Thank you for reading and obviously I am aware that not everybody will be able to contribute towards this project - so to those people I am asking you to spread the word about Truth T Shirts. Tell friends and family, post on Twitter/Facebook, anything you do will be of great appreciation. No donation is too small, so with your help let's attempt to make the world a more transparent and lie-free place!
>
>
>
>
>

column2: >

column1: Inspired by the natural beauty of The Netherlands, Lumbr specializes in designing and producing some of the most innovative products out of the finest woods. We’ve been crafting and perfecting the art of handmade wooden watches for some time, and now we’re incredibly proud to present the Troy watch.

column2: >
column5:
>

Why call it the Troy watch? Theo, co-owner of Lumbr, was inspired by the myth of Troy and set out to create a wooden product with a twist. Our wood-based watch features an unexpected look inside
column6: it’s the first wooden watch on Kickstarter to possess a fully visible mechanical skeleton with automatic movement.
column7: >
column8:
>

From the ship to your wrist, both Troy’s case and strap are made entirely of beautiful, solid Oak or Walnut shipwood. It’s bound to make a statement without causing any discomfort. While the wooden, modern design of the Troy watch will make waves with its style, it still remains hypoallergenic so that anyone can rock it.
column10:
>

Not only is the Troy watch beautiful, it’s also practical. The modern wood design of our premium timepiece can tough it out through rain, splashing and accidental submergence (it’s ok to become so attached to your Troy watch that you forget to take it off before jumping in the shower).
column12:
>

Our simplistic wooden design, combined with our modern specs, make this watch truly captivating. Its superluminous dials ensure you’re styled and timely, rain or shine and day or night.
column14:
>

The Troy watch is as durable as it is dynamic. Both the front and back of the watch are made with Sapphire glass, the second hardest material in the world behind diamonds. The use of this manufactured crystal makes your watch hard to scratch and built to last.
column16:
>

The only things that all of our watches will have in common will be the high-end Japanese Miyota mechanical calibre, stainless steel butterfly clasp and the one-year international warranty. Delicately and individually handcrafted, each Troy watch has its own unique grain and pattern so that no two are exactly alike.

column1: We are using CrowdOx as our pledge manager software. It let's us send surveys to verify backer orders.
Question: Why can't i select my options when i order a watch on IndieGogo?

It is easier for us to keep track of our customers wishes and shipping details in a central system like CrowdOx. Once you select and purchase a perk on our IndieGogo campaign, you will receive an invitation from CrowdOx within 24 hours. With that invitation you can manage your pledge: you can select the options you want for your watch (wood type, movement color) and maintain your shipping address. You can even change your options and shipping address during the campaign by clicking the same invitation in your e-mail.
column9:
>

That’s us, Theo and Bart. We’re two real Dutchmen with a passion for bold, practical and stylish design, and we make up Lumbr. The idea for Lumbr originated in the summer of 2013 when we invented the Beatblok, a wireless wooden speaker.

We started selling our handcrafted wooden products, and apparently the Netherlands had been waiting for this crossover between authentic craftsmanship and contemporary design for quite some time. We acquired fans throughout the entire country, and just like that, Lumbr was off to a brilliant start! In the meantime, both our collection and our team have expanded. We’ve gained fame outside the Dutch borders, as well, while our passion has stayed the same: create beautiful wooden products with a sturdy look, bold design and an honest price. So, thank you all for your support, and thanks for climbing aboard!
column10:
>

 We want to say thank you for checking out our project and for helping us make Troy a success.

A stretch goal lies just beyond the horizon, and we know you can help us get there, so share your hearts out, and we’ll continue to do our part!

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or buy a watch, if you love the project as much as we do, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!
column11: >
column12: >

It takes 2000 litres of water to grow enough cotton for 1 pair of boxer briefs. That's about 50 bathtubs of water that needs to be transported to the cotton fields to grow the material used for every pair of cotton boxer briefs.

Cotton Irrigation

Modern cotton fields are also loaded with harmful chemicals, like defoliants
column2:
a chemical used to kill leaves from the plants before harvesting so machines can pluck the cotton more easily. Cotton farms use 2.4% of the worlds farmland, but 11% of pesticides sold.

Cotton Farm (Arizona)

Other fabric sources, like Beech or Eucalyptus trees, grow too slow or consume too much water. But bamboo is different.

Bamboo is the fastest growing plant on the planet, up to 3 feet a day (0.00003 km/h). And it's very resilient
column3: it typically doesn't need irrigation water, pesticides, or fertilizer. And it grows in a wide variety of climates around the world.

column1:
Bamboo viscose is a fabric derived from bamboo. It's a strong fiber made from bamboo plant matter that will decompose in the right conditions. The fabric keeps its colors and won't fade, is popular with fashion designers as it's extremely soft and breathable, but is also requires less color dye than other fabrics.

Often compared with silk or cashmere for being so soft, bamboo viscose fibers have less tiny barbs than cotton, making the fabric super soft and cozy. Despite this, the fabric is strong and durable. If cared for properly, it will last twice as long as cotton. 

It's also very breathable. Bamboo viscose allows much more air circulation than cotton, which helps keep your twig and berries feel fresh. This breathability has the added benefit of allowing evaporated moisture to be quickly circulated away, reducing odor from humid-loving bacteria.

We found Bamboo viscose to be so unbelievably comfortable that when we first tried them, we quickly forget we were even wearing them. It quickly occurred to us that it was the perfect fabric for underwear. 

Despite its softness, bamboo viscose fibers are very durable. Our fabric isn't sheer and prone to underwear disintegration. It is thin enough to not be noticed, but thick enough to provide support, withstand the most demanding activities, and last twice as long as cotton.

 

Buddha Boxers started after searching for comfortable, ecologically sustainable underwear that was well priced. When we couldn't find any, we set out to make our own. We spoke to numerous fashion designers to come up with the right fit and product design. We wanted something priced well so our cause for sustainability could go further.

We set up the Buddha Boxers Prototype Test Club (BBPTC) to solicit feedback from discerning customers, men of every shape and size who care about comfortable underwear. We gathered feedback about everything related to underwear and were able to put together super comfortable undies that fit right.

After getting the sustainable and comfortable part of our mission down, we felt our cost to manufacture was too high. In order to bring it down, we knew we had to simplify product features without compromising on comfort or functionality. Relying heavily on feedback from our BBPTC, we were able to target and remove or refine non-essential features and keep our unit costs lower:

Though we removed unessential features, we did add two vertical ridges along each leg to reduce crease build-up and minimize ride-up. 

 

Ever run out of clean undies while in the middle of a trip? Been on a long flight with multiple connections without a chance to change? Because Buddha Boxers are so breathable, they can keep you feeling fresh for multiple days by keeping air flowing and restricting oder-causing bacteria buildup. 

This makes Buddha Boxers perfect for those who travel with strict weight requirements by allowing you to pack fewer, but longer-lasting underwear.

 

We gone through many underwear iterations and are constantly looking for ways to improve our product offerings.

Though we've been selling our boxer trunks for nearly a year, we've made some significant changes to our offerings for this Kickstarter:
• Standardized sizing and improved fit to our boxer trunks. Previous trunks were available in medium-large, now they are available in medium or large.
• Previously boxer trunks only available in black, now available in black, grey, blue, and green.
• We've added boxer briefs to our product line up!

Every guy has different tastes, we're offering two kinds of underwear: boxer trunks, and our new boxer briefs.

Boxer trunks are underwear with leg length between briefs (no legs), and boxer briefs (longer legs). Boxer trunks are popular with guys who want something less form-fitting than briefs. 

For those who prefer a longer leg sleeve, we have boxer briefs. Boxer brief's longer legs reduce ride-up.

Boxer Briefs

 

We wanted our sustainable undies to be affordable. To do that, we knew we'd need to be ruthless in driving costs down. Selling online means that we don't pay for retail space, and avoid the expensive problem of maintaining inventories in multiple locations.

Our packaging is simple, made from 100% recycled material, is recyclable/compostable, and is designed to fit into mailboxes. We don't use expensive packaging that you would see in a retail store that has the additional costs of using premium cardboard, colors, and graphic designers. 

We were also aggressive in deciding what features to cut out of Buddha Boxers. We used the BBPTC to continually steer our product design to focus only on the essentials that make underwear great.

Through the extensive feedback we've gotten, we found a few ways to keep costs down without compromising function or comfort:
• We avoided using any tags. Tags not only have the potential to cause irritation, they cost a bit extra to be sewn onto underwear
• Though stylish, we found that most guys didn't use their flys. We removed them entirely
• Lots of factories will include their logo in underwear waistbands for larger orders. But we instead asked for a lower unit price by not having any branding on our waistbands at all

Buddha Boxers are form-fitting, designed to be comfortably snug and provide support for your loved ones. Both the boxer trunks and boxer briefs will be available in the above five sizes. If you fit somewhere inbetween sizes, we suggest getting the larger size. Get the smaller size if you prefer a more compact fit.

To measure your waist, run a tape measure around your waist. Place one finger between ​your waist ​and the tape measure​ for a comfortable fit. You can also use the first number on your ​jean​ size as reference.

 

We're excited to announce that Buddha Boxers trunks and boxer briefs is available in four colors!
column2: >One Shade Of Grey
column3: >Wild Blue Yonders
column4: >Dark Black
column5:
>Jungle Green

 

If your underwear doesn't fit well, or is defective, we’ll ship you another size of your choice free of charge. For multi-pack returns, we'll replace 2 undies, and will replace any additional unopened individual packages returned to us. We'll pay for return shipping on all returns from US and Canada.

For international customers, extra shipping charges may apply, but let us know if anything is wrong and we'll take care of you!

I have professional experience in brand management, so I have always had a profound passion for marketing and strategy from a global perspective and understand the importance of creating consumer first brands and products. As a Nigerian woman that was born in Paris, France and raised in Vienna, Austria, Lagos, Nigeria, Kuwait city, Kuwait and Texas in the United States, my collective experiences have shaped my creative passions. I desire to offer people a taste of various cultures through connecting distinct cultural designs that create comfortable and quality loungewear items designed to be worn at home.

PJGB’s founder is a nomad that has lived in various countries around the world as a 3rd culture kid, and has been on the journey to be comfortable in her own skin. PJGB is just that. Comfort in your own skin. PJGB is an acronym for the word Pajamagbada, which is one of the brands signature creations. The word is a combination between Pajama + Agbada, merging two distinct items of clothing together to create a new wave. Pajama is defined as a loose usually two-piece lightweight suit designed especially for sleeping or lounging, and Agbada a traditional item of clothing from the Yoruba ethnic group in Nigeria meaning a loose-fitting robe. This specific style represents the beauty of the Yoruba culture, and the beauty of being comfortable in your own skin/home which is generally what the brand represents. Most items in this collection will feature a similar cultural connection, but all pieces will ultimately represent comfort. Consumers of this brand enjoy lounging round the house, watching a great show and entertaining family or friends, while feeling luxurious, relaxed and comfortable at the same time. PJGB strives to give customers the comfort and flexibility to find personal peace through loungewear that is made just for you.
As I embark on the product development phase, I am thankful for the community around me that is able to support my journey.

I am seeking $10,000 in order to develop this brand from the ground up, work with the right partners and ensure I am to launch quality items. In order to properly develop an apparel brand, there a are few key steps that are required to proceed, and all of these steps require capital:
• Fabric sourcing- I will need to work with various fabric mills and sourcing partners to find the best fabrics for my designs

• Pattern making- In sewing and fashion design, a pattern is the template from which the parts of a garment are traced onto fabric before being cut out and assembled. This will allow us to create the blueprint the final items, and there is a $200-$600 cost for each individual pattern made, and I will need 7-10 patterns created. Costs vary depending on the intricacy of the design

• Product samples and prototype - once I have the patterns made I will be able to get samples made in my desired fabric. There is is a $200-$600 cost for each individual pattern made, and I will need 7-10 samples created. Costs vary depending on the intricacy of the design
• Grading Process- needed to build out the different sizes of the designs prior to production . Costs vary
This contribution will allow me to work with the best partners to develop my designs and create the best samples.
• Taking the right steps in the product development stage are critical and ensuring the best final product
• As a brand manager I am trained in working closely with teams to ensure all elements tie back to the brand guidelines and consumer first insights from the research conducted
There are always potential risks and obstacles I may face on the way to achieving my goal.

• That is why it is important for me to pay attention to detail to ensure that all items not only look nice, but are also functional. Working with the right partners will be the first step in reducing any risks in the functionality of designs
• While I am not an expert in all aspects of the product development phase, I plan to work very closely with all external partners to ensure visibility and collaboration at all steps
Not able to contribute to this campaign? No problem! Here are some ways you can help
• Please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
• Please be on the lookout for any brand updates, and support once we launch!

Short Summary

Hello potential funders!

My name is Peter Yeung and I'm a journalist based in London with a background in anthropology and a penchant for doing things that will cause me pain, stress, and occasionally regret. That's why I've signed up to run the inaugural Hackney Half Marathon. But there's no chance that I'll be regretting this decision, since I'm running to raise funds for Radar, a brilliant communication rights organisation run by a team of passionate journalists and development professionals.

Radar train and mentor networks of citizen reporters from some of the world’s most marginalised communities, and empower them to bring their perspectives into the public dialogue. In other words, communities are enabled to speak for themselves.

They do this by structuring reporting around one of the most affordable communication tools available – basic mobile phones. Just when you thought you couldn't love your battered Nokia 3310 any more... But funding is needed to keep their operation going.

The Impact
column6:
schema=vimeo"" width=""580"">

Although Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights protects the right of every individual or community to speak and be heard, in practice, access to communication tools and the ability to influence the media agenda are often governed by a strict social and cultural hierarchy. 


Radar aims to challenge stereotypes in the press, and open up the flow of critical news and democratise access to the media, giving more people a chance to engage in meaningful dialogue.

column1: In practice, a news alert sent via SMS from a village in India can be received in London, analysed and verified by our expert team, and shared online with influential audiences within minutes.

Work from Radar reporters has appeared in the Guardian, New Internationalist and The Ecologist, along with contributions to the BBC World Service and international television features. The issues they have highlighted have been picked up by the EU election observation teams, leading advocacy organisations and policy networks.

Some of you may be genuinely impoverish souls, and I understand that. But it would still be great if you spread word of Radar to friends, family, and people you meet. While if you shared this on any form of social media, I would be infinitely grateful.
Find more on their website: http://www.onourradar.org/

column6: >Frozen Rain in 95% Silk / 5% Spandex. Print made from a picture of a frozen tree on a cold winter morning. Lining is made out of 95% silk / 5% spandex.
column10:
Stitches is a contemporary luxury womenswear line created by a doctor who found her passion from a very young age. We registered our company in 2010 but spent the first year and a half compiling the best team, studying the market, understanding our clients and testing accessories and techniques to make our products well tailored and impeccable. The company quickly found its aesthetic in nature and launched its first collection in 2012 (SS13). Ever since then we have attained success through our daily struggles to remain relevant. Early 2013 we opened our own little factor in Bucharest where all our garments are handmade and shipped across the globe. 


Our signature Frozen Rain Print: We are proud but humbled by this print. It was made using a picture taken of a frozen tree on a winter morning. 100% silk.


We are a print based brand as we use a lot of custom made prints. Our prints are mainly inspired by nature as you will find. We looooooove the use of insects, frozen trees, snow, precious stones, e.t.c. Give us anything nature and we will convert it into beautiful prints!

We pride ourselves in the use of luxury textiles. Our textile print supplier is a digital printing company in the UK who has a lot of years in experience working with high end and established designers. Though this results in our products being expensive we have sacrified price for quality. For us its not about a competitive price but a COMPETITIVE QUALITY.
column11:
>

Leaf bug print in 100% silk. Print made from a photo of an insect, THE LEAF BUG.



ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN

""Your purchase from our SS14 collection would take us to the next step"".

We are collaborating with Indiegogo to help raise funds to propel our brand further. We are ready! We would like to have a presentation at Paris Fashion Week. We would also like to hire a showroom / sales representative who would supply our garments to boutiques and multi brand retailers worldwide! 

Unfortunately, you need money to make money. Hence our campaign!

column1: Frozen Rain in 95% Silk / 5% Spandex. Print made from a picture of a frozen tree on a cold winter morning. Lining is made out of 95% silk / 5% spandex. Black organza overlay 100% silk.ABOUT USGeeks & Stitches is a contemporary luxury womenswear line created by a doctor who found her passion from a very young age. We registered our company in 2010 but spent the first year and a half compiling the best team, studying the market, understanding our clients and testing accessories and techniques to make our products well tailored and impeccable. The company quickly found its aesthetic in nature and launched its first collection in 2012 (SS13). Ever since then we have attained success through our daily struggles to remain relevant. Early 2013 we opened our own little factor in Bucharest where all our garments are handmade and shipped across the globe. Our signature Frozen Rain Print: We are proud but humbled by this print. It was made using a picture taken of a frozen tree on a winter morning. 100% silk.We are a print based brand as we use a lot of custom made prints. Our prints are mainly inspired by nature as you will find. We looooooove the use of insects, frozen trees, snow, precious stones, e.t.c. Give us anything nature and we will convert it into beautiful prints!We pride ourselves in the use of luxury textiles. Our textile print supplier is a digital printing company in the UK who has a lot of years in experience working with high end and established designers. Though this results in our products being expensive we have sacrified price for quality. For us its not about a competitive price but a COMPETITIVE QUALITY.Leaf bug print in 100% silk. Print made from a photo of an insect, THE LEAF BUG.ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN""Your purchase from our SS14 collection would take us to the next step"".We are collaborating with Indiegogo to help raise funds to propel our brand further. We are ready! We would like to have a presentation at Paris Fashion Week. We would also like to hire a showroom / sales representative who would supply our garments to boutiques and multi brand retailers worldwide! Unfortunately, you need money to make money. Hence our campaign!Bomber jackets with Leaf Bug and Praying Mantis print. Both - 100% silk shell. Lining is made out of 30% silk / 70% cotton.WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GETWe need at least €50,000 for the following

Personal presentation during Paris Fashion Week. We'll use about 34% of the funds raised. For the presentation we would invite editors and fashion influencers who will cover our collection on-line, on social media and in magazines. Presentations at Paris Fashion Week can really help propel any brand. If you manage to create enough buzz you might get a lot of wholesale orders during and after the presentation.

We would also like to hire a showroom sales representative who would supply our garments to boutiques and multi brand retailers worldwide and all year round! Another 40% from the funds raised would go here. The best ones in Paris and Milan go for about €20,000 a year but you are guaranteed very good returns.
We would also like to invest in textiles and accessories and this would consume over 20% of funds raised from here.

For perks we offer our exciting Spring Summer 2014 collection at up to 50% discount. That's almost the wholesale price! If you purchase these items from our website you would be paying the full retail price.WHO IS TALKING ABOUT USSS14 campaignOur first office! We miss it. Moved out to a bigger space in August. That wall art was everything. Took 8 hours to installOur lovely ladybug prints. All - 100% silk.                One of the prints from our first collection SS14. Print was made using                                                                     pictures of the popular Californian hot creek.CHOOSE FROM OUR LIST OF PERKS BELOWSILK SCARVES FOR PERKSThese are printed silk scarves, Nature inspired prints. Would come with our brand name and label. New with tags. Pick your choice. 50 x 70 cm. €55 each.  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not contribute we totally understand. Other ways you can help us can be to get the word out there for us. MAKE SOME NOISE FOR OUR CAMPAIGN PLEASE!
Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. Use the Indiegogo share tool.

At the end of the campaign we would compile all sizes ordered and produce accordingly. 3. What happens to my order at the end of the campaign: Once we receive payment (which could take 2 weeks after the end of the campaign) we would a). compile all orders and then order the necessary prints. Once we receive the fabrics back we start b). producing your garments at our studio. As soon as each garment is ready c). we quality check them to make sure there are no problems. Then we d). ship them to you.   4. Where do you get your fabrics from: Our fabrics supplier and digital printing factory is located in the U.K. They are known for their high quality. 5. When would you ship: Delivery would start at the beginning of April 2014 so you have your garments in time for summer! Dispatch could be earlier. We will notify you if there are any changes. 6. Shipping rates: Please see above table. 7. Do you sell in any boutiques: Yes you can find Geeks & Stitches stocked at boutiques in Dubai, London, Lebanon. We plan to increase our stockists before the end of 2014. 8. Where can I purchase Geeks & Stitches after the campaign ends: On our website http://www.shop.geeksandstitches.com 9. Will you accept exchanges: Yes you can exchange for another size or item. All exchanges should be made within 7 days of receipt of items. 10. Help us use 3D printing to make the world a safer place.
Firearm and ammunition sales have skyrocketed in the USA. Accidental shooting and firearm theft are poised to become even bigger problems.
We want to tackle this problem by conducting an Innovation Challenge that will allow inventors and designers to submit 3D printable product ideas that improve gun safety.
We need your help to fund this important endeavor. No money, no mission.
Share our story by visiting 3Dlt.com/innovate

3D Printing allows people to manufacture three dimensional objects, on demand, from designs they create using computer aided design (CAD) software. The benefits of 3D printing are being applied to many industries including heathcare, aerospace, automotive, among many others. Theindustry has evolved to the point where consumers are now buying 3D printed “copies” online and at retail stores.

3Dlt.com is a 3D template marketplace. Like a stock photo site, we’ve created a marketplace where professional designers, students, companies, and other organizations can sell their designs online. Our powerful search algorithm makes it easy for consumers to find the things they’re interested in. In addition to file download we also offer printing services, online and at retail.

More than just a design marketplace, 3Dlt.com is a fast track to innovation. We think our platform and 3D printing can play a role in solving some of the world's big problems. For our first initiative we plan to launch an Innovation Challenge using 3D printing to improve gun safety.
WE ARE NOT TAKING A STANCE ON GUN OWNERSHIP.
Somewhere between 70 and 80 million Americans own a total of 270-300 million guns. Since the FBI began mandating background checks for firearms purchases in 1993, 165 million have been conducted.

column4: usg=AFQjCNH0y7GRNB52cT8NODPWr_MtZbI2FA"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">took the lives of 31,076 people. 73,505 Americans were treated in hospital emergency departments for non-fatal gunshot wounds. Guns were used in 11,078 homicides and 19,302 suicides. Gun-related accidents killed 606 people. More than 75% of guns used in suicide attempts and unintentional injuries of 0-19 year-olds were stored in the residence of the victim, a relative, or a friend.

column1: Beyond injury and death, firearm theft creates even more problems. It has been estimated that over 500,000 firearms are stolen in the USA each year. An increase in gun ownership
column4: usg=AFQjCNEH8_TR_fjyv_3NwLanq7LkEkU4eQ"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">could lead to an increase in burglary - especially as stolen guns are easy to sell quickly and at good prices.

column1: For a number of reasons, including recent events, fear and talk of stricter control, gun sales are at an all-time high. In 2002 the FBI processed 8.5 million background checks. In 2012? 16.5 million. Black Friday 2012 was the busiest single day ever, with over 150,000 checks conducted.

While most of the economy has struggled, the firearms industry has flourished. Since 2008, profits are up over 100% at two of the biggest firms, and employment in the sector is up 30%. With the demand, many outlets have sold out of popular models and prices have gone up, driving even more demand. Ammunition sales are also brisk. Winchester’s ammunition sales for instance, have gone up 33% since 2007. In fact, many retailers and eCommerce websites cannot keep popular calibers and brands in-stock.

Then there’s concealed carry. Since the mid-1980’s 49 states have enacted some kind of legislation solidifying their citizen’s rights to carry a concealed firearm in public either without a permit or after obtaining one. Nationally, the NSSF estimates there are 6.8 million concealed-carry holders today. This is up from about one million in the mid-1980s.

More people (including untrained newbies) are buying guns and they are purchasing and stockpiling more ammunition than they otherwise might. Since they are unable to find ammunition in their local store, they are ordering it online and having it shipped to them (via UPS, FedEx, and other commercial carriers.) This has the potential to alert others to the presence of a gun or create a liability as deliveries can be left without a signature. Beyond that, a growing percentage of the population is legally permitted to carry loaded firearms in public. We believe that together, these things have the potential to exacerbate the gun safety issue...soon.

Innovations in firearm safety have the potential to save thousands of lives each and every year. Whether you support 2nd Amendment rights or think tougher gun legislation is the answer, we can all agree that gun safety is vitally important. More guns and ammo in the hands of more untrained users could lead to more crime, injury and death.
For many reasons product innovation in firearm safety has stifled.
The Innovation Challenge will focus on using 3D printing to develop new products that improve firearm safety.

What types of firearm safety products could be 3D printed? Gun locks, safety accessories, and ammunition storage all seem like opportunities. Following are two examples of gun safety products that could potentially have a 3D printed component.
Please note we are not promoting the use of 3D printing to produce guns or gun enhancements.

The concept of 3D printed firearms is getting lots of press coverage and exposure right now. The eventual availability of 3D printed guns creates an ever greater need for improved gun safety. While some see 3D printing as a problem, we think it can also be part of the solution. All entries in our challenge will be vetted and only those with potential to improve safety will be accepted.

We’re promoting a 3D design-first philosophy. 3D printing provides on demand manufacturing, anywhere in the world. It's also a fast track to product innovation. Projects created for 3D printing are generally ready for mass production, when and where it makes sense.

We’ll use the money from this crowdfunding campaign to fund a competition among designers to submit designs for 3D printable products that promote firearm safety. We’ll offer different categories (with different sponsors, and have an overall champion). Voting will be split 50/50 between our panel of experts (TBD) and the general public. Vote early and often for your favorite designer.
We’ll operate the Innovation Challenge in a completely transparent manner. Winners will pay out as follows:

The remaining 50% will be used to market and operate the Innovation Challenge. At the conclusion of the event an expense summary will be published to our website. Any remaining funds will be applied towards a future Innovation Challenge.

The scalability of the Innovation Challenge will allow us to fulfill our commitment to our investors regardless of whether we raise $100 or $100,000. But the more you invest, the more we can pay our winners. Your dollars drive innovation. As the payout gets bigger the quantity and quality of submissions will likely increase.
Designs from the Innovation Challenge will be featured and sold on 3Dlt.com. But more importantly, it's our chance to make the world a better place, one problem at a time.
What’s in it for You as an Investor?
Get cool stuff, foster innovation, and potentially save lives by making the world a safer place.
Our goal is to improve firearm safety through innovative 3D printable products. The Innovation Challenge will operate under these rules:
• Products must have a 3D printed component and not be purely software or web services in origin.
• Contestants must provide the design file (.STL), thumbnail images, and two 3D printed copies of their submission
• Existing products / updates to existing products will be accepted - but must be 3D printable
• Product must not have an existing Kickstarter, Indiegogo or other crowdfunding effort already underway.
• All submissions will be vetted by our team of firearms safety experts.
• Rules are subject to change and qualified submissions are not guaranteed for inclusion.

We’re not asking you to fund 3Dlt.com. We are a for-profit company and will benefit by receiving a license to resell all of the designs that are submitted. All funds received via this crowdfunding initiative will be used to fund this project and an expense review will be posted on our website at the completion of the challenge.
We are asking you to fund innovation in firearm safety.
We’re also asking you to spread the word. Visit 3Dlt.com/innovate to share our plan for a safer world with your social network.

The biggest risk for this project are some of the legal issues that may arise around the Innovation Challenge. We will have to account for this and take proper care to indemnify all parties. Some of the funds raised by this project will be used to cover legal fees associated with this.
The other risk is that no designs are submitted to the Innovation Challenge.

Learn more about 3Dlt.com by visiting our website and learn more about our team members by visiting our Google+ Page
